loans.name: Adut

texts.en: Adut, who lives in Bor, has been selling fish for three years. She is 30 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are in school. Adut heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, and is now requesting her second loan, this one for 1000 SDG, in order to purchase fish. She will use the  resulting extra income to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

Huda is looking to improve her family's life conditions and increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase goods for her store.

loans.name: Santa Rosa Group

texts.es:
Doña Emérita, cuenta con una edad de 48 años, ella reside en una aldea al sur de Honduras, es una persona muy emprendedora siempre sea dedicado a trabajar, ella tiene su negocio de pulpería en el cual vende abarrotería como ser: manteca, arroz, pollo, jabón y embutidos. También se dedica a la venta de comida sus principales clientes son personas que trabajan cerca de ese sector y vecinos.
Doña Emerita esta solicitando un préstamo de 10,000.00 lempiras para invertir en la compra de mortadela, pollo, manteca, jabón, granos básicos y otros productos de consumo, ella cree que con la ayuda de este crédito podrá abastecer mas su negocio y así generar mas ingresos para la superación de su familia.
El sueño de doña Emérita es gozar de buena salud para seguir trabajando en el crecimiento de su negocio.
Doña María Martha y Doña María Luisa también tienen actividad comercial de abarrotaría y son un grupo de señoras muy unidas.   


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo 2012
texts.en:
Eméria, age 48, lives in a village in southern Honduras.  She is a very enterprising person who has always been devoted to working.  She has a general store where she sells groceries like lard, rice, chicken, soap, and sausages.  She also sells meals to her main customers who work close to this area, and she sells meals to her neighbors.

Emerita is requesting a loan for 10,000 lempiras to buy bologna, chicken, soap, basic grains, and other edible products.  She believes that, with the help of this loan, she will be able to stock her business more.  This way she will generate more income in order for her family’s betterment.

Emérita’s dream is to enjoy good health so that she can continue working on the growth of her business.

María Martha and María Luisa also have businesses selling groceries.  They are a group of very united women.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – March 2012

loans.use: to buy bologna, chicken, soap, basic grains, and other edible products for her business.

loans.name: Haneen

texts.en:
Haneen is photographed (she is on the right of the photo) with her daughter.

Haneen is a Palestinian married woman, her husband is employed and gets a salary, but not enough to cover all the family's costs.

For the past two years, Haneen has been making and selling hand-made food to customers. She makes Palestinian traditional foods including different types of salads like Tabboleh and different types of cooked food like Mansaf. She also buys olive oil and resells it to customers upon their request. All of these have been profitable projects.

Haneen is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing a bulk quantity of vegetables, dairy products and olive oil. Taking this loan will provide Haneen with the necessary raw materials to continue in her project and also offer customers the quantities they request. This will increase sales and improve the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase a bulk quantity of vegetables, dairy products and olive oil.

loans.name: Shaher

texts.en:

Shaher is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing variety of goods and groceries that are often requested by customers such as rice, milk, sugar and cooking oil. This will increase sales and improve the family's income.

Shaher is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to increase the variety of goods sold in his store.

loans.name: Zaruhi

Zaruhi has applied for this loan to develop the farm. With the requested amount she plans to purchase rabbits and renovate the barn. This loan will help Zaruhi to get more income from agriculture, which will help her to ensure financial stability for her family.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina sells fruit and vegetables at a covered market in Belaya Tserkov, central Ukraine. She currently has a vending location in a huge outdoor market where hundreds of vendors sell all sorts of different items. 

Valentina started her business about nine years ago. She has an entrepreneurial mind and has worked hard to develop her business. Recently Valentina enlarged her vending kiosk. Now Valentina is requesting a loan of 20,000 Ukrainian Grivnas to purchase additional merchandise for her vending kiosk. 

With a varied inventory, she will be able to increase her sales and continue working to make a better life for her and her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Letty Andrea

texts.es:
Letty ha trabajado fuertemente desde hace varios años con el ánimo de posicionar su negocio en la región y poder tener una buena fuente de ingresos. Letty trabajó durante 2 años aproximadamente en un almacén de ropa y vendiendo mercancía, y desde hace 4 años aproximadamente, aprovechando la experiencia adquirida, decidió montar su propio negocio de venta de prendas de vestir donde ofrece una gran variedad de productos. Gracias a su buena atención y a la calidad de sus productos ha logrado posicionarlo y ser un referente en su municipio. Ahora, Letty busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a desarrollar la página web de su negocio.

Letty espera que de esta manera su negocio aumente sus ventas considerablemente, pues ya podrá tener presencia en la web y hacer mayor presencia frente a sus clientes. Además, Letty espera que su negocio siga creciendo y pueda cumplir su sueño de brindarle a su familia una buena calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Letty has worked hard for a long time to get her business established in the area and to have a good source of income. She worked for approximately two years in a clothing store and selling merchandise. About four years ago, taking advantage of the experience she had acquired, she decided to open her own business selling clothing. Her business offers a wide variety of products. Thanks to her good service and the quality of her products, she has been able to firmly establish her business. She has become a leader in the area. Currently, Letty is hoping that a loan will offer her the opportunity to develop her business' web page.
Letty hopes that this will increase her sales considerably. This will give her a presence on the internet and make her more accessible to her customers. Letty also hopes that her business will continue to grow, and that she can achieve her dream of offering her family a good quality of life.

loans.use: to develop her business' web page

loans.name: Asmaa

texts.en:
Asmaa is a conservative person so she is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet. The man  in the photo is Asmaa's husband. Asmaa is a 38-year-old married woman from Hay Nazal, Jordan. She weaves handmade baskets and she is requesting a loan of 1000 JD to purchase materials needed for doing her weaving.

Asmaa is looking to improve her business and increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for weaving

loans.name: Muna

texts.en:
Muna is a conservative person so she is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet. The man in the photo is her son.

Muna is a 48-year-old married woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan and a mother of 4 children. Muna has  a home-based beauty salon and she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase cosmetics for trading purposes.

Muna is looking to establish a salon outside of her house so that she can increase her customer base and improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics for business purposes

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 38 years old and married with four children. All of her children are still in school. Helen lives in Kator and has been running a food stall for the past three years. Helen heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this will be her first loan from BRAC. 

Helen is requesting a 500 SDG loan to purchase tomatoes and onions. She will use the extra income from her loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and onions

loans.name: Dedeha

texts.en:
Dedeha lives in Kator. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for three years. She is thirty years old, married, and has four children; all of them are still in school. 

Dedeha heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her fourth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2,000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Sokhorn

texts.en:
Sokhorn is thirty years old and her husband, Ratha is twenty-nine years old (they are pictured with their son). They have been married since 2005 and have two young sons. The family lives in a village approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sokhorn sells grocery items at home, while her husband is a motor remoque taxi driver. A motor remoque is a motorbike connected with a trailer at the back. 

Sokhorn is asking for a loan of $1,500 to expand her grocery inventory by buying more grocery items for resale.

loans.use: To expand her grocery inventory by buying more grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea (in the photo) is thirty-three years old and his wife Phalla is thirty-six. They live in a village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 2002 and have two children: one son and one daughter. One attends school and another one is still young.

Chea is a construction worker, while his wife is a garment worker. He currently lives with his grandmother because he does not have his own house. Hence, he is requesting his first loan of $700 to build a house to live in.

loans.use: To build his own house to live in.

loans.name: Vannak

texts.en:
Vannak (in the photo) is twenty-five years old and his wife, Voleak, is twenty-three years old. They live in a village about fifteen kilometers form Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 2009 and have two young sons.

Vannak is a security guard, while his wife is a cobbler in a shoe factory. Vannak is requesting his first loan of $1,200 to buy a motorbike to get work. He will also use a part of the loan to build a restroom for family use.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to get work and build a restroom for family use.

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Sophea (in the photo), age twenty, is single. She lives with her mother in a village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Sophea sells cosmetics. She wants to expand her business by buying more cosmetics for resale. That’s why she is asking for her first loan of an amount of $1,000.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Sam Nang

texts.en:
Sam Nang (pictured here) is twenty-three years old and his wife, Srey Non, is twenty-five years old. They live in suburb of Phnom Penh about 25 kilometers from the city. They have been married since 2008 and have one young daughter.  

Sam Nang is a construction contractor, while his wife is a garment worker. He is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to buy additional construction materials for his construction business.

loans.use: To buy additional construction materials.

loans.name: Jose Constantino

texts.es:
Jose se encuentra casado y tiene 3 hijos de 10, 15 y 17 años de edad, a quienes siempre les ha querido ofrecer una buena educación. Jose trabaja transportando en su carro a muchos campesinos desde sus veredas hasta el casco urbano de su municipio, y de esta manera genera los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar. Con este trabajo siempre ha generado los ingresos necesarios para su hogar, y siempre le ha ido muy bien con su carro, sin embargo, en la actualidad el motor de su carro se encuentra averiado, por lo que busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la reparación del motor de su vehículo y seguir trabajando para generar los ingresos en su hogar.

Jose de esta manera podrá seguir generando los ingresos y su familia podrá tener todas las necesidades satisfechas. Además, Jose espera que su negocio crezca y pueda cumplir el sueño de brindarles a sus 3 hijos la posibilidad de acceder a una educación universitaria.
texts.en:
Jose is married with three children ages 10, 15 and 17. He has always wanted to offer his children a good education. Jose's job involves transporting many people from their rural homes to the urban centre of his municipality. This is how he generates the income necessary for sustaining his household. This work has always provided him with enough income for his family, and things have always gone well with his vehicle. However, the motor is now broken down; he is hoping that a loan will allow him to repair it and keep working to bring in an income for his family.
Through this loan, Jose will be able to keep generating an income and his family's needs will be satisfied. Jose also hopes that his business will grow, and that he can achieve his dream of offering his three children the opportunity of getting a university education.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle's motor.

loans.name: Khun

texts.en:
Khun (in the photo) is fifty-one years old and her husband Chhen is fifty-eight years old. They live in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1985 and have one son and three daughters. One is married and lives outside the family home, two are garment workers and another one is still young.    

Khun is a rice farmer, while her husband is a house construction constructor and assists his wife in the farming business when he is free. Khun is requesting her first loan for an amount of $200 to connect her house to the private electricity utility service. Because her family currently does not have electricity, they use batteries. 

In the photo you see Khun at home, not on her farm.

loans.use: To connect her house to the electricity utility service.

loans.name: Ratha

texts.en:
Ratha (in the photo) sells groceries at home, while her husband, San, is a security guard. They have been married since 2009 and have one young daughter. They live in a village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Ratha is requesting a loan for the amount of $1,500 to purchase a motorcycle for her brother to get work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her brother to get work.

loans.name: Makol

texts.en:
Makol (in the photo) is twenty-four years old and his wife Channa is also twenty-four. They live in a suburb about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married for one year and have no children yet. 

Makol and his wife are garment workers. He is applying for his first loan of an amount of $1,500 to purchase a motorcycle to get to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to get to work.

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en:
Samnang is thirty years old and his wife, Savy, is thirty-two. They are pictured together. They live in a village about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and have two sons. One attends school and another one is still young. 

The family has three lines of business (1) Producing rice wine, (2) Raising pigs and (3) Selling grocery items. Samnang is asking for his first loan for an amount of $500 to purchase additional grocery items to sell.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Siek

texts.en:
Siek (pictured above) is forty-nine years old and her husband, Sak, is fifty. They live in a village in a suburb of Phnom Penh City and they have seven sons and three daughters. Three are married and live separately, two are garment workers, four attend school and another one is still young. 

Siek stays at home. The main source of income is from her husband and children’s salary. Her husband is a construction worker. Siek is applying for her first loan in the amount of $300 to buy a motorbike for her children to get to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her children to get to work.

loans.name: Sinoeun

texts.en:
Sinoeun (in the photo) is thirty-five years old and her husband, Sorith, is thirty-three. They live in a village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1995 and have three daughters. Two attend school and another one is still young.  

Sinoeun provides manicures and pedicures for people in her village. Her husband is a Tuk Tuk taxi driver. Sinoeun is asking for her first Kiva loan of an amount of $1,000 to buy a new Tuk Tuk for her husband because his old one is broken, is not fuel-efficient, and cannot be repaired easily.

loans.use: To purchase a new Tuk Tuk for her husband.

loans.name: Andres Felipe

texts.es:
Andres es una persona muy trabajadora que ha desarrollado una gran habilidad para la elaboración de artículos en arte country, generando así un negocio con el que genera sus propios ingresos y contribuye económicamente para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Andres desde muy temprana edad comenzó a mirar como elaboraban estos productos y se fue interesando por esta labor, y posteriormente hizo un curso de elaboración de productos en arte country y así surgió su negocio. Actualmente Andres elabora una gran cantidad de productos los cuales ofrece en su municipio y diferentes regiones, y gracias a la buena calidad de estos ha tenido la oportunidad de crecer en ventas rápidamente. Dada la gran demanda del mercado por sus productos, Andres busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de materias primas que requiere para la elaboración de sus productos en arte country.

Andres espera que de esta manera su negocio siga creciendo y sus ventas sigan aumentando, para que así pueda seguir generando ingresos en su hogar y cumpla el sueño de tener a sus padres viviendo en su casa propia y con una buena estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Andres is a very hard-working person who has developed a great ability for making “arte country”.  (a style of decorative art from wood).   This is how he is generating a business with which he generates his own income and contributes financially to support his household.

At a very early age Andres started to look at how to make these products.  He was getting interested in this work.  Later, he took a course on making arte country.  That is how his business emerged.

Andres now makes a great quantity of produces that he sells in his municipality and different regions.  Thanks to the good quality of his work, he has had the opportunity for his sales to grow rapidly.  

Given the great demand in the market for his products, Andres is looking for a loan so that he can buy raw materials that he needs to make his arte country.

Andres hopes that this way his business will continue to grow, and that his sales will then increase.  This  way he will be able to continue generating income for his household.  He will also fulfill his dream of having his parents living in their own house and being financially stable.

loans.use: to buy raw materials that he needs to make his "arte country".

loans.name: Hernan De Jesus

texts.es:
Hernan se encuentra casado y tiene 2 hijos a quienes siempre les ha querido ofrecer todo lo que necesitan. Siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajador y esto le ha permitido superar grandes adversidades en la vida. Desde hace aproximadamente 30 años vende prendas de vestir, negocio con el cual genera los ingresos para su hogar y del cual depende toda su familia. Inició su negocio vendiendo puerta a puerta, y posteriormente se contactó con algunos clientes y así pudo tener un punto fijo de atención; actualmente su negocio sigue funcionando muy bien y sigue siendo la fuente de ingresos para su hogar. Con la finalidad de seguir ofreciendo los productos a sus clientes, Hernan busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de prendas de vestir para ofrecer a sus clientes.

De esta manera su negocio tendrá gran variedad de productos para ofrecer y sus clientes se seguirán interesando en el negocio. Además, espera que con sus ingresos pueda seguir teniendo una buena calidad de vida y una buena estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Hernan is married with two children. He has always desired to provide for his children's every need. Hernan has always been very hard-working; this has allowed him to overcome great adversity in life. For about 30 years, he has sold clothing. This business allows him to generate an income upon which his entire family depends. He started his business selling door to door; he soon got to know some clients and developed a fixed customer base. His business is functioning very well at the moment, and it continues to be the sole source of income for his family. With the goal of continuing to offer products to his customers, Hernan is hoping that a loan will allow him to buy garments to sell.
This way, his business will have a large variety of products to sell, and his customers will maintain their interest in his business. Furthermore, Hernan hopes that his income will continue providing him with a good quality of life and good economic stability.

loans.use: to buy clothing items for sale.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesus se encuentra casado y tiene 2 hijos quienes son su motivación para trabajar diariamente. Anteriormente, Jesus vendía frutas y verduras en un carrito por las calles de su municipio, sin embargo, desde hace 2 años entre el y su esposa decidieron montar una tienda general donde ofrecen toda clase de productos de la canasta familiar. La principal razón para el cambio del negocio es el deterioro de la salud de Jesus vendiendo los productos en la calle. Debido al poco capital con el que fue montado el negocio, no se encuentra mucho surtido de productos en su tienda, es por esto que Jesus busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de productos de la canasta familiar y así ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos.

De esta manera su negocio podrá ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos y ser más atractivo para sus clientes. Además, con mayores ingresos Jesus podrá ofrecerle a su esposa y sus 2 hijos una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas.
texts.en:
Jesus is married with two children; they are his motivation to work every day. Jesus used to sell fruits and vegetables with a trolley which he would steer through the streets of his municipality. However, he and his wife decided to open a general store two years ago. There, they sell all sorts of basic household food items. The main reason for the business change was Jesus' deteriorating health from selling on the street. Because they only had a small amount of capital to launch the business, it is not very well-stocked. For this reason, Jesus is hoping that a loan will provide him with the opportunity to buy more household food items so that he can offer a wider variety of products.
This way, his business will have a greater variety of household food products and therefore be more attractive to customers. Furthermore, with the accompanying increase in income Jesus will be able to offer his wife and two children a better quality of life and better economic opportunities.

loans.use: to buy basic food items in order to have a greater variety.

loans.name: Eamsengchea

texts.en:
Eamsengchea (pictured with her young daughter) is thirty-one years old and her husband, Samnang, is thirty-four. They have been married since 2002 and have two children, one son and one daughter. One is in school and another one is still young. The family lives in a village approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Eamsengchea and her husband are fishermen and grow rice when rice farming season comes. 

She is asking for her first loan of an amount of $1,000 to fill in the land behind her house because there are some ponds there which need to be filled in. She will also use a part of the loan to build a fence around her house.

loans.use: To fill in the land behind her house and build a fence around her house.

loans.name: Khom

texts.en:
Khom (in the photo), age thirty-nine, is divorced. He lives with his elderly mother in a village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Khom is a policeman. He is applying for his first loan of $1,300 to buy a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Kimnhan

texts.en:
Kimnhan (in the photo), age forty-one, is a teacher. His wife, age forty-one, sells porridge and typical Khmer desserts in the school where her husband teaches. They live in a village about 12 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and they have three sons who are in school. 

One of Kimnhan’s sons is in his second year at the Economic University in Phnom Penh. Kimnhan is asking for a loan of $1,500 to pay school fees and buy a motorbike for his son to drive to school.

loans.use: To pay school fees and buy a motorbike for his son to drive to school.

loans.name: Chamnan

texts.en:
Chamnan (in the photo), age thirty-one, is a lathe operator. His wife Sila, age twenty-nine, stays at home. They have been married since 2005 and have two daughters. One is in school and another one is still young. They live in a village about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.   

Chamnan is requesting his first loan for an amount of $1,000 to repair the house where he lives by making new walls.

loans.use: To repair the house where he lives by making new walls.

loans.name: Sipho

texts.en:
Sipho (in the photo), age fifty-two, is a widow with one son who has full-time employment. She lives in a village about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sipho is a garment worker. She is applying for her first loan of an amount of $1,500 to buy a motorcycle for her son to get to and from work. Currently, Sipho’s son works in Phnom Penh, however because his home is quite far from the city he needs to stay with his uncle after work. With a motorbike which he will buy with money from the loan, he will be able to come back home every evening to help support his mother at home.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her son to get to work.

loans.name: La Estrella Group

texts.es:
Doña Carmenza es una persona muy trabajadora  y  dedicada  a su negocio, ella vive  con  su  esposo y sus 3 hijos. Su  negocio lo tiene  desde hace más de 5 años.
Doña Carmenza su negocio es la venta de  golosinas  en  su  casa de habitación ya  que  es zona turística ella tiene bastante demanda de sus comidas.
Doña Carmenza el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de carnes, pollo, aceites, quesillo y condimentos con estas compras poder  incrementar  sus  ventas. Con el préstamo espera satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y a si tener mejores ingresos y tener mejores  condiciones  de vida.
Doña Carmenza sus metas y sueños es de poder hacer una glorieta  y así  tener  mas cómodos a sus clientes para que esto le genere mejores ingresos y poder  darle  a sus  hijos  una  mejor  educación.
Maribel es una  joven  muy emprendedora  su  actividad  es  la  venta  de  ropa usada. Y lo hace desde  hace 8 años 
Delia es una  señora muy trabajadora su  actividad  es  la venta  de  golosinas. Y lo hace  desde hace  más  8  años 
Surit su negocio es  la  venta  de  ropa  usada   desde  hace mas  de 4 años.

Choluteca, Honduras - Marzo 2012
texts.en:
Doña Carmenza is a very hard-working person who is very dedicated to her business. She lives with her husband and three children. For over five years, Carmenza has had a business selling snacks from her home; her home is located in a tourist area and she has a lot of demand for her food.
With this loan, Carmenza will invest in the purchase of meat, chicken, oil, cheese, and condiments. With these purchases, she will be able to increase her sales. She hopes that this loan will allow her to cover her customers' demand and to have a better income and, therefore, better living conditions.
Carmenza's goals and dreams include being able to build an arbour so that her customers will be more comfortable. This will generate more income, with which she will be able to provide her children with a better education.
Maribel is a very enterprising young woman. She has sold used clothing for 8 years.
Delia is a very hard-working woman who has sold candy for over 8 years.
Surit has sold used clothing for over 4 years.

Choluteca, Honduras - March 2012

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, oil, and condiments for her business.

loans.name: Kunthea

texts.en:
Kunthea and her husband Tha are fishermen. She is applying for her first loan of an amount of $1,000 to buy additional fishing materials. 

The couple has been married since 2003 and they have two daughters. One is in school and another one is still young. They live in a village some kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

In the photo you can see Kunthea and her husband.

loans.use: To buy additional fishing materials.

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Savoeun (in the photo) is a garment worker and her husband, Channareth, is a construction worker. They have been married since 2007 and they just have one young son. The family lives in a village about fifteen Kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Savoeun is requesting her first loan for an amount of $1,000 buy a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.name: Buntoeun

texts.en:
Buntoeun (pictured here) is fifty years old and her husband, Chhin, is also fifty. They have been married since 1984 and have five children who are attending school. The family lives in a village approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Buntoeun is a manicurist. She paints and cleans finger and toe nails. Her husband is a construction worker. She is asking for her first loan of $1,500 to buy a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.name: Prong

texts.en:
Prong, pictured here with her loom, is a 39-year-old scarf weaver.  Prong also buys some scarf and silk fabric from the fellow weavers in her village and transports them to sell in other provinces. Prong's husband, Sovan, is a 54-year-old construction worker.  

Prong and her husband live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1996 and have two children who are in school.  

Prong is asking for her first loan in the amount of $300 to renovate the house where she lives.

loans.use: to renovate the house where she lives.

loans.name: Seur

texts.en:
Seur (in the photo), age thirty-three, sells grocery items at home and grows rice when rice farming season comes. Her husband, Phorn, age thirty-two, is a construction worker. Seur is applying for her first loan for an amount of $300 to expand her grocery store by buying more grocery items for resale.  

They live in a village near the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and they have four children, three sons and one daughter. One attends school and other three are still young.

loans.use: To expand her grocery store by buying more grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Havas

texts.ru: Хавас честная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она замужем и любящая мать четверых детей. Более 14 лет Хавас занимается купле- продажей скота. На полученную прибыль от данного бизнеса она женила своего сына, а также купила 300 шт. абрикосовых деревьев. В бизнесе помогает муж и дети. С 2002 года  Хавас является  клиентам «ИМОН Интернешнл» и имеет хорошую кредитную историю. Хавас хотела бы получить займ для покупки скота с целью увлечения поголовья скота.
texts.en:
Havas is married and a loving mother of four children. She's honest, hard-working and, for the last 14 years, has run a business focused on buying and selling cattle. This business has enabled her to not only to pay for her sons wedding, but to purchase 300 apricot trees as well. Her husband and son assist her in running the business. 
Havas has been a client of "IMON International" since 2002, and boasts a good credit history. She's asking for a loan in order to purchase some cattle and increase the size of her herd.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Jose Alirio

texts.es:
Jose se una persona muy trabajadora que con el ánimo de ofrecer a su familia la mejor calidad de vida posible tiene diferentes fuentes de ingresos para su hogar. Jose trabaja esporádicamente sacando materiales del río que cruza por su región, y además de esto tiene un galpón de pollos y una cochera de cerdos en la parte trasera de su casa, con lo que genera ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Gracias a los buenos productos que ofrece ha podido tener muy buenos clientes que le garantizan muy buenos niveles de ventas. Con el ánimo de seguir ofreciendo buenos productos y poder responder a todos los pedidos de sus clientes, Jose busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la realizar adecuaciones locativas a su galpón de pollos y su cochera de cerdos para que pueda mantener una mayor capacidad en estas.

De esta manera Jose podrá tener una mayor capacidad de producción y así atender a todas las necesidades de sus clientes que actualmente superan su capacidad de producción. Además, con mayores ingresos su familia gozará de una mejor calidad de vida y mayor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
José is a very hardworking person with the intention of giving his family the best quality of life possible.  He has different sources of income for his household.  José works sporadically extracting materials from the river that runs through his region.  In addition to this he has a chicken shed and a pig shed behind his house with which he generates income to support his household.  Thanks to the good products he offers he has been able to have very good customers who guarantee him very good sales levels.

With the intention of continuing to offer good products and being able to respond to all the requests from his customers, José is looking for a loan to give him to opportunity to make adaptations to his chicken shed and pig shed so he can keep a greater number of animals.

In this way José will be able to have a greater capacity for production and attend to all the needs of his customers, which currently exceed his capacity.  In addition, with greater income his family will enjoy a better quality of life and greater economic stability.

loans.use: to adapt his chicken and pig sheds to have greater capacity.

loans.name: Wejdan

texts.en:
Wejdan is a 35-year-old single lady from Baqa'a, Jordan. She has  a beauty salon and she is looking expand her business, thus she is requesting a loan of 1000 JD to to purchase accessories and cosmetic products for her business.

Wejdan started her business years ago through selling accessories and cosmetics from her house then she opened a beauty salon with her sister. She is looking to improve her family's living conditions and increase their living standard.

loans.use: to purchase accessories and cosmetic products for business purposes

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao is 38 years old and lives with his 42-year-old wife, Ruos, in the suburb of Phnom Penh.  They have been married since 1993 and have two young children, a son and a daughter.

Mao is a construction worker and his wife is a cleaner for a factory. He is applying for his first loan of $800 to buy a motorbike to get to work.

Currently, Mao commutes to work by asking his neighbors for a ride. With a motorbike, he will have his own transportation and will no longer need to ask his neighbors for a ride to work.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to get to work.

loans.name: Zain

texts.en:
Zain is a 44-year-old married woman from Baqa'a, Jordan and a mother of 3 children. She has an exeptional talent in decorating with flowers. She learned that from her neighbor so she was able to set up her own business that insures her a modest income.

Zain is looking to expand her business, thus she is requesting a loan of 1100 JD to to purchase equipment needed for decorating with flowers. An aspiration of Zain's is to educate her children and provide them with a better life.

loans.use: to purchase equipment needed for decorating with flowers

loans.name: Salha

texts.en:
Salha is a conservative person so she is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet. The man in the photo is her husband, Ayoub.

Salha is a 37-year-old married woman from Al Russeifeh, Jordan and a mother of 6 children. She is looking to improve her family's living conditions thus she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to do maintenance on her house.

loans.use: to do maintenance on her house

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Abeer is a 30-year-old married woman from Madaba, Jordan and a mother of 2 children.

Abeer is looking to improve her family's living conditions and she is requesting a loan of 400 JD to do maintenance on her house.

loans.use: to do house maintenance

loans.name: Eng

texts.en:
Eng stays at home. The main source of income is from her husband who is a motor remoque taxi driver; a motor remoque is a motorbike with a trailer connected to the back. 

The elderly couple lives live in a village about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and they have three sons, two are married and the third has full-time employment.    

Eng is applying for a loan in the amount of $1,000 to buy a new motorbike for her son to get work because the old one breaks down and uses a lot of gasoline.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike for her son to get work.

loans.name: Djelika

texts.fr:
Djélika est âgée de 50 ans,  mariée et vivant dans une famille monogame elle est mère de 3 enfants et réside avec son mari et ses enfants  dans le quartier  Kôkô de la préfecture de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso). 
Elle a prématurément abandonné les études, ainsi elle a embrassé les activités génératrices de revenus. Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans réussite, elle finit par se   baser  sur l’achat- vente de bois de chauffe il y a 8 ans.  Le bois de chauffe est l’un des éléments essentiel pour les femmes Maliennes  dans la  préparation (cuisine),  raisons pour la quelle Djélika peut vendre 3 chargements de Remorque par mois.  
Dans le souci de remédier aux ruptures de stocks en hivernage, elle décida de continuer à collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Après un premier prêt correctement remboursé elle est à son 2eme prêt. 
Djélika  envisage utiliser ce prêt pour l’achat  5 chargements  de remorques en bois de chauffe dans les villages  environnant  de la ville de Koutiala. Elle effectue sa vente  devant sa porte au quartier Kôkô à une clientèle mixte au comptant. Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice de 125 000FCFA par mois qu’elle utilisera pour le remboursement des taux d’intérêts de Soro, contribuer aux dépenses quotidiennes  de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Djélika is 50 years old. She lives in a monogamous household with her husband and three children in the Kôkô neighbourhood of Koutiala (which is in the Sikasso region). 

Djélika left school early, and so entered into various business activities to generate income. Having tried several business ideas without success, she finally settled on buying and selling firewood, which she has been doing for 8 years. Malian women rely on firewood for food preparation, which means that Djélika can sell three trailer-loads per month. 

Djélika decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso in order to solve her problem of stock shortage during the rainy season. She has already fully repaid her first loan, and this is her second. Djélika is planning to use this loan to purchase five trailer-loads of firewood in the villages surrounding Koutiala. She will then sell this wood from her home in the Kôkô neighbourhood. Her customers include both men and women, and they pay cash. With the loan, she hopes to make 125 000 FCFA per month, which she will use to pay back interest on the loan, contribute to the family's daily expenses and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy firewood.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Mariée  et mère de 5 enfants, Fatoumata est âgée de 44 ans, et vit dans une famille monogame avec son époux et ses enfants dans le quartier koko de la préfecture de Koutiala (région de Sikasso). 
Pour des raisons sociales, Fatoumata n’a pas eu la chance de faire des études, pour cela elle s’est basée sur les activités génératrices de revenus depuis à bas âge. Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans réussite, elle finit par se lancer dans l’achat-vente de bois de chauffe il y a plusieurs ans.  Fatoumata trouve que cette activité lui procure de revenus et que ça marche très bien, puisqu’elle peut vendre un chargement de remorque par semaine. Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle en quantité, augmenter la taille de son activité, elle décida de  faire recours à  l ‘institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a 3 ans. Elle est à son 5eme  prêt individuel dont les précédents ont été correctement remboursés. Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter des chargements de remorque dans un  village environnant  de la ville de Koutiala. Elle effectue sa vente devant sa porte à une clientèle constituée de femmes et d’hommes  au comptant ou à crédit.  Elle compte  réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100.000FCFA par mois qu’elle envisage utiliser pour  le remboursement des intérêts de Soro, participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille et investir le reste dans d’autres activités génératrices de revenus. Elle compte sur les financements  de Soro  Yiriwaso pour l’élargissement de son activité.
texts.en:
Fatoumata is 44 years old, married and the mother of five children. She lives in a monogamous household with her husband and children in the Kôkô neighbourhood of Koutiala (which is in the Sikasso region). 

For social reasons, Fatoumata was unable to attend school and has therefore been earning a living from a young age. Having tried several business ideas without success, she finally settled on buying and selling firewood several years ago.  Fatoumata has found that this business works well and allows her to earn a good income as she is able to sell one trailer-load of wood per week. 

In order to provide enough firewood for her customers and increase the size of her business, she turned to the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution three years ago. This is her fifth individual loan. The previous loans have all been repaid in full. With this loan, she is planning to buy trailer-loads of wood in one of the villages outside Koutiala. She sells the firewood from her home to male and female customers, who either pay cash or buy on credit. She hopes to make 100 000 FCFA on average per month, which she will use to pay back interest on the loan, contribute to the family's daily expenses and invest in other business activities. She is relying on finance from Soro Yiriwaso to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase firewood.

loans.name: Sali

texts.fr:
Née à Garalo,  Madame  Sali  est âgée de 40 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle vit dans une famille polygame   avec sa coépouse, son mari et leurs enfants à Koutiala (Région de Sikasso). 
Pour des raisons sociales, Sali n’a pas eu la chance d’étudier, ce qui justifie son intérêt pour les activités génératrices de revenus à savoir l’achat et vente de tissus, chaussures et autres depuis plusieurs ans.  Sali est très bien sollicitée par ses clients.  
Pour augmenter la taille de son activité et satisfaire sa clientèle, elle a décidé de rejoindre  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il  y a des années. Sali a pris 2 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) tous payés correctement et est à son troisième  prêt individuel.  
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter des stocks de marchandises constitués de dix douzaines de porte feuilles, cinq douzaines de chaussures et un colis d’ustensiles de cuisine. Elle s’approvisionne à Cotonou et effectue sa vente dans la ville de Koutiala à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes, en détail, au comptant et à crédit.  
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150.000FCFA, qu’elle utilisera pour le remboursement de son échéance, participer aux charges quotidiennes de sa famille et poursuivre son activité avec le reste.
texts.en:
Sali was born in Garalo. She is 40 years old, married and the mother of five children. She lives in a polygamous household with her co-spouse, husband and children in Koutiala (which is in the Sikasso region). 

For social reasons, Sali was unable to attend school, which is why she has been involved in various business schemes for several years. These include buying and selling cloth, shoes and other goods. Sali is much sought-after by her customers. 

A few years ago, Sali decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to increase the size of her business and satisfy her customers. Sali has taken out 2 solidarity loans (group loans), which were both reimbursed correctly. This is her third loan, which she is taking out as an individual. With this loan, she plans to build up her stock and buy ten dozen wallets, five dozen pairs of shoes and a pack of cooking utensils. She buys her stock at Cotonou and sells her products in Koutiala. Her customers include both men and women, who either pay cash or buy on credit. Sali hopes to make 150 000 FCFA monthly, which she will use to repay the loan, contribute to households expenses and fund her business.

loans.use: to buy various products.

loans.name: Rula

texts.en:
Rula is a conservative person so she is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet. The man in the photo is her husband.

Rula is a 30-year-old married woman from Al Salt, Al Balqa, Jordan and a mother of one child. She is looking to improve her family's living conditions thus she is requesting a loan of 700 JD to do maintenance on her house.

loans.use: to do maintenance on her house

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal is a 41-year-old married woman from Al Aqaba, Jordan and a mother of 5 children.

Manal is looking to improve her family's living conditions thus she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to do maintenance on her house.

loans.use: to do maintenance on her house and renew her furniture

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a conservative person so she is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet. The man in the photo is her husband.

Hanan is a 33-year-old married woman from Al Naseer, Amman, Jordan and a mother of 4 children. She is looking to improve her living conditions thus she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to do maintenance on her house.

loans.use: to do maintenance on her house

loans.name: Sokhors

texts.en:
Sokhors (pictured here) is 30 years old. She and her husband Sophat, who is 39 years old, have been married since 2001. They have two daughters: one is in school and another one is still young. The family lives in a village approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sokhors is a tailor, while her husband is a driver. She is asking for a loan of 1,500 USD to replace her husband's motorbike because the old one breaks down and uses more gasoline.

loans.use: To get a new motorbike for her husband.

loans.name: Samphors

texts.en:
Samphors (in the photo) is 28 years old. She and her husband Pheaktra, who is also 28 years old, live in a village about 35 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have one son who is in school. 

Samphors is a garment worker, while her husband is a construction worker. She is asking for her first loan in the amount of 600 USD to fill in the land behind her house. There are some ponds behind her house, so she needs to fill them in.

loans.use: To fill in the ponds behind her house.

loans.name: Laidou Group

texts.fr:
Laïdou est un groupe  constitué de  femmes mariées ayant en moyenne 25 ans, 4 enfants et vivant  dans des familles traditionnelles à MASSABLACOURA, un des quartiers de la ville de Bougouni (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur deuxième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de céréales à travers  AMINATA, de la  vente de friperie et du jardinage.
AMINATA , la seule assise  sur la photo,  compte acheter avec son  prêt,  800 kilos  de riz paddy. Elle s’approvisionne auprès des paysans producteurs des villages voisins. Elle effectue sa vente à domicile et au marché à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes, en détail, au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000.FCFA par mois dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
Laïdou is a group made up of married women. They are 25 years old on average, and have an average of four children each. They all live in traditional families at Massablacoura, a neighbourhood of Bougouni (which is in the 3rd administrative region of Mali). 

This is their second group loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, and was requested to allow them to better meet the needs of their customers. This group of women are involved in various business acitivities, such as trading cereals, selling second-hand clothing and gardening.

Aminata, who is sitting down in the photo, is planning to buy 800 kilos of paddy rice with her loan. She buys her supplies from producers in surrounding villages. She sells her stock from home and at the market to male and female customers, who either pay cash or buy on credit. 

She hopes to earn 30 000 CFA francs on average per month, part of which will be used to help her husband with daily expenses and part of which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase cereals.

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
DJIGUISSEME est constitué de 5 femmes mariées ayant en moyenne 47 ans, 6 enfants et vivant  dans des familles traditionnelles à MASSABLACOURA, un des quartiers de la ville de Bougouni (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur septième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de pâte d’arachide à travers KADIATOU  , de la  vente de condiments et du savon.
KADIATOU, la seule assise du groupe sur la photo,  compte acheter avec son  prêt,  20 sacs d’arachide .Elle s’approvisionne auprès des paysans producteurs des villages voisins. Elle effectue sa vente à domicile et au marché à une clientèle mixte, en détail, au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000.FCFA par mois dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en: Djiguisseme Group consists of five married women who average 47 years in age and six children.  They live in traditional families in Massablacoura, one of the neighborhoods of Bougouni (the third largest administrative region in Mali). In order to satisfy customer demand, they are on their seventh loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance organization. This group of women are in the business of peanut paste.  Kadiatou, the only one sitting in the photo, plans to use her loan to buy 20 bags of peanuts.  She sources from farmers in neighboring villages. She sells from home and at the market to a mix of customers, for cash and credit.  She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 30,000 FCFA, a part of which will be used to support her husband with daily expenses and the other part will be invested in her business.

loans.use: to buy peanuts.

loans.name: Chhantha

texts.en:
Chhantha (pictured here) is 51 years old and lives in a village about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh City. She is a widow with two sons and two daughters. One is a waiter, another one is a security guard, and two have full-time employment. 

Chhantha is requesting her first loan in the amount of $1,500 to purchase a motorcycle for her son, who is a waiter, to use for commuting.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her son to use for commuting.

loans.name: Alia

texts.en:
Alia is a conservative woman so she is unwilling to upload her photo on internet. The photo is of her husband.

Alia is a 47-year-old married woman from Sahab, Jordan and a mother of 5 children. She is looking to improve her son's educational level, so she is requesting a loan of 800 JDs.

loans.use: to cover educational costs

loans.name: Khawla

texts.en:
Khawla is a conservative woman so she is unwilling to upload her photo on the internet. The photo is of her husband.

Khawla is a 41-year-old married woman, a mother of 3 children. And she lives in Al Russeifeh, Jordan. She took out a loan of 500 JDs to buy some things to improve the living conditions in her house.

loans.use: to improve the living conditions in her house

loans.name: Muntaha

texts.en:
Muntaha is a conservative woman, so she is unwilling to upload her photo on internet. The photo is of her husband.

Muntaha is a 39-year-old married woman. She is a mother of 6 children. She is living in Al Russeifeh, Jordan.

Muntaha has taken out a loan of 800 JDs. She is looking to fix up and renew her house.

loans.use: to improve living conditions in her house

loans.name: Farah

texts.en:
Farah is a young Palestinian man. He is married and a father of four children. For the past four years, Farah has been making and selling wooden crafts which are handmade from olive wood.  It has been a profitable project, but not enough to cover all the costs.

Farah is requesting a 2,500 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing bulk raw materials necessary to make crafts, such as olive wood and a collection of paints. This will increase sales and improve the family's income.

Farah is pictured making crafts from olive wood.

loans.use: to purchase olive wood in bulk and a collection of paints.

loans.name: Bunny

texts.en:
Bunny (in the photo), age 56, is a widow with one son who is a security guard. She lives in a village about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Bunny sells second-hand clothes and cosmetics. She is applying for her first loan of 1,000 USD to expand her business by buying more clothes and cosmetics for resale.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Saret

texts.en:
Saret is 33 years old and sells fish; her husband, Binsean, is 35 years old and a construction worker. They live in a village about twenty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh and have three sons, two are attending school and the third is not yet of school age.

Saret is asking for her first loan in the amount of $500 to buy a water pumping machine which will assist in her parents' rice farming business.

loans.use: to assist in her parents’ farming business by buying a water pumping machine.

loans.name: Ayau

texts.en:
Ayau lives in Bor. She sells food at a food stall, and has been in business for one year. She is 26 year old, married, and has four children, two of whom are still in school. 

Ayau heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase sugar and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and sugar

loans.name: Yar

texts.en:
Yar lives in Bor. She sells food at a food stall, and has been in business for two years. She is 28 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are still in school. 

Yar heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1,200 SDG in order to purchase sugar and maize flour. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and maize flour

loans.name: Atong

texts.en:
Atong lives in Bor. She sells food at a food stall, and has been in business for two years. She is 36 years old, married, and has four children, two of whom are still in school. 

Atong heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1,200 SDG in order to purchase beans and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and onions

loans.name: Yom

texts.en:
Yom lives in Bor. She sells food in a food stall, and has been in business for four years. She is 30 years old, married, and has three children; two of them are still in school. 

Yom heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her forth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2,000 Sudanese pounds (SDG) in order to purchase sugar and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Shler's Group

texts.en:
Shler is a 39-year-old Iraqi woman, married, and a mother of six children. 

Learning to sew at a young age, Shler has 27 years of experience behind the sewing machine and has been successfully meeting the requests of her customers, working from home while also taking care of her household and family.

In the past Shler successfully applied for, received, and repaid a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq, which she used to purchase a small generator allowing her to work even during the hours of the day the city's power was out.  She also bought some fabric and tools for her work.

With the previous loan she was able to make improvements benefiting her customers, and with a new loan Shler will concentrate more on making some improvements she can also benefit from.  She would like to renew her work area, making the conditions of her work more pleasant.

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor, thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients, and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: to renew her sewing work area.

loans.name: Zain

texts.en:
Zain is a conservative woman so she is unwilling to upload her photo on the internet. The photo is of her brother.

Zain is a 21-year-old single woman who lives in Al Salt, Jordan. She has taken out a 600 JD loan. She needs to buy raw materials to make milk products.

Because she's under 30 years old, her loan is considered as a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy  raw materials to make milk products

loans.name: Dara

texts.en:
Dara is 24 years old and single.  He lives with his parents, sisters and brothers in a village approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Dara is a motor remoque taxi driver. A motor remoque is a motorbike with a trailer connected at the back. He is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike for his family to use for commuting. 

Photo: Dara with a motorbike he uses to operate a motor remoque taxi driver business.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for his family to use for commuting.

loans.name: Vann

texts.en:
Vann is 43 years old and single. She lives with her nephew in a village across Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.
Vann is a teacher and when she is not teaching, she grows rice, tomatoes, beans and sesame with her nephew's assistance. She is applying for her first loan in the amount of $300 to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticides to maintain her farm.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticides to maintain her farm.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is 40 years old. She is a mother of 4 children and she lives in Al Zarqa, Jordan.

Nadia is looking to take out a loan of 500 JDs in order to expand her clothing sales.

loans.use: to buy and sell clothes

loans.name: Amenah

texts.en:
Amenah is a conservative woman, so she is unwilling to upload her photo on the internet. The photo is of her husband.

Amenah is 50 years old, and she lives in Al Russeifeh, Jordan. She is a mother of 4 children.

Amenah is looking to take out a loan of 500 JDs so she can fix her house paint.

loans.use: to fix her house paint.

loans.name: Kimnang

texts.en:
Kimnang is 40 years old and her husband, Ponlork, is 42 years old.  They have been married for almost ten years and have one daughter who assists her parents in their business. The family lives in a village about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Kimnang is a wedding planning decorator and rents out traditional Khmer clothes for weddings. Her husband is a cameraman who takes wedding pictures alongside his wife.

Cambodian people prefer to rent wedding planning decorations and traditional clothes for the wedding party.  Kimnang is asking for her first loan of $700 to purchase an additional camera for her husband.

loans.use: to purchase an additional camera for her husband.

loans.name: Fakhriddin

texts.ru: Фахридин целеустремленный и добрый человек, ему 35 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет троих детей. Взрослому 6 лет, среднему 4 года, а младшему 2 годика. Его жена занимается домохозяйством и присматривает за детьми. Более 6 лет она занимается купле- продажей пластиковых окон и дверей. Его точка бизнеса находится на рынке стройматериалов. Его бизнес хорошо налажен и имеет много постоянных клиентов. Раньше он занимался мастерством. Фахридин запрашивает займ для покупки пластиковых материалов.
texts.en:
Fakhriddin is a thirty-five year old married man. He's kind, focused and has three children: their ages are six, four and two. His wife takes care of their household and looks after the kids.
Over six years ago, Fakhriddin started a business focused on buying and selling plastic doors and windows. His runs it from a site at the market for construction materials. His business is well run and he has many regular clients. Prior to starting his business, he made a living as a craftsman. 
Fakhriddin is asking for a loan in order to purchase some plastic building materials.

loans.use: To buy plastic material.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 10 pagnes (traditional colorful fabric), 10 ready-to-wear outfits for children and tops for girls and women.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina se dedica a la actividad de la confección desde hace ya bastante tiempo. Con este trabajo, genera ingresos con los cuales contribuye económicamente para el sostenimiento del hogar donde convive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. La actividad la aprendió desde muy temprana edad y gracias al conocimiento adquirido su taller de confección se reconoce por la buena calidad de sus productos. Debido a que el mercado le ha estado demandando más productos de los que su capacidad de producción tiene para ofrecer, Luz Marina busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de una máquina fileteadora para generar un empleo en su taller.

Luz Marina espera aumentar su capacidad de producción hasta el punto en poder satisfacer toda la demanda que tienen por sus productos y poder seguir creciendo cada vez más. Además, espera que con mayores ingresos sus 2 hijos y su esposo tengan la posibilidad de acceder a una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas.
texts.en:
Luz Marina has worked in sewing for a long time now.  With this job she generates income with which she contributes economically to the support of her home, where she lives with her husband and two children.  She learned this work from a very young age and, thanks to the knowledge she acquired, her sewing shop is recognized for the good quality of her products.

Because the market has been requesting more products than her production capacity has to offer, Luz Marina is looking for a loan that will give her the opportunity to buy a serger to generate a job in her shop.  Luz Marina hopes to increase her production capacity to the point of being able to satisfy all the demand for her products and to be able to continue growing more all the time.

In addition, she hopes that with greater income her two children and her husband will have the possibility of having a better quality of life and more economic opportunities.

loans.use: to buy a serger to generate a job in her shop.

loans.name: Soaphalyneth

texts.en:
Soaphalyneth (pictured) is 23 years old. She and her husband, Heng (24 years old), live in a village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They were married in 2011 and have one little son.

Soaphalyneth stays at home and takes care of her son. Her husband has full-time employment and his salary is their main source of income. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy a new motorbike for her husband to get to work.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for her husband to get to work.

loans.name: Mariam's Group

texts.en:
Mariam is 44 years old, an Iraqi mother of three children.

Six years ago, Mariam started to work from home, using her sewing skills to help with the family finances, and bring in some additional income.

Previously, Mariam has successfully applied for, received and repaid a loan taken from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq, which she used to improve her work area and purchase an iron.

Now, Mariam has taken a new loan to further enhance her sewing and tailoring work. She would like to buy a new sewing machine and a small generator, as well as some fabric and raw materials.

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and a small generator, as well as some fabric and raw materials.

loans.name: Martha Elena

texts.es:
Martha es una madre soltera cabeza de familia de su hijo de 6 años, a quien su padre abandonó desde hace un tiempo sin generar alguna contribución económica, por esto Martha ha venido trabajando fuertemente en su negocio con el ánimo de generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de sus gastos. Martha trabaja desde hace aproximadamente 2 años en la actividad de la confección, la cual aprendió de trascendencia familiar y con esto ha podido crear un gran negocio. Martha fabrica billeteras y las ofrece en toda la región y esto le ha permitido tener un gran número de clientes. Debido a que la demanda del mercado es superior a la capacidad de producción de su taller, Martha busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de una máquina plana para generar un empleo en su taller y aumentar su capacidad de producción.

Martha de esta manera podrá tener un taller que responda a todos los pedidos de sus clientes y así poder seguir creciendo en su taller de modo que pueda seguir generando empleo para las personas más necesitadas. Además, Martha espera que su negocio le cumpla el sueño de poder ofrecerle a su hijo una educación de calidad y en un futuro brindarle educación universitaria y una estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Martha is the head of household and the single mother of a 6-year-old child whose father left without providing any financial support. So Martha has been working very hard in hopes of generating the income they need to meet their expenses. Martha has been a tailor for two years, a trade she learned from her family, and has built a great business making wallets. She sells them throughout the area and has acquired a large number of customers. As demand exceeds her production capacity, Martha is seeking a loan to enable her to buy another industrial sewing machine for her workshop so that she can add an employee and increase her production.

In this way, Martha would be able to fill all her customers' orders and continue expanding and generating employment for those who most need it. Martha also hopes that through her business she will achieve her dream to give her child a good education now, a university education in the future, and financial stability.

loans.use: to buy another industrial sewing machine for her workshop so that she can add an employee and increase production.

loans.name: Sandra Milena

texts.es:
Sandra es una madre cabeza de familia de 2 hijos de 4 y 10 años de edad, quienes son su motivación para trabajar fuertemente en su negocio. Debido a la falta de ingresos, Sandra decidió montar un negocio con el cual pudiese generar los ingresos que requiere para poder ofrecerles a sus 2 hijos una buena calidad de vida y una educación. Fue así como montó su negocio de fabricación de accesorios para dama, donde produce aretas, manillas, anillos, collares, hebillas, llaveros, entre otros. De esta manera ha podido tener un negocio que le ha brindado lo necesario y en el cual ha trabajado fuertemente para poder sacar sus 2 hijos adelante.  Gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos, Sandra ha tenido muy buenos pedidos de sus clientes, y es por esto que busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de materias primas para la producción de sus accesorios para dama.

De esta manera podrá seguir aumentando sus ventas y seguir creciendo en su negocio. Además, Sandra espera que su negocio le brinde los ingresos para que sus 2 hijos puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida, el acceso a una educación de mejor calidad y una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Sandra is the head of the family with 2 children, ages 4 and 10, who are her motivation to work hard at her business. Sandra decided to start her business so she could generate the income needed to offer her children an improved quality of life and an education. She started a business making and selling accessories for women, like earrings, bracelets, rings, necklaces, belt buckles, key chains and others. Doing this, she’s been able to have a business that offers her what she needs and in which she has worked very hard to be able to get her family ahead. Thanks to the quality of her products, Sandra has received many orders from her clients and that’s why she is requesting a loan in order to buy basic materials for the production of her accessories for women.

This way she will continue increasing sales and growing her business. Also, Sandra hopes her business brings her the income needed to provide her children with an improved quality of life, access to a good education and economic stability.

loans.use: buy basic materials for the production of her accessories for women.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
El señor Leonardo, tiene 44 años de edad, esta casado y vive con sus 5 hijos y su esposa en el municipio de Langue, en el sur  de Honduras.
Don Leonardo se dedica a la venta de granos básicos y abarrotería en general como maíz, arroz, frijoles, manteca, café, margarina, sal, azúcar, harina, huevos, maseca, refrescos, entre otra gran variedad de productos. 
Don Leonardo esta solicitando su crédito de 20,000.00 lempiras para la compra de maíz, arroz, frijoles, manteca, café, margarina, sal, azúcar, harina, huevos, maseca, refrescos y otra mercadería para abastecer su negocio de esta manera lograr mayores ganancias y acaparar mas clientes para que su negocio se fortalezca.
Los planes de Don Leonardo son preparar a su negocio y convertirlo en mercadito para lograr que sus hijos sigan estudiando y mejorar sus vidas.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo 2012
texts.en:
Leonardo, 44, is married and lives with his five children and his wife in the municipality of Langue in south Honduras.

Leonardo works selling basic staple items and groceries in general like corn, rice, beans, lard, coffee, margarine, salt, sugar, flour, eggs, Maseca [brand of cornmeal] and soft-drinks among quite a large variety of products.

Leonardo is asking for a 20,000 lempira loan to buy corn, rice, beans, lard, coffee, margarine, salt, sugar, flour, eggs, Maseca, soft-drinks and other merchandise to stock his store thus attaining higher profits and winning over more customers so that his business will flourish.

Leonardo’s plan is to prepare his store to turn it into a minimarket so that he can see that his children continue with their schooling and to improve their lives.

San Lorenzo, Honduras-March, 2012

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock his store.

loans.name: Barra Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Barra est constitué de 4 femmes mariées ayant en moyenne 32 ans, 4 enfants et vivant  dans des familles traditionnelles à MASSABLACOURA, un des quartiers de la ville de Bougouni (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur septième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de condiments à travers  KADIATOU, de la  vente de condiments et des céréales.
KADIATOU , la seule assise sur la photo,  compte acheter avec son  prêt,  5 cartons de condiments de diverses sortes. Elle s’approvisionne au marche de Bougouni. Elle effectue sa vente à domicile et au marché à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes, en détail, au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000.FCFA par mois dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en: The Barra group consists of four married women with an average age of 42 and four children. They live in traditional families in Massablacoura, one of the neighborhoods in the city of Bougouni (the third largest administrative region in Mali).  To satisfy the needs of their customers, they are on their seventh collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso, a microfinance organization.  This group of women are in the business of condiments (via Kadiatou) and cereals.  Kadiatou, the only one sitting in the photo, plans to use her loan to buy five boxes of different condiments.  She sources at the Bougouni market.  She resells from home and at the market to a clientele of women and men, for cash and credit.  She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 30,000 FCFA, a part of which will be used to help her husband with daily expenses. The other part will be invested in her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Madame Fatoumata est une femme mariée de 31ans et mère d’un enfant. Elle vit avec son mari et son enfant dans le quartier Médine de Bougouni. Madame Fatoumata est une enseignante de formation. Parallèlement à cette activité, Fatoumata mène des activités de commerce général avec l’achat vente, de pagnes, chaussures et draps de lit. Elle a appris cette activité auprès d’une de ses amies du quartier.
Avec une expérience de plus de 6 ans; elle maitrise cette activité. Dans le cadre de l’élargissement de ses activités, elle décida de prendre un prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter, 10 complets d’habits pour femme, 2 pièces de pagnes uni-wax et 10 paires de chaussures pour femme. Elle s’approvisionne au Burkina Faso. Ses articles sont vendus à la maison et dans les différents quartiers de Bougouni de façon ambulante et à une clientèle mixte.
Elle compte réaliser  avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 35 000 FCFA. 
Avec ce bénéfice elle envisage agrandir son entreprise.
texts.en:
Fatoumata is 31 years old, married, and mother of one child. She lives with her husband and child in the Médine district of Bougouni. Fatoumata is a teacher by training. Along with teaching, Fatoumata is involved in general trading activities such as the buying and selling of pagnes (colorful African wax cloth), shoes, and bed sheets. She learned this business from one of her friends from her neighborhood.

With over six years of experience, she is an expert in this business. Trying to grow her business, she decided to take out a loan with Soro Yiriwaso to buy 10 complete sets of women's clothing, 2 Uniwax pagnes, and 10 pairs of women's shoes. She stocks up in Burkina Faso. She sells her items from home and from place to place in the different neighborhoods of Bougouni to a mixed group of customers.

With this loan, she plans to earn a monthly profit of 35,000 FCFA. She plans to use these profits to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy pagnes (colorful African wax cloth), sheets, shoes

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
La señora petrona de 44 años, tiene 4 hijos es casada y vive en su propia casa ubicada en una aldea de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras.
Doña Petrona su negocio es la venta de mariscos como ser pescado, camarones, verduras y sal. Ella solicita el préstamo para compra de arena, cemento y grava ya que su casa esta un poco deteriorada por la parte de atrás y con el préstamo desea mejorar su condición de vida ya que su casa es uno de sus patrimonios más importantes para ella y su familia.
El negocio de Doña Petrona es vender en su carro con la ayuda de su esposo los productos en los lugares de Nacaome, y sus alrededores, el impacto de este préstamo es muy grande para ella ya que su casa le da el abrigo a ella y su familia
Doña Petrona sueña que su negocio le de ingresos para hacer su casa mas grande y bonita para que su familia la disfrute.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2012
texts.en:
Petrona, 44, is married and has 4 children. She lives in her own house located in the village of San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras.
Petrona sells seafood, like fish, shrimp, vegetables and salt. She is requesting this loan to buy sand, cement and gravel because the back part of her house is a little deteriorated; she will use the loan to improve her quality of life as the house is one of the most important assets her family has.  
Petrona’s business has her selling her products from her car, with the help of her husband, in places like Nacaome and its surroundings. This loan will have a great impact on her life as her house is her family’s shelter. 
Petrona dreams that her business provides her with enough income to make her house bigger and more beautiful so her family can enjoy it.
San Lorenzo, Honduras – March 2012

loans.use: buy sand, cement and gravel to repair her house.

loans.name: Aura Rosa

texts.es:
Aura es una persona que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajadora, y gracias a esta cualidad su negocio ha sido muy reconocido por la buena calidad de los productos que ofrece. Aura se dedica desde hace aproximadamente 15 años a la confección de pijamas y ropa interior, negocio con el cual ha contribuido económicamente al sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar. Gracias a la buena atención que ofrece Aura a sus clientes, ha tenido la oportunidad de captar un gran número de clientes, lo que a su vez le ha garantizado unas grandes ventas en su negocio. Dado que su negocio fue montado con muy bajo capital, Aura se ha esforzado bastante con el fin de sacarlo adelante, y esto le ha permitido sentirse orgullosa por tener hoy en día un gran negocio de confección.
