Con la finalidad de comprar algunas materias primas y realizar algunos mantenimientos a sus máquinas, Aura busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de algodón para la fabricación de sus productos y realizar mantenimiento a sus máquinas de confección.

De esta manera, Aura podrá continuar trabajando en su negocio y seguir creciendo para poder generar mayores ingresos en su hogar. Aura sueña con que este negocio le brinde la oportunidad de ofrecer a su esposo y a sus 3 hijos una buena calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Aura has always been a very hardworking person; this has made her business famous for the quality products it offers. For about 15 years, Aura has made pajamas and underwear. Her business helps pay for her household expenses. The great service Aura provides has allowed her to build a large customer base and also has guaranteed strong sales. Since she started her business with very little capital, Aura has worked very hard to get ahead. She is very proud, therefore, to have a large tailoring business today. 

Aura is seeking a loan so that she can buy basic materials, including cotton, to make her products. She also wants to repair her sewing machines. This way she can continue growing her business so that she can generate more income for her household. Aura hopes that through her business she can offer her husband and 3 children better living conditions and financial stability.

loans.use: to buy cotton to make her products and to repair her sewing machines.

loans.name: Carlos Alonso

texts.es:
Carlos es una persona que ha tenido que atravesar muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo, sus ganas de trabajar y salir adelante le han permitido superar las dificultades y continuar progresando junto a su familia. Carlos nació en una vereda donde sus padres tenían un terreno en el cual cultivaban café, sin embargo, las necesidades de dinero hicieron que Carlos se desplazara a la ciudad en busca de trabajo para poder aportar económicamente en su hogar. En la ciudad encontró un trabajo y con este aportó económicamente durante un tiempo, pero cuando su padre falleció y su madre se encontraba muy enferma se vio en la obligación de regresar a su vereda y hacerse cargo del cultivo ya que sus hermanos no tenían la capacidad y el conocimiento para poderlo sostener. De regreso a su vereda conoció a su actual esposa y allí formó una familia con 2 hijos, y con el ingreso que le genera el cultivo de café sostiene los gastos de su hogar. Debido a que el cultivo de café estuvo durante un largo tiempo sin alguien que lo trabajara, el cultivo se encuentra en muy malas condiciones y ahora Carlos busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de abonos, fertilizantes, insecticidas y fungicidas para poder recuperar el cultivo de café y volver a sacar productos de buena calidad.

Carlos espera que con su trabajo el cultivo de café se recupere y siga siendo una gran fuente de ingresos para su familia. Además, espera que con los ingresos su familia pueda gozar de una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas para progresar.
texts.en:
Carlos is a person who has had to go through many adversities in his life.  Nevertheless, his desire to work and get ahead has allowed him to overcome the difficulties and continue to make progress with his family.

Carlos was born in a village where his parents had a parcel of land where they grew coffee.  However, the need for money caused Carlos to move to the city to look for work in order to contribute economically to his home.  He found work in the city and was able to contribute economically for a time but when his father died and his mother became ill he was obliged to return to his village and take charge of the crops since his siblings had neither the capacity nor the skills to do so.

Upon his return to the village he met his current wife and formed a family there; they have two children.  With income generated from coffee growing he’s able to cover household expenses.  

Because the coffee plants stood with no one to take care of them for a period of time, they are in poor shape and now Carlos is looking for a loan that will give him the opportunity to be able to buy manure, fertilizer, insecticide and fungicide to restore the coffee crops and once again produce good quality products.


Carlos hopes that with his work the coffee crops will recover and continue to be a source of income for his family.  He also hopes that with the income his family will be able to enjoy a better quality of life and have better economic opportunities to make progress.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, insecticides and fungicides.

loans.name: Nihad

texts.en:
Nihad is conservative woman who is unwilling to upload her photo on internet. The photo is of her husband.

Nihad is 47 years old and married with six children. She lives in Al Karak, Jordan.

Nihad is looking to have a loan of 300 JD so she can improve her house living conditions. Her mother-in-law is paralyzed so she wants to build a suitable bathroom for her.

loans.use: to improve her house conditons

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha is 30 years old and married with three children. She lives in Al Zarqa, Jordan.

Maha is looking to have a loan of 600 JD so she can purchase clothes to sell. This will enable her to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Sameera

texts.en:
Sameera is a conservative woman so she is unwilling to upload her photo on the internet. The photo is of her husband.

Sameera is a 40-year-old married woman. She is a mother of 4 children. She lives in Bani Kenanah, Irbid, Jordan.

Sameera is looking to have a loan of 500 JDs so she can buy and sell clothes.

loans.use: to buy and sell clothes

loans.name: Nazmyah

texts.en:
Nazmyah is 49-year-old married woman, a mother of four children, and lives in Al Russeifeh, Jordan. She is a conservative woman so she unwilling to upload her photo on the Internet; the photo shows her husband. 

Nazmyah is looking to have a loan of 400 Jordanian Dinar (JOD) with which she can buy furniture and electrical machines for her house so she can improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy new furniture and electrical stuff

loans.name: Maysoon

texts.en:
Maysoon is 39 years old and a mother of three children. She lives in Al Karak, Jordan. 

Maysoon is looking to have a loan of 500 Jordanian Dinar (JOD) so she can sell clothes.

loans.use: to sell and buy clothes

loans.name: Adhieu

texts.en:
Adhieu lives in Bor. She sells food at a food stall and has been in business for one year. She is 30 years old, is married, and has three children. Two of her children are still in school. 
Adhieu heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans and sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Awur

texts.en:
Awur lives in Bor. She is 31 year old, married, and has five children; three of them are still in school. For the past two years she has sold charcoal.

Awur heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This will be her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 SDG in order to buy charcoal to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Teresita De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Teresita siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, y gracias a esta cualidad ha podido sacar su negocio adelante, superando grandes adversidades que se le han presentado en la vida. Teresita anteriormente comercializaba joyas, y posteriormente tomó un curso donde le enseñaron a fabricarlas, y de allí surgió su taller de fabricación de joyas. Sus productos son muy reconocidos por la buena calidad y los buenos diseños, y esta ha hecho que pueda captar un gran número de clientes que le garantizan muy buenas ventas mensuales. Gracias a los buenos pedidos, Teresita busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de materias primas que requiere para la elaboración de las joyas.

Teresita espera que de esta manera su negocio pueda seguir creciendo y siga generando ingresos con los cuales pueda ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Teresita sueña con que su negocio crezca y sea muy reconocido, además de poder generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas.
texts.en:
Teresita has always characterized herself as a hard-working, entrepreneur; thanks to these qualities, she has been able to get ahead with her business, overcoming adversity in her life. Teresita used to sell pre-made jewelry, but then she took a jewelry-making course and now she’s runs a jewelry workshop where she makes and sells jewelry. Her products are considered to be of good quality with good designs and this has enabled her to capture a great number of clients who guarantee very good monthly sales. Thanks to all the orders she has received, Teresita is requesting a loan so she can buy the basic materials she needs to make jewelry.

Teresita hopes that this will help her business grow and continue to generate income, so she can improve her family’s quality of life. Teresita dreams that her business will grow to be recognized, and she’ll be able to offer employment to those who are in need.

loans.use: buy the basic materials she needs to make jewelry.

loans.name: Clara Ines

texts.es:
Clara se encuentra casada y tiene un hijo de 10 años a quien siempre le ha querido ofrecer una buena educación, y es por esto que trabaja fuertemente en su negocio con el ánimo de generar ingresos suficientes para poder contribuir económicamente con los gastos de su hogar. Clara tiene un puesto de venta de frutas donde ofrece gran variedad de productos a sus clientes, y gracias a esto ha logrado captar un gran número de clientes que le garantizan muy buenas ventas. En su negocio le colabora una persona ya que durante el día circula mucha gente por el sector y a veces es difícil atender los clientes y estar pendientes de que no le vayan a robar alguno de sus productos. Este puesto de venta de frutas ya lleva cerca de 10 años ubicado en la misma parte, y gracias a esto Clara ya es reconocida en el sector. Con el ánimo de surtir su negocio, Clara busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de frutas para surtir su negocio y ofrecer a sus clientes una gran variedad.

De esta manera se espera que su negocio siga creciendo y pueda tener buenas ventas con las cuales pueda generar ingresos para su hogar. Además, Clara espera que con mayores ingresos su familia pueda gozar de una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas.
texts.en:
Clara is married and has a 10 year old son who she’s always wanted to provide a good education for and this is why she works hard in her business aiming at earning sufficient income to contribute economically to household expenses.

Clara has a fruit stand where she sells a wide variety to her customers and thanks to this has been able to capture a large number of customers that guarantee good sales.  She collaborates with a person in her work because during the day many people circulate in the sector and sometimes it’s difficult to take care of all the customers and also be watching to keep her products from being stolen.

This fruit stand has been located in the same spot for almost ten years and thanks to this Clara is well-known in the sector.  With the intention of stocking her business, Clara is looking for a loan that will make it possible for her to buy fruit to stock her business and offer a wide variety to her customers.

In this way she hopes her business will continue growing and that she will have good sales to generate income for her home.  In addition, Clara hopes that with higher income her family will enjoy a better quality of life and greater economic opportunities.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 34-year-old married male. He lives in Baqa'a, Jordan. He is a father of two children.

Mohammed needs a loan of 1500 JD to buy a machine to help him repair vehicles..

loans.use: to buy a machine needed to repair cars

loans.name: Khairiyah

texts.en:
Khairiyah is 61 years old and the mother of six children. She lives in Al Salt, Jordan.

Khairiyah wants to have a loan of 400 JD to purchase clothes and trees, which are used as decoration in homes.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and trees to sell

loans.name: Sobol

texts.en:
Sobol is 32 years old and single. She lives in Al Russeifeh, Jordan.

Sobol is looking to have a loan of 800 JD to help her purchase domestic goods to sell to her neighbors.

loans.use: to buy household goods to sell

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Doña Juana de 55 años de edad, es una mujer soltera su esposo falleció, y ella con esfuerzo y lucha ha salido adelante a sus 5 hijos hoy en día cada uno de ellos trabajan y algunos de ellos le ayudan a traer ingresos a su hogar, ella tiene casa propia vive con una hija soltera, radica en una aldea de la comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras.
Doña Juana Tiene una pequeña pulpería y venta de golosinas pues ahí ella vende jabón, arroz, frijoles, frescos, azúcar, maseca, harina blanca, huevos y sale a vende también pastelitos y tacos de manera ambulante con el fin de obtener ingresos para prosperar ya que son tiempos muy difíciles.
Doña Juana solicita el préstamo para abastecer el negocio en la compra de jabón, arroz, frijoles, frescos, azúcar, maseca, harina blanca, huevos y otros productos, con la ayuda de este préstamo desea seguir invirtiendo y creciendo con su negocio. 
El sueño de Doña Juana es mejorar su casa y construirle una casa a su hija que vive con ella.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2012
texts.en:
Juana, 55, is a widow and with much effort and fight, she has raised 5 children. Each one of her children works and some of them help with the household income. She has her own house and lives with her daughter, who is single, in the village of San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras.
Juana has a small grocery store and also sells candy. She sells soap, rice, beans, drinks, sugar, maseca (corn flour mix), white flour and eggs. She also goes out and sells pastries and tacos as a street vendor in order to prosper in these difficult times.
Juana is requesting a loan to stock her business with the products mentioned above and others. She’d like to continue investing in and growing her business.
Juana’s dream is to repair her own house and build one for her daughter with whom she lives.
San Lorenzo, Honduras – March 2012

loans.use: soap, rice, beans, drinks, sugar, maseca (corn flour mix), white flour, eggs and other products for her business.

loans.name: Javier Aneiro

texts.es:
Javier es un gran emprendedor que viendo las necesidades de las personas decidió montar una idea de negocio con la que actualmente trabaja. Javier decidió fabricar discos para guadaña, herramienta que no se podía conseguir con mucha facilidad, ni a un buen precio, ni de una buena calidad, por lo que decidió fabricarlas por su propia cuenta y así surgió su idea de negocio. Su primera venta fue a un amigo que las probó durante un tiempo, y al ver la buena calidad del producto lo fue recomendando a las demás personas y así su producto fue captando cada vez más clientes. Actualmente Javier sigue fabricando sus discos para guadaña con una gran calidad y de este negocio genera los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar donde convive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos. Debido a que su negocio lo montó con muy bajo capital, y la demanda del mercado por su producto ha sido muy alta, Javier busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de materias primas como láminas, discos, cadenas, entre otros, y poder así fabricar las unidades que requiere el mercado.

De esta manera, su negocio podrá seguir creciendo y su familia podrá tener mayores ingresos. Además, Javier podrá cumpliendo poco a poco su sueño de tener una casa propia para su familia.
texts.en:
Javier is a very entrepreneurial person, who realizing people's needs, decided to start up a business idea, which he is currently working on. Javier decided to produce blades for brush cutters, which is a tool that wasn't easy to come by, or get at a good price, or a good quality. That is why he decided to produce them on his own and that's how his business idea came up. He made his first sale to a friend who tried it for a while, and as he realized the good quality of the product, he started recommending it to other people. That's how his product began to acquire more and more customers. Currently Javier continues to manufacture blades for brush cutters and from this business he generates the necessary income to support his home, where he lives together with his wife and his 4 children. Given that his business was set up with a very low amount of capital, and the market demand for his product has been very high, Javier is looking for a loan that will give him the opportunity to be able to buy more supplies such as metal sheets, blades, chains, among others, in order to be able to produce the units required by the market.
In this way, his business will have the possibility to continue to grow and his family will be able to live on a higher income. Also, little by little, Javier will be able to fulfill his dream of having a home of his own for his family to live in.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as metal sheets, blades, chains, among others, to be able to produce the units the market requires

loans.name: Flavio Alonso

texts.es:
Flavio es una persona muy trabajadora que desde muy corta edad se encuentra trabajando al lado de su padre quien le enseñó la actividad de la agricultura a muy corta edad. Actualmente, Flavio trabaja independiente y tiene su propio cultivo de verduras el cual con mucho esfuerzo ha levantado y ha logrado sacar de este, productos de muy buena calidad. Gracias a la enseñanza de su padre acerca de la agricultura, Flavio realiza con muy buenas prácticas su trabajo, lo que le ha permitido captar un gran número de clientes para su negocio, que le ha permitido crecer cada vez más. Debido a que su cultivo fue montado con muy bajo capital, Flavio busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de abonos, riegos, insecticidas y fungicidas para seguir sacando adelante su propio cultivo.

Flavio de esta manera podrá seguir generando los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento familiar y así podrá seguir progresando en su vida. Además, Flavio podrá ir cumpliendo poco a poco su sueño de tener un gran negocio y generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas.
texts.en:
Flavio is a very hardworking person who has been working from a very early age alongside his father who taught him how to farm when he was quite young.  Currently, Flavio works independently and has his own vegetable crops which he’s managed to get going with much effort and to produce good quality products.  

Thanks to his father’s teachings about farming, Flavio has very good work habits which has led to his winning over many customers for his business which in turn has led to his continued growth.  Because his crops started with very little capital, Flavio is looking for financing to buy manure, sprinklers, insecticide and fungicide to continue producing his own crops.

In this way Flavio will be able to continue generating income needed to support the family and to continue making progress in life.  In addition, Flavio will be able to reach his great dream little by little of having a great business and generating employment for those who are most needy.

loans.use: to buy manure, sprinklers, insecticide and fungicide.

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en:
Nawal is 31 years old and married. She is living in Al Russeifeh, Jordan. She is a mother of two children.

Nawal is looking to have a loan of 800 JD so she can improve her house living conditions to be healthier

loans.use: to improve her house living conditions

loans.name: Kholoud

texts.en:
Kholoud is a conservative woman so she is unwilling to upload her photo on the internet. The photo is of her father.

Kholoud is 30 years old and divorced. She lives in Al Khaledieh, Jordan.

Kholoud is looking to have a loan of 400 JD so she can improve her house living conditions and buy some new furniture to make her house more comfortable.

loans.use: to improve her house living conditions

loans.name: Ingrid Johana

texts.es:
La joven Ingrid de 32 años de edad, vive con su pareja el señor José con quien tiene un hijo de 5 años que va al kinder de su comunidad, ella y su familia viven en su casa propia en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, Valle. Al sur de Honduras.
Ingrid se dedica desde hace unos tres años a vender tacos, pastelitos, comida corrientes a maestros y alumnos que le visitan a diario ya que su negocio esta cerca de una escuela  y también sale a vender ambulante para agenciarse mas ingresos.
Ingrid solicita el préstamo para comprar pollo, papas, frijoles, huevos, harina, azúcar que es los productos que necesita para preparar sus golosinas, con el préstamo pretende mejorar su negocio y la calidad de sus comidas.
El sueño de Ingrid es vivir bien y mejorar su vivienda para que su hijo y su familia tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2012
texts.en:
Ingrid, 32, lives with her partner, José. They have a 5-year old who is in kindergarten. She and her family live in their own house in the community of San Lorenzo, in the south of Honduras.
For the last 3 years, Ingrid has been selling tacos, pastries and regular meals to teachers and students that visit her every day. Her business is close to a school and she also goes out as a street vendor to generate more income.
Ingrid is requesting a loan to buy chicken, potatoes, beans, eggs, flour and sugar, as these are the ingredients she needs to prepare her meals. With this loan, she hopes to improve her business and the quality of her meals.
Ingrid’s dream is to live well and improve her home in order to improve her family’s quality of life.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - March 2012

loans.use: buy chicken, potatoes, beans, eggs, flour and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en: Amal is 42 years old and married. Amal lives in Al Zarqa, Jordan. She is a mother of three children. Amal is looking to have a loan of 400 JD. This will enable her to sell clothes, which makes her able to open her own store in the future.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Achiro

texts.en:
Achiro lives in Kator. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for three years. She is 22 years old, married, and has no children. 

Achiro heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI est  un groupe  de femmes mariées ayant en moyenne 30 ans, 4 enfants et vivant  dans des familles traditionnelles à DIALANIKORO, un des quartiers de la ville de Bougouni (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur troisième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de chaussures à travers  KOROTOUMOU  , et  des habits.
KOROTOUMOU , avec sa mai dans le seau sur la photo,  compte acheter avec son  prêt,  100 paires de chaussures. Elle s’approvisionne auprès des grossistes de Bougouni. Elle effectue sa vente à domicile et au marché à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes, en détail, au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000.FCFA par mois dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en: Benkadi is a group of married women with an average age of 30 and 4 children. They live in traditional families in Dialanikoro, one of the neighborhoods in the city of Bougouni (the third largest administrative region in Mali).  To meet the needs of their clientele, they are on their third collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso, a microfinance organization.  This group of women are in the business of shoes (via Korotoumou) and clothing.  Korotoumou, with her hand in the pail in the photo, will use her loan to buy 100 pairs of shoes.  She buys her inventory from wholesalers in Bougouni. She resells from her home and at the market to a clientele of women and men, for cash and credit. She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 30,000 FCFA, a part of which will be used to help her husband with daily expenses. The other part will be invested in her business.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Pima Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles polygames les 4 femmes du groupe Pima ont  en moyenne  33 ans et   5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes  dans le quartier Massablacoura de la ville de Bougouni et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de mariage. 
Elles font l’achat et la vente de céréales à l’image de la présidente du groupe Mariam, des condiments alimentaires (pâtes d’arachide et huile d’arachide), des tasses  et des habits.
 Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 7eme prêt solidaire. Les six précédents ont été correctement remboursés
Madame, Mariam (1ere  femme de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de  céréales de toutes qualités qui est très appréciée et sollicitée à Bougouni. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 17 sacs de fonio dans les villages environnants auprès des paysans producteurs. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, en détail et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt, Madame  Mariam espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et aider son mari à prendre en charge certains besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The four women in the Pima group are married (mainly in polygamous families), with an average age of 33 and an average of five children. They all live in the Massablacoura district of the city of Bougouni, and are either related through family or marriage or know each other because they are neighbors.
Like the president of the group Mariam they buy and sell cereals, as well as seasoning for cooking (peanut butter and peanut oil), containers and clothes.
To expand their business the members of the group have joined Soro Yiriwaso, and are now on their seventh group loan. The six previous loans have all been correctly repaid.
Mariam (the first woman moving from right to left in the photo) is an important vendor of all kinds of cereals, and is valued and sought-after in Bougouni. She plans to use her loan to buy 17 bags of fonio from rural producers in the surrounding villages. She makes sales on a cash, retail and credit basis to both male and female customers.
With this loan Mariam hopes to make an average monthly profit of 80,000 francs CFA, which she will reinvest in her business and use to help her husband meet certain household expenses.

loans.use: to buy fonio.

loans.name: Javier De Jesus

texts.es:
Javier es una persona que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajador y siempre querer ofrecer a su esposa y sus 6 hijos una buena calidad de vida. Javier anteriormente trabajaba en las actividades del campo, sin embargo, las pocas oportunidades que había hicieron que se desplazara hacia la ciudad en búsqueda de generar ingresos más estables. Fue así como comenzó con un negocio de venta de muebles, en el cual le fue muy bien pero debido al poco capital con el que contaba en un momento la competencia le hizo caer en quiebra. Posteriormente abrió una tienda general en la que ofrece todos los productos de la canasta familiar y en la que le ha ido muy bien. Gracias a este negocio genera los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su familia, y es por esto que su negocio lo trabaja con mucho empeño cada día. Javier se caracteriza en su negocio por ofrecer muy buena atención a sus clientes, y por ofrecer muy buenos precios en sus productos, y gracias a esto ha tenido muy buenas ventas, a tal punto en que el inventario de algunos productos se ha ido desabasteciendo. Es por esto que Javier busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de productos de la canasta familiar para surtir su negocio y seguir ofreciendo buenos productos a sus clientes.

De esta manera Javier podrá seguir teniendo gran clientela y seguir generando los ingresos con los que sostiene los gastos de su hogar. Además, Javier tiene el sueño de que su negocio le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de su casa propia para poder vivir en ella con su esposa y sus 6 hijos.
texts.en:
Javier is a person who has always been noted for being very hardwroking and always wanting to offer his wife and six children a good quality of life.  

Javier used to work in the fields but the little opportunity that provided led him to move to the city seeking to generate more stable income.  This is how he started out selling furniture.  He did well but because he had little capital competition led him into bankruptcy.  He then opened a general store where he stocks all basic staple items and he’s done very well with it.  Thanks to this business he generates the income needed to support his family and this is why he works so hard at it every day.

Javier is notable in his business for offering very good customer service and for having very good prices in his products and thanks to this his sales have been good to such an extend that he’s been running out of some of his products.  This is why Javier is looking for a loan to be able to buy basic staple items to stock his store and continue offering good products to his customers.

In this way Javier will be able to keep his great clientele and continue generating the income with which he covers household expenses.  In addition, Javier dreams with being able to buy a house of his own to live in with his wife and six children.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock his store.

loans.name: Leocadio De Jesus

texts.es:
Leocadio siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy trabajadora y siempre querer ofrecer a su familia una buena calidad de vida. Leocadio inició su negocio de cría y venta de cerdos desde hace aproximadamente 5 años, negocio con el cual ha generado los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Gracias a la buena crianza que da Leocadio a sus animales, puede ofrecerlos a muy buen precio por tener muy buena calidad, y es por esto que Leocadio quiere seguir trabajando fuertemente en este negocio para seguir generando los ingresos para su hogar. Con el ánimo de seguir ofreciendo a sus clientes buenos cerdos, Leocadio busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de 5 cerdos y cuido para criarlos.

De esta manera seguirá trabajando en su negocio y aspira a que en un futuro su negocio le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de su casa propia donde pueda vivir con su familia en una mayor estabilidad.
texts.en:
Leocadio has always been noted for being a very hardworking person who always has wanted to offer his family a good quality of life.  Leocadio started his business raising and selling pigs about five years ago, a business that has generated the income needed to support his home.

Thanks to the good care Leocadio gives his animals, he’s able to sell them at a very good price because they are good quality and this is why Leocadio wants to continue working hard in this business to continue generating income for his home.

Aiming at continuing to offer good pigs to his customers, Leocadio seeks a loan to buy five pigs and feed for them.  In this way, he will continue working with his business and he hopes in future that his business will make it possible for him to buy a house of his own to live in with his family with more stability.

loans.use: to buy five pigs and feed for them.

loans.name: Bolingo 2 (#4) Group

texts.en:
Jean Pierre, 43, is single and has four children. The youngest is nine years old and the oldest is eighteen. All four are currently attending school.

Jean Pierre owns a grocery shop in a local market in Brazzaville which he has operated for the past five years. Food prices have been slowly rising in Brazzaville, which has been difficult for Jean Pierre. He is grateful for the loans that allow him to buy more at one time, thus lowering the cost per product. His strategy is to keep a large variety of goods in his store to attract customers.

Jean Pierre has received two previous loans from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo and has a very good repayment record. He will use his portion of the loan to buy salt, cookies, milk, pasta and tomatoes to sell in his shop.

Jean Pierre hopes to continue to grow his business and carry a greater variety of merchandise. He would like to build a home for his family one day.

loans.use: to buy more stock for his shop.

loans.name: Shima's Group

texts.en:
Shima is a 29-year-old Iraqi wife and a mother of two children. 
Working from her home, she has been using her sewing skills for the past two years to work on custom orders and help support her family with the additional income she can bring in through the work.
Shima took a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq to buy an overlock machine and a small generator and heater for her work area, hoping to improve both her work conditions and the services she can offer to her customers.
Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers group loans for clients unable to provide a guarantor, thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients, and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: to buy an overlock machine and a small generator and heater for work area

loans.name: Kwestan's Group

texts.en:
Kwestan is 39 years old, a married mother of two children living in Iraq.

With four years experience, Kwestan has been contributing to her family's income by working from home on an old sewing machine. Meeting both her household duties and fulfilling her customers' wishes, she has been making dresses and small household items based on orders.

To improve her opportunities, Kwestan took a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq to buy a new sewing machine and renew her work area.

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about these borrowers has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and renew her work area

loans.name: Ali

texts.fr:
Monsieur Ali est un homme marié de 38 et père de 2 enfants. Il réside avec sa femme et ses enfants chez son père dans le quartier Dialanicoro de Bougouni.
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école moderne, très vite il commença des activités génératrices de revenus.
Ali fit des années un commerçant de bétails et de pièces détachées, mais sans réussite.  Alors il décide d’apprendre auprès de son ami les activités d’achat et de vente de céréales. Avec une expérience de plus de 5 années, il maitrise son activité et est très sollicité.
Dans le souci d’agrandir son entreprise, il décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter, 1 tonne de maïs, 1 tonne de petit mil et 2 tonnes de riz.  Il s’approvisionne à Bougouni et dans les villages  environnants mais aussi dans le Wassoulou pour ensuite les revendre dans le marché de Bougouni et  une partie à Yanfolila, à une clientèle mixte.
Il est à son troisième prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso. Tous les deux prêts précédent ont été correctement remboursés
Avec ce nouveau prêt il envisage de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 70 000 FCFA, qui sera essentiellement utilisé pour  agrandir son entreprise.
texts.en:
Ali is a married father of two, and is 38 years of age. He lives with his wife and children in his father’s house, located in the Dialanicoro neighborhood of Bougouni.
He did not go to modern schools, and at a young age began working to earn money.
For years Ali sold livestock and lengths of African cloth, but did not have much success. As a result, he decided to get a friend to teach him how to buy and sell cereals. With over five years’ experience, he is now skilled in this activity and is much sought-after.
As he wanted to expand his business, Ali decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso to buy one ton of corn, one ton of pearl millet and two tons of rice. He gets his supplies from Bougouni and the surrounding villages, as well as in the Wassoulou region, before selling it to mixed clientele in Bougouni market and also in Yanfolila.
This is Ali’s third loan with Soro Yiriwaso, and his previous two loans have been correctly repaid.
With this new loan he hopes to make a monthly profit of 70,000 francs CFA, which will mainly be used to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy cereals.

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Né à Kébila dans le Cercle de Kolondièba, Monsieur Adama est un homme marié de 33 ans et père de 2 enfants qui vit avec sa femme et ses enfants dans le quartier Massablacoura de Bougouni.
Très vite il abandonna l’école au profit des activités génératrices de revenus. Il a tenté pendant des années différentes activités comme la vente des articles divers de boutique, mais sans succès. Il finit par opter pour l’apprendre du métier de forgeron avec la fabrication et la vente des charrues, houes, haches, couteaux etc.
Avec une expérience de plus de 8 ans, il maîtrise son activité.
Afin de satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuse il décide d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter 50 kg de ferrailles et le reste de l’argent est réservé pour l’achat du bois de chauffe pour la forge. Adama est à son premier prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso. Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali)  et effectue ses ventes après fabrication de se articles dans son atelier situé au bord la route reliant Bougouni à Sikasso, à une clientèle constitué majoritairement de paysans.
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 30 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour améliorer son entreprise.
texts.en:
Adama was born Kébila in the county of Kolondièba. He is a married father of two children, is 33 years of age and lives with his wife and children in the Massablacoura neighborhood of Bougouni.
He left school early to start making money and for years tried a number of activities, such as the sale of various articles in stores, but without success. Eventually he decided to learn to be a blacksmith, producing articles such as plows, hoes, axes, knives, and so on.
With over eight years’ experience, Adama is now skilled in his trade.
To meet the needs of his growing customer base, he decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso finance program to purchase 50 kg of scrap iron and use the rest of the money to buy firewood for his forge. This is Adama’s first loan with Soro Yiriwaso. He gets his supplies from Bamako (the capital of Mali) and, once he has manufactured his goods, he sells them in his workshop next to the road between Bougouni and Sikasso. His customers are almost all farmers.
He hopes to make a monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA, which he will use to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy scrap metal

loans.name: Maria Dolly Del Socorro

texts.es:
Maria es una persona que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajadora, y esta cualidad le ha permitido superar grandes adversidades que se le han presentado en la vida. Maria se encuentra casada y tiene 5 hijos a quienes les quiere ofrecer una buena calidad de vida y una buena educación. Maria anteriormente vivía con su familia en un municipio del cual tuvieron que salir por la falta de oportunidades, así llegaron a su actual municipio donde allí vive un hermano suyo y este le colaboró para que se pudieran instalar en este municipio. Posteriormente, Maria logró conseguir arrendado un local donde montó un restaurante y ofrece una gran variedad de comidas a sus clientes. Maria desde su restaurante espera poder aportar ingresos en su hogar con los cuales puedan ofrecerles a sus hijos una buena calidad de vida, además, espera que su negocio le permita crecer económicamente. Con el ánimo de terminar de montar su negocio, ya que no posee un gran capital, Maria busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de silletería y mesa para poder terminar de montar su negocio.

Maria espera que este restaurante le brinde ingresos para su hogar y este le permita tener buena estabilidad económica. Además, María sueña con que este negocio le permita cumplir su sueño de tener una casa propia para su familia.
texts.en:
María is a person who has always been noted for being very hardworking and this quality has allowed her to overcome the great adversities life has presented her.

María is married and has five children she wants to provide a good quality of life and a good education for.  María used to live with her family in a town they had to leave because of the lack of opportunities.  This is how they got to their current town where a brother of hers lives and he helped out so that they could settle in this town.  Later on, María managed to rent a locale where she set up a restaurant offering a wide variety of dishes to her customers.

María hopes to generate income from the restaurant to support her home and provide her children with a good quality of life and she also hopes the business will help her grow economically.  

With the goal of completing her restaurant setup and because she does not have much capital, María seeks a loan that will make it possible for her to buy tables and chairs to finish furnishing the restaurant.

María hopes that the restaurant will provide income for her home and allow her to have economic stability.  In addition, María dreams with the restaurant allowing her to reach her dream of having a house of her own for her family.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Diego Alejandro

texts.es:
Diego es un joven emprendedor que desde muy corta edad aprendió la actividad de la mecánica y mantenimiento y reparación de motos. Por esto, desde hace un tiempo montó su propio taller de mecánica donde ofrece el servicio de mantenimiento y reparación de motos, negocio con el cual ha generado sus propios ingresos y con los cuales contribuye económicamente en su hogar para poder ofrecerles a sus padres y hermanos una mejor calidad de vida. Debido a que su negocio lo montó con muy bajo capital, Diego busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de herramientas de trabajo y repuestos para las motos. 

De esta manera su negocio seguirá creciendo y podrá permitirle tener un gran negocio con el cual pueda tener unos ingresos estables para ofrecer en su familia una buena calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Diego is a young entrepreneur who since a very young age started working as a mechanic and motorcycle repairman.  Because of this he opened his own repair shop some time ago where he provides maintenance and repair service for motorcycles, a business that has generated his own income that he uses to contribute economically to his home to provide his parents and his siblings with a better quality of life. 

Because he set up his business with very little capital, Diego is looking for financing that will make it possible for him to buy work tools and motorcycle spare parts.  In this way, his business will continue to grow and will allow him to have a great business that will generate stable income to offer his family a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy work tools and spare parts.

loans.name: Gona

texts.en:
Gona is a 32-year-old Iraqi woman. She is married and has two children.

Gona wished to contribute to the family's income so as to help support the household and her children. Working from her home, she started using her sewing skills three years ago to offer her sewing and tailoring services to women in her area.

Gona took a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq in the amount of 1500 USD to purchase an overlock machine, fabric and other materials. She is hoping to improve her opportunities by offering better service and more variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy an overlock machine, fabric and other materials.

loans.name: Umujema

texts.en:
Umujema lives in Kator. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for three years. She is 35 years old, married, with no child.

Umujema heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Agater

texts.en:
Agater lives in Kator. She sells clothes and has been in business for three years. She is 35 years old, married, and has two children, all of them are still in school.

Agater heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia lives in Kator. She sells charcoal and has been in business for three years. She is 27 years old, married, and has two children, all of them are still in school.

Cecilia heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan lives in Kator. She sells charcoal and has been in business for three years. She is 32 years old, married, and has five children, all of them are still in school.

Susan heard about BRAC, South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Shoxan's Group

texts.en:
Shoxan is a 27 year old, married, Iraqi woman. She has been working from home for the past 5 years using her sewing skills to contribute to the family's monthly income. 

In the past, Shoxan successfully applied for, received and repaid a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq. She used the previous loan to purchase an embroidery machine, an overlock machine and an iron. Shoxan now is taking a loan to make further improvements to her little sewing business. This time she is planning to replace her sewing machine and also to buy a small generator, which will allow her to better manage her time and work even during the hours when the city's power supply is out.

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: to replace her sewing machine and also to buy a small generator.

loans.name: Asiaha

texts.en:
Asiaha lives in Kator. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for three years. She is 30 years old, married, and has five children, all of them are still in school.

Asiaha heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her fourth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1800 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna lives in Kator, South Sudan. She is 39, married and has five children, with all of them still in school. For the past three years she has sold clothes to earn an income.

Anna heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This will be her fourth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1500 SDG in order to purchase more clothes to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: in order to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Edison

texts.es:
Edison es un joven emprendedor que ha visto como sus ganas de trabajar se han reflejado en un gran cultivo y en la formación de una gran familia. Edison se encuentra casado y tiene un hijo de 2 meses de nacido, y a su familia siempre le quiere brindar una buena calidad de vida. Desde muy temprana edad aprendió junto a su padre las actividades del campo, por lo que muy pequeño ya estaba cultivando y esto le sirvió para que desde hace aproximadamente 5 años ya tenga su propio cultivo y de este saque productos de muy buena calidad. Actualmente, Edison tiene 22 años y espera que su cultivo siga siendo un buen cultivo y siga sacando productos de buena calidad para ofrecer a sus clientes a un buen precio; es por esto que busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de abonos, semillas, riegos, fertilizantes y fungicidas para sacar adelante su cultivo.

Edison espera que de esta manera su negocio siga saliendo adelante y pueda tener un gran cultivo donde pueda generar empleo para los más necesitados en un futuro. Además, Edison tiene el sueño que el negocio le brinde la oportunidad de comprar el terreno donde actualmente cultiva y no tener que pagar los altos costos del arriendo.
texts.en:
Edison is a young entrepreneur who has seen how his will to work is reflected in a great harvest and in the formation of a great family.  Edison is married and has a two month old son and he always wants to provide a good quality of life for his family.

From a very young age he learned field chores alongside his father and this was useful for him when five years ago he acquired his own crops which produce very good quality products.  Edison is currently 22 years old and he hopes that his crops will continue to be good and produce good quality products to offer to his customers at a good price which is why he’s looking for a loan to buy manure, seeds, sprinklers, fertilizer and fungicide to produce his crops.

Edison hopes in this way to continue making progress with his business and to have large crops so that he can generate employment to those who are most in need in the future.  In addition, Edison has the dream that the business will provide the opportunity to buy the land he currently farms so that he will no longer have to pay the high cost of the lease.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy home products and home electronics to fill some recent major orders.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy personal hygiene products to offer to her customers.

loans.name: Labina

texts.en:
Labina lives in Kator, South Sudan. She is 26 years old, married and has three children; two of them are in school. For the past three years she has sold charcoal to earn an income.

Labina heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This will be her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to buy more charcoal to sell. She will save her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Juiltia

texts.en:
Juiltia lives in Kator. She sells at a food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is 39 years old, married, and has five children. All of them are still in school.

Juiltia heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beans and onions to sell.

loans.name: Maria Lucrecia

texts.es:
Maria se encuentra casada y tiene 2 hijos de quienes siempre ha manifestado son su más grande motivación para trabajar fuertemente en su negocio. Maria tiene una tienda general donde ofrece productos de la canasta familiar, y gracias a esta genera ingresos con los cuales contribuye al sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar. En su tienda ya lleva un largo tiempo trabajando, y esto le ha permitido mejorarle la calidad de vida a su familia y poder tener una mejor estabilidad económica. Gracias a la buena atención que ofrece en su tienda a los clientes, Maria ha logrado captar un gran número de clientes que le garantizan muy buenas ventas mensuales, y es por esto que ahora quiere aumentar la variedad de productos que ofrece en su negocio. Maria busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de un refrigerador para ofrecer productos que requieran de estar refrigerados como pollo, carnes frías, entre otros.

Maria espera que de esta manera sus ingresos aumenten considerablemente, pues podrá satisfacer más necesidades de sus clientes. Además, espera que con mayores ingresos su familia pueda tener una mejor calidad de vida y sus 2 hijos puedan tener acceso a una educación de mayor calidad.
texts.en:
Maria is married and has two children, whom she always has shown to be her biggest motivation to work hard in her business.  Maria has a general store where she sells staples, and thanks to this she generates income to contribute to the support of the household expenses.  She already has been working a long time in her store, and this has allowed her to improve her family's quality of life and be able to have better economic stability.  Thanks to the good service she offers her customers in her store, Maria has managed to attract a large number of customers, which guarantees her good monthly sales.  This is why now she wants to increase the variety of products she sells in her business.

Maria is looking for a loan that gives her the opportunity of buying a refrigerator to sell products that require refrigeration such as chicken and cold cuts, among others.

Maria hopes that in this way her income will increase considerably so she will be able to satisfy more of her customers' needs.  In addition, she hopes that with more income her family can have a better quality of life and her two children can have a higher-quality education.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator to sell products that need to be refrigerated, such as chicken and cold cuts, among others.

loans.name: Nian's Group

texts.en:
Nian is a forty-year-old married Iraqi woman and the mother of three children. For the past four years she has been using her sewing skills to work on custom orders and help her husband with the financial support of the family.

Working from home, Nian has been successful in meeting the demands of her household as well as the needs of her customers. To be able to offer more options to the latter, Nian would like to buy an overlock machine and an iron and make some improvements in her work area. To do so she took a loan through her group from Relief International Microfinance Iraq.

RI-Iraq offers group loans to clients unable to provide a guarantor and thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients with each client evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the group’s individual with the lowest repayment capacity.

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for her protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to buy an overlock machine and an iron and make some improvements in her work area.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice lives in Kator. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for five years. She is 40 years old, married, and has five children. All of them are still in school.

Loice heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan lives in Kator where she has been selling charcoal for the past three years. She is 30 years old, married, and has three children, all of whom attend school.

Susan, who leaned about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, is requesting her third loan for 1500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use the extra income arising from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen lives in Buluk where she has been selling charcoal for three years. She is 31 years old, married, and has five children, all of whom are in school.

Helen learned about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and is requesting her first loan of 1000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use the resulting extra income to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Sitan

texts.fr:
Madame Sitan est une femme mariées de 35 et sans enfant. Elle réside chez son époux dans le quartier Hérémakono Nord de Bougouni. 
N’ayant pas fréquentée l’école moderne très vite elle commence les activités génératrices de revenus. Avant de mener cette activité de vente de céréales madame Sitan vendait des condiments dans le marché de Bougouni. Cette activité ne lui est pas réussit. C’est ainsi qu’elle décide d’accompagner son mari dans domaine d’achat et la vente de céréales
Avec une expérience de 6 années, elle maîtrise son activité et est très appréciée et sollicitée.
 De ce fait après une très longue réflexion elle décide de prendre un prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter 2 tonnes de maïs et 10 sacs de mil. Elle s’approvisionne à Manankoro et Gueya et la vente se fait dans le marché de Bougouni et parfois à Bamako.
Elle est à sa première expérience avec Soro Yiriwaso.
Madame Sitan envisage de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 90 000 FCFA.
 Avec ce bénéfice elle envisage agrandir son entreprise..
texts.en: Ms. Sitan is a married woman who is 35 years old and childless. She lives with her husband in the North Heremakono district of Bougouni. Not having attended school, she quickly started an income-generating business.  Before her current business of selling cereals, she sold condiments at the Bougouni market.  That business was not successful. For this reason, she started to work with her husband at buying and selling cereals.  With six years of experience, she has mastered her business and is very popular and sought-after.  After considering for a long time, she decided to take a loan with Soro Yiriwaso to buy two tons of corn and 10 bags of millet.  She sources in Manankoro and Gueya and resells at the Bougouni market and sometimes also in Bamako.  She is on her first loan with Soro Yiriwaso.  Ms. Sitan expects to earn a monthly profit of 90,000 FCFA. With her profits, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Orlando De Jesus

texts.es:
Orlando es una persona que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajador, pues desde muy temprana edad aprendió junto a su padre a atender una tienda general, pues su padre generaba los ingresos para el hogar con este negocio. Hace aproximadamente 4 años Orlando decidió montar su propio negocio y desde entonces viene trabajando fuertemente para poder generar ingresos con los cuales pueda sostener los gastos de su hogar. Orlando ofrece en su tienda toda clase de productos de la canasta familiar, pero debido al poco capital con el que fue montado su negocio y con la necesidad de ingresos por parte de su familia, ha tenido dificultades para poder surtir su negocio con una mayor variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes. Es por esto que Orlando busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de productos de la canasta familiar para surtir su negocio y ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes.

De esta manera Orlando podrá aumentar sus ventas haciendo más atractivo su negocio para sus clientes. Además, podrá ofrecer unos mejores ingresos en su hogar mejorando la calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Orlando is a person who is known for always being very hard-working.   At a very early age he leaned, together with his father, how to attend to a general store.  His father generated the household income with this business.

Approximately four years ago Orlando decided to establish his own business.  Ever since then he has been working very hard in order to be able to generate income to support the household expenses.

Orlando sells all types of basic needs items in his store.  However, due to the small amount of capital that he used to set up his business and the need for income for his family, he has had difficulties being able to stock his store with a greater variety of products to offer his customers.

That is why Orlando is looking for a loan to buy basic needs items to stock his business and to offer a greater variety of products to his customers.

This way Orlando will be able to increase his sales, which will make his business more attractive to his customers.  He will also be able to get better income for his household, which will improve the whole family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic needs items to stock his business and to offer a greater variety of products to his customers.

loans.name: Aquiles

texts.es:
El señor Aquiles, se dedica desde hace cuatro años a la PRESTACION DE SERVICIOS DE TRANSPORTE TAXI, actividad que desarrolla en un Mall de la ciudad y el cual es visitado por muchas personas que utilizan este medio de transporte, comienza desde muy temprano con clientes que ya lo tienen contratado entre ellos algunos vecinos de la colonia donde vive, le gusta que sus clientes queden muy satisfechos con su servicio y el se esmera porque se sientan muy cómodos y seguros en su vehículo, siempre es muy amable y sonriente, este negocio le ha ayudado mucho para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos con el estudio y dos de ellos ya están trabajando.
Don Aquiles esta solicitando el crédito para la reparación de su vehículo ya que esta presentando problemas con el motor y quiere comprar casquillos, pistones, sellos, empaques, bujías, inyectores entre otros. 
Dona Aquiles agradece a por los préstamos recibidos y espera que PRISMA lo siga apoyando.


Tegucigalpa, Honduras – Marzo 2012
texts.en:
Señor Aquiles has offered a taxi service for four years. His business is based out of a mall in the city and his services are used by many people who use this form of transportation. Aquiles starts work very early in the morning with some clients who have his taxi reserved; some of these clients are his neighbours. He is happy because his customers are very satisfied with his service, and he does his best to ensure that they feel comfortable and secure in his vehicle. He is always very kind, and always smiling. This business has helped him greatly; he has been able to get his children ahead in their studies. Two of them are already working.
Aquiles is requesting a loan for vehicle repair; he is having motor trouble and wants to buy cases, pistons, seals, packaging, spark plugs, injectors, and other items.
Aquiles is grateful for his loans and hopes that PRISMA will continue to support him.

Tegucigalpa, Honduras – March 2012

loans.use: to buy cases, pistons, seals, packaging, spark plugs, injectors, and other spare parts for his taxi.

loans.name: Amparo Del Socorro

texts.es:
Amparo se dedica hace aproximadamente 20 años a las labores del campo gracias a que su padre se dedicaba a estas actividades y se las enseñó cuando era muy joven. Actualmente, Amparo se encuentra casada y tiene 2 hijos, y con su esposo tienen un cultivo de verduras y una producción de leche. El cultivo lo maneja su esposo que tiene un poco más de conocimientos que ella, y el cuidado de las vacas lecheras y el ordeñarlas corren por cuenta de Amparo. De esta manera contribuye con la generación de ingresos para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar. Gracias al buen cuidado que da Amparo a su vaca, esta le ha dado leche de muy buena calidad, y por esto su producto es muy apetecido por sus clientes. Con el ánimo de aumentar su producción de leche, Amparo busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de una vaca para aumentar su producción de leche y poder responder a la demanda del mercado.

De esta manera sus ingresos mensuales aumentarán considerablemente, pues tendrá la capacidad para abastecer los pedidos de sus clientes. Además, Amparo espera que con mayores ingresos sus 2 hijos y su esposo tengan la oportunidad de acceder a una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas para progresar.
texts.en:
For approximately 20 years Amparo has devoted herself to doing farm work.  This is thanks to her father, who devoted himself to these business activities, because he taught her this work when she was very young.

Amparo is currently married and has two children.  She and her husband grow vegetables, and they are milk producers.  Her husband manages the crops because he has a bit more knowledge than she does in that area.  Amparo takes care of the dairy cows and milks them.  This way she contributes to the generation of income to support the household expenses.

Thanks to the good care that Amparo gives her cow, the cow has given her very good quality milk.  That is why her customers like her product so much. 

With the thought of increasing her milk production Amparo is looking for a loan to buy a cow to increase her milk production.  Then she will be able to respond to the market demand.  This way her monthly income will increase considerably.

Also, Amparo hopes that with greater income her two children and her husband will have a better quality of life and opportunities to progress financially.

loans.use: to buy a cow to increase her milk production and respond to the market demand.

loans.name: Santa Colastica

texts.es:
Santa,  Tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad. Hace 6 años junto a su esposo inicio su negocio de víveres de primera necesidad.  Ella empezó comprando bebidas, enlatados y granos actualmente su negocio ha crecido. También vende víveres varios y productos avícolas. Trabaja de lunes a domingo desde las 8:00 am hasta las 10:00 pm.
En el sector donde vive tiene algunos problemas por la delincuencia. Su tienda no ha tenido mayores inconvenientes ya que no trabaja sola.  Con el préstamo desea comprar panes, snack, artículos para el hogar. Su meta futura es seguir progresando en su negocio.
texts.en:
Santa is 65 years old and married. She lives in Guayaquil with her husband and has four grown children. Six years ago, she and her husband started an emergency supplies business. Santa began purchasing drinks, canned goods, and grains and her business has grown. She also sells other supplies and poultry products. 

Santa works Monday through Sunday from 8 AM to 10 PM. There are some delinquency problems in the area where she lives. Her store has not suffered any major inconveniences since she does not work alone. 

With this loan Santa wants to purchase bread, snacks, and home supplies. Her future goal is to continue progressing in her business.

loans.use: to purchase breads, snacks, and domestic goods

loans.name: Torre Fuerte Group

texts.es:
Doña Lourdes de 35 años de edad es soltera, vive con sus dos hijos en un barrio de la ciudad de Nacaome, Doña Lourdes es líder del grupo Torre Fuerte la han elegido a ella por su dedicación y esfuerzo, ella se dedica desde hace 9 años a la elaboración de golosinas, como arroz con pollo, tacos, sándwich, baleadas y otras golosinas su venta es ambulante en el mercado de Nacaome, Doña Lourdes hace sus ricas golosinas muy temprano en la mañana para aprovechar las horas de las comidas y vender sus preparaciones.
Doña Lourdes esta solicitando 10,000.00 lempiras para la compra de verduras, carnes, pollo, arroz, aceites y otros productos para preparar sus golosinas, logrando de esta manera seguir trabajando en su negocio y con las utilidades del mismo seguir invirtiendo y pagando sus obligaciones.
Doña Lourdes uno de sus sueños es tener su propia casa ya que donde ella vive actualmente esa casa es rentada, y de igual manera seguir en el  grupo con sus compañeros para seguir trabajando con PRISMA.
Carlos y Alexis se dedican a vender verduras en el mercado de Nacaome.
Douglas tiene su negocio al que se dedica todo el día que es la venta de ropa
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2012
texts.en:
Doña Lourdes, age 35, is single and lives with her two children in a neighbourhood of the city of Nacaome. She was selected leader of the Torre Fuerte group because of her dedication and hard work. She has made snacks for nine years. Her dishes include arroz con pollo, tacos, sandwiches, and baleadas [a wheat flour tortilla filled with mashed fried beans]. She sells in a stall in the Nacaome market. She gets up very early in the morning to make her food so that she can be ready for mealtimes.
Lourdes is requesting a loan of 10,000 Lempiras for the purchase of vegetables, meat, chicken, rice, oil, and other items to prepare her snacks. This will allow her to keep working and investing, and paying off her obligations. One of her dreams is to have her own home; she currently rents. She also wants to continue working with her group of friends as part of PRISMA.
Carlos and Alexis sell vegetables in the Nacaome market. Douglas sells clothing, working in his business all day.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - March 2012

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, chicken, rice, oil, and other products.

loans.name: Shamim Akhtar's Group

texts.en:
Shamim akhtar is a 46 year-old married woman who has five children: four sons and one daughter. Her eldest son is a rickshaw driver and financially contributes to the family from his earnings. Two others work in a factory and a fourth one is involved in the timber sales business. Her daughter reads in 2nd standard.  Her husband is a driver by profession and earns income for the family by working for 8 hours a day. 
Shamim herself is also a very supportive lady. She operates an animal sales business. Her business is home-based. She raises young animals and sells them when grown. This business earns her good profits which she utilizes in managing the financial expenses. 

She has requested a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for the improvement of her animal sales business. With the loan, she will buy animals (goats) to raise and sell.  She is confident that her business will be expanded further after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy animals for animal sales business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Buluk. She sells food at a stall, and has been in business for three years. She is 35 years old, married, and has five children.  All of them are still in school.
Mary heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase maize flour and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour and rice for sale.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana lives in Buluk. She sells clothes and has been in business for three years. She is 37 years old, married, and has four children.  All of them are still in school.
Diana heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1200 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes lives in Buluk. She sells items at food stall, and has been in business for five months. She is 28 years old, married, and has two children.  Both of them are in school.

Agnes heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her forth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase sugar and maize flour. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and maize flour for sale.

loans.name: Yaqueline

texts.es:
Yaqueline se encuentra casada y tiene 2 hijos quienes son su más grande motivación para trabajar fuertemente en su negocio todos los días. Yaqueline, al ver que lo ingresos que genera su esposo no son suficientes para poder sostener los gastos que se generan en su hogar, montó un negocio de videojuegos donde además ofrece snack y dulces a sus clientes. Gracias a esto, Yaqueline genera ingresos con los cuales contribuye económicamente en su hogar y esto le permite a su familia tener una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica. En su negocio Yaqueline se ha caracterizado por ofrecer un muy buen servicio y esto le ha permitido atraer cada vez más clientes para su negocio, lo que a su vez le ha generado mayores ventas. Actualmente, Yaqueline no tiene la capacidad para atender toda la demanda en su negocio, por lo que busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de un televisor y una consola de videojuegos para poder tener la capacidad de atender la demanda en su negocio.

Yaqueline podrá aumentar sus ventas considerablemente, pues actualmente debe dejar de vender por la falta de capacidad. Además, Yaqueline estima que con mayores ingresos su familia podrá tener una mayor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas que les permitirá progresar.
texts.en:
Yaqueline is married with two children. Her children are her greatest motivation for working hard in her business every day. When she saw that her husband's income was not enough to cover their household expenses, Yaqueline opened a video game business where she also offers snacks and sweets to her clients. Thanks to this work, Yaqueline makes an income and contributes to the household finances. This allows her family to have a better quality of life and better economic stability. Yaqueline offers an excellent service, which has allowed her to attract more and more clients and increase her sales. Currently, Yaqueline does not have the capacity to serve the demand for her business. For this reason, she is looking for a loan which will allow her to buy a television and video game console in order to have enough capacity to cover the demand.
Yaqueline will be able to increase her sales considerably; she has had to stop selling due to lack of capacity. Furthermore, Yaqueline knows that an increase in income will allow her family to have a better quality of life and better economic opportunities, which will allow them to progress.

loans.use: to buy a television and a video game console in order to have enough capacity to serve demand.

loans.name: Maria Lucero

texts.es:
Maria es una persona que ha tenido una gran fortaleza para superar grandes adversidades que se le han presentado en la vida. Maria es una madre soltera cabeza de familia, pues su ex esposo murió hace un tiempo y la dejó viuda a cargo de su único hijo. En ese entonces, Maria tenía un empleo con el cual generaba ingresos para contribuir económicamente en su hogar, pero con la muerte de su esposo se vio en la obligación de dejar su empleo para poder estar más al cuidado de su hijo. Debido a que necesariamente tenía que generar ingresos, montó un taller de confección donde ofrece el servicio de confección a terceros y el cual, gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos, ha tenido un gran reconocimiento en el sector y le ha permitido captar un gran número de clientes. En su taller, Maria se ha caracterizado por entregar pedidos a tiempo, y siempre ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes, y esto le ha permitido venir captando cada vez más clientes para su negocio. Gracias a que actualmente sus pedidos se han incrementado considerablemente, Maria busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de una máquina fileteadora con la cual pueda generar un empleo en su taller.

De esta manera, Maria podrá ofrecer la herramienta de trabajo para la persona que le colaborará en su taller para aumentar la capacidad de producción y así responder a todos los pedidos que le hacen sus clientes. Además, Maria espera que así su taller siga creciendo y le siga generando cada vez más ingresos, ya que su hijo esta próximo a dejar la secundaria y requiere de dinero para pagar sus gastos universitarios. Maria sueña con tener un gran taller, generar mucho empleo y poder ofrecerle a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas para seguir progresando.
texts.en:
María is a person who has had the strength to overcome great adversities life has presented her.  María is a single mother head of household because her husband died some time ago leaving her widowed in charge of their only son.  Back then, María had a job that allowed her to contribute economically to her home but with her husband’s death she had to leave her job to take care of her son.  

Because she needed to generate income too she set up a sewing workshop where she does sewing jobs for third persons and thanks to the good quality of her products she’s become recognized in the sector and this has led to her acquiring a large number of customers.  In her workshop María is noted for delivering her completed orders on time and for always offering good customers service which has led to her acquiring more and more customers for her business each time.  Thanks to the fact that her orders have increased considerably lately, María is looking for a loan that will make it possible for her to buy a serger sewing machine with which she can offer employment to someone.  In this way María will have the necessary work tool of the person who will work with her in the shop to increase production capacity and be able to fill all the pending orders she has from customers.
