This is the way Luz Marleny could have a big business offering her customers the products they need. Furthermore, she hopes that her business grows with higher profits so her family can have a better quality of life and her 2 sons can attend university.

loans.use: to buy clothing in order to supply her business with the most often purchased product

loans.name: Attou

texts.en:
Attou lives in bor. She sells clothes, and has been in business for two years. She is 28 years old, married, and has four children; two of them are still in school. 

Attou heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1200 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fee of her children.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Luz Fanny

texts.es:
Luz Fanny es una madre soltera cabeza de familia de su único hijo debido a que se separó del padre de su hijo y este se fue sin aportar alguna contribución económica para el sostenimiento de su hijo. Luz Fanny al ver la necesidad de generar ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hogar, decidió montar una tienda general donde ofrece productos de la canasta familiar, dulces, gaseosas, snack, entre otros. La tienda la tiene hace aproximadamente 6 años y gracias a esta ha podido sacar su hijo adelante y ha logrado brindarle a su hijo una buena educación. Debido a que cuando montó su tienda no contaba con mucho capital disponible, Luz Fanny no cuenta con un refrigerador en la misma, por lo que busca que un préstamo le permita comprar un refrigerador para ofrecer a sus clientes productos que requieran de estar refrigerados como carnes frías, quesos, entre otros.

De esta manera Luz Fanny espera que su negocio siga saliendo adelante y le permita tener buenos ingresos para no tener que sufrir por la falta de dinero. Además, aspira a que su hijo tenga una buena calidad de vida y el acceso a una buena educación. Luz Fanny sueña con tener un negocio grande donde genere empleo para los más necesitados y desde el cual pueda tener una estabilidad económica para el sostenimiento de su hogar.
texts.en:
Luz Fanny is a single mother and the head of the family. She is separated from the father of her son; he provides them with no financial support. Seeing the need to earn an income, Luz Fanny decided to open a store where she sells basic items like candy, soft drinks, snacks etc. She's had the store for about six years and has used the income to support her son and provide him with an education. When she started the store she didn't have much capital so couldn't buy a refrigerator. Now she is seeking a loan to buy one so she can offer her customers items that need to be kept cold such as cold cuts, cheese etc.

With this purchase Luz Fanny hopes that her business will continue to thrive and provide her with a good income so that she doesn't have to worry about money. As well she hopes that her son will have a good standard of living and access to a good education. Her dream is to have a big store and provide employment for those who most need it, and to have a stable, regular income.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator so she can offer her customers items like cold cuts, cheese etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to supply her business with more types of liquor in order to offer a greater variety of products to her clients and thus increase sales

loans.name: Gune

texts.en:
Gune lives in Kator. She sells at a food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is 32 years old, married, and has three children. All of them are still in school.

Gune heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans and maize flour. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beans and maize flour for sale.

loans.name: Nyanthiech

texts.en:
Nyanthiech lives in Bor. She sells at a food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is 37 years old, married, and has six children; four of them are still in school. 

Nyanthiech heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans and sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Jorge Eliecer

texts.es:
Jorge es una persona muy trabajadora que ha luchado fuertemente con el ánimo de sacara adelante a su esposa y sus 5 hijos. Desde muy temprana edad aprendió la actividad del campo gracias a que consiguió trabajo en unos cultivos cerca de su casa. Desde entonces, Jorge viene trabajando en esta actividad la cual en un principio le permitía tener unos ingresos con los que contribuía económicamente a sus padres para el sostenimiento de su hogar, y posteriormente para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar donde convive con su esposa y sus 5 hijos. En su cultivo se ha caracterizado por ofrecer productos de muy buena calidad y esto le ha permitido tener una gran cantidad de clientes fijos que le permiten tener muy buenas ventas mensuales, y con el ánimo de seguir teniendo sus cultivos Jorge busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de abonos, fungicidas e insecticidas para el sostenimiento de sus cultivos.

De esta manera su negocio podrá seguir siendo de muy buena calidad y seguirá recibiendo buenos ingresos por sus productos. Además, espera que su negocio crezca y se siga consolidando para que su familia tenga una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas para progresar.
texts.en:
Jorge is a very industrious person who has fought hard to move his wife and five children forward. At a very early age he learned how to farm, thanks to which he obtained work in some of the fields near his house. Since then, Jorge has been working as a farmer which at first enabled him to have an income to contribute financially to his parent’s household and later to pay the expenses of his own home where he lives with his wife and children.

His farm is known for producing high quality products, which has enabled him to have a large number of established customers and very good monthly sales. With the goal of continuing to produce his crops, Jorge is looking to a loan to provide the means of purchasing fertilizer, fungicides and insecticides to maintain his fields.

In this way, he will continue having a high quality business that generates a very good income from his products. As well he hopes that his business will grow and continue consolidating so that his family will have a better quality of life and greater opportunities to succeed economically.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, fungicides and insecticides to maintain his fields.

loans.name: Yar

texts.en:
Yar lives in Bor. She sells at a food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is 28 years old, married, and has five children; three of them are still in school. 

Yar heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1200 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice to sell.

loans.name: Diego

texts.es:
Diego trabaja como empleado en una finca cerca de su casa, en la cual su oficio es criar los cerdos de su patrón entre otras cosas. Gracias a que su patrón le deja tener cerdos suyos en el corral, Diego ha venido aprovechando esta oportunidad para obtener unos ingresos extras y poder tener así una mejor calidad de vida. Gracias a estos ingresos de más que recibe Diego, su familia ha tenido la oportunidad de acceder a una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas. El corral donde se crían los cerdos no tiene un techo, y además de esto le hace falta un muro para poder tener una mayor cantidad de cerdos en el corral. Con el ánimo de adecuar este corral de mejor manera e introducir más cerdos suyos, Diego aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a realizar adecuaciones locativas al corral colocando un techo y construyendo un nuevo muro.

De esta manera Diego tendrá más animales suyos en el corral de su patrón y así podrá generar mayores ingresos para su familia a parte de su salario. Con mayores ingresos, su familia podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas de progresar.
texts.en:
Diego works as an employee on a farm that is close to his house.  His job is to raise the pigs that his boss has, among other things.  Diego is thankful that his boss lets him keep his own pigs in the corral.  

Diego has been taking advantage of this situation to get extra income in order to be able to improve his quality of life.  Thanks to these increased earnings that Diego receives his family has had the opportunity to have a better quality of life, and they have had greater financial opportunities.

The corral where he raises the pigs does not have a roof.  Also, it needs a wall in order to be able to have more pigs in the corral.  
With the intention of renovating this corral and improving it, he will put more of his own pigs in it.  Diego wants the loan to make improvements to the corral by placing a roof over it and by building a new wall.

This way Diego will have more animals of his own in his boss’s corral.  This way he will be able to generate greater income, aside from his salary, for his family.  With greater income his family will have a better quality of life and greater financial opportunities to advance.

loans.use: to make improvements to the corral by placing a roof over it and by building a new wall.

loans.name: Isabel De Jesus

texts.es:
Isabel es una persona que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajadora y siempre querer ofrecer a su familia una buena calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica. Isabel tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 5 de ellos los crió siendo madre soltera cabeza de familia, posteriormente se casó y tuvo su otro hijo y de allí en adelante vienen progresando juntos. Mientras era madre soltera cabeza de familia y debía criar sus 5 hijos, pasó por grandes adversidades en su vida teniendo que trabajar en condiciones extremas que hacían que su calidad de vida se deteriorara enormemente. Sin embargo, un día tomó la decisión de montar un taller de confección en su propia casa y desde allí viene trabajando más cómodamente y en un trabajo que si le gusta. En su taller de confección ofrece el servicio de confección a terceros, y gracias a la buena calidad de sus trabajos ha logrado reunir una gran cantidad de clientes. Debido a los grandes pedidos que ha tenido, una de sus máquinas se le ha averiado, por lo que busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de materias primas y arreglar su máquina de coser que tiene descompuesta.

Isabel espera que de esta manera sus ingresos sigan aumentando, pues podrá tener una mejor producción y poder responder a todos los pedidos de sus clientes. Además, Isabel espera que con mayores ingresos su familia pueda gozar de una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas.
texts.en:
Isabel is a person who has always been known to be a hard worker and she always wants to give her family a good quality of life and better financial stability. Isabel has 6 children of which 5 of them she raised as a single mother as head of the household, and later she married and had another child and from there they have been progressing together. While she was a single mother and head of family, because she had to raise her 5 children, she went through great adversities in her life having to work in harsh conditions that made her quality of life deteriorate enormously. Nonetheless, one day she made the decision to open a sewing workshop in her own home and from there she has been working more happily in work that she likes. In her workshop she offers services to third parties for resale, and thanks to the good quality of her work she has successfully gained a good client base. Because of the large number of orders that she has, one of the machines has broken-down, and this is why she is searching for a loan to give her the opportunity to be able to buy raw material and to fix her broken sewing machine. 

Isabel hopes that in this way her income will continue increasing, and she can have a larger production and be able to respond to all the orders from her customers. Furthermore, Isabel hopes that with higher income her family can enjoy a better quality of life and more economic opportunities.

loans.use: to purchase raw material and to fix her sewing machine that has broken

loans.name: Akeer

texts.en:
Akeer lives in bor. She sells from a food stall and has been in business for three years. She is 29 year old, married, and has four children, two of whom are still in school. 

Akeer heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her fourth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2,000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase sugar and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and rice to sell.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en: Tatyana is married. She owns a retail business, selling clothing at Kosmicheskiy market in Zaporozhye. She has been in this business for 13 years. Low prices and not much competition help Tatyana to succeed.  Having a large variety of goods helps her to attract new and repeat customers. She tracks her expenses and profits well and always knows when she needs to purchase more inventory. Tatyana is asking for a loan to help her purchase a new collection of swimming suits for the coming summer season.

loans.use: to purchase a new collection of swimming suits.

Aruai heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her fourth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2,000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and onions to sell.

Nyandeng heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase wheat flour and sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz Marina de 41 años de edad, madre de tres hijos tiene como profesion el ser Ingeniera Agronoma. Actualmente labora para una empresa del estado, desempeñandose en el cargo de Archivo Contable. Junto a su esposo el cual tiene como oficio la soldadura y quien le apoya con los gastos del hogar,han podido alcanzar las metas propuestas. Luz es una mujer muy activa y como objetivo esta la construccion de su casa, motivo por el cual acude a Afodenic ya que con las obligaciones y gastos del hogar aparte con los altos costos de los mismos materiales, su salario no le rinde para llevar a cabo de una vez la obra. Hoy con este siendo su primer ciclo de credito y el cual se siente muy afortunada de pertenecer a la gran familia de kiva, comprara: Laminas de zinc, perlines, puertas de madera, golozos, soldaduras entre otros y asi cambiar el techo de su casa que es su principal inquietud en estos momentos ya que se aproxima el invierno y no quiere que se le pase el agua. Manifiesta que atraves de la misma mejora obtendra mejores condiciones de vida y salud para sus pequeños que es su fin primordial.
texts.en: Luz Marina is 41 years old and the mother of three children.  She is an agriculturist by profession.  She is currently working for a state enterprise and is responsible for Accounting Archives. Her husband is a welder by trade and helps her with the household expenses.  Together they have been able to achieve their goals.  Luz is a very active woman and her goal is the construction of her home. She came to Afodenic because the cost of building materials is high, and after paying her obligations and household expenses, she does not have enough of her salary left to complete the work all at once.  This is her first loan cycle and she feels very fortunate to belong to the great Kiva family.  She will purchase zinc sheets, purlins, wooden doors, screws, solder, and other materials to replace her home’s roof.  This is her main concern right now because winter is approaching and she doesn’t want any water leaking through. Making this home improvement will enable her children to be healthy and have better living conditions, which is her primary goal.

loans.use: to replace her home's roof.

loans.name: Agot

texts.en:
Agot lives in bor. She sells from a food stall and has been in business for three years. She is 36 years old, married, and has five children, four of whom are still in school. 

Agot heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her fourth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2,000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and onions to sell.

loans.name: Niaz Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Niaz bibi, age 27 years, is married and the mother of two sons. Both of her sons are too young to attend to school. She offers her services as a seamstress in her community. She sews clothes by receiving orders from her community clients. She does this work on a part time basis, but now her work is in demand, so she is deciding to adopt it as a full time business. 

She is also a very caring lady. She is growing up her children with great care and discipline so they make their parents proud. Her husband is a talented man. He operates a computer repairing shop where he repairs computers and also sells computer accessories. His customers are very satisfied because of his good work and they can trust him. 
 
Niaz has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He will invest the loan in the buying of computer accessories and repairing tools so he will be able to uplift his business and improve his income. She is hopeful that her husband’s business will be established further after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy computer accessories and repairing tools.

loans.name: Yar

texts.en:
Yar lives in bor. She sells from a food stall and has been in business for two years. She is 30 years old, married, and has five children, three of whom are still in school. 

Yar heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase sugar and milk. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and milk to sell.

Adut heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1,000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

texts.en:
Amer lives in bor. She sells fish and has been in business for three years. She is 30 years old, married, and has five children, four of whom are still in school.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Wilson De Jesus

texts.es:
Wilson es una persona muy trabajadora que ha logrado superar grandes dificultades que le ha presentado la vida. Casado y con 2 hijos de 5 y 10 años de edad, Wilson se vio en la obligación de abandonar su municipio natal debido a las pocas oportunidades que encontraba para generar los ingresos que requería para sostener su hogar. Fue así como se desplazó hasta el municipio de Medellín junto con su familia y allí con gran esfuerzo empezó a estudiar diferentes posibilidades de negocio para comenzar a generar sus ingresos. Luego de pensar en muchas alternativas surgió la idea de tener un puesto de venta de papas y platanitos fritos; además encontró un lugar donde es muy concurrido tanto por estudiantes como por comerciantes de la zona, lo que hizo que se volviera muy atractiva la idea. Wilson ya lleva algunos meses con su negocio montado y este ha venido creciendo mucho gracias al esfuerzo que hace por posicionarlo y ofrecer a sus clientes un buen servicio. Y gracias a este esfuerzo que ha hecho, Wilson busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de un carro para preparar fritos para generar un empleo en su negocio, ya que la demanda de sus productos es superior a la capacidad que tiene Wilson para atenderla. 

De esta manera su negocio seguirá creciendo y Wilson podrá tener mayores ingresos para su hogar, de tal manera que su familia podrá gozar de una mejor calidad de vida y poco a poco irá cumpliendo su sueño de sacar sus 2 hijos adelante brindándoles una buena educación.
texts.en:
Wilson is a very hardworking person who has succeeded in overcoming the great difficulties he has encountered in life. He is married with two children, 5 and 10 years old. Wilson found he had to abandon the town where he was born due to scarce job opportunities to support his family. Thus, he, together with his family, moved to Medellín. Through a lot of effort, he began studying different business possibilities for earning a living. After considering many alternatives the idea of having a stall selling fried potatoes and plantains emerged. He found a place that was much frequented both by students and local merchants, which made the idea very attractive.

Wilson has now had his business set up for several months and it has been growing steadily thanks to the work he has done in positioning it and providing his customers good service. Thanks to these efforts, he is now  looking for a loan that will provide the means of purchasing another cart to prepare fried food and to hire an employee, since the demand for his products is greater than he is able to meet on his own.

In this way his business will continue growing and Wilson will be able to earn more income for his home. Consequently his family will be able to enjoy a better quality of life and he will slowly be able to fulfill his dream of moving his children forward by providing them a good education.

loans.use: to purchase a cart to prepare fried food and to hire an employee for his business, since the demand for his products is greater than he is able to meet on his own.

loans.name: Aluel

texts.en:
Aluel lives in Dokuru bor. She sells food at a stall, and has been in business for three years. She is 40 years old, married, and has five children: three of them are still in school. 

Aluel heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans and sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Akuany

texts.en:
Akuany lives in bor. She sells charcoal and has been in business for two years. She is 40 years old, married, and has five children, all of whom are still in school. 

Akuany heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1,000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Munawar's Group

texts.en:
Munawar is a widow. She lost her husband a few years ago as a result of sudden death. She is a mother of one son who is too young to attend school. To afford their living expenses, Munawar operates a clothes sales business. She sells clothes to her community clients for a profit. Her clothes collection is in great demand among her customers. 

After the death of her husband, she shifted to her brother’s home. She didn’t want to become a burden on her brother, and that’s why she started this business. Her brother runs a small restaurant in the community market. Munawar also helps him by preparing food for his restaurant. 

She has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her clothes sales business. She will invest the loan in buying clothes in larger quantities of a better quality for selling. She is hopeful that her business will be improved a lot after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy clothes for her clothes sales business.

loans.name: Yar

texts.en:
Yar lives in bor. She sells charcoal and has been in business for two years. She is 32 years old, married, and has five children, three of whom are still in school. 

Yar heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1,500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Guet

texts.en:
Guet lives in bor. She sells fish and has been in business for three years. She is 30 years old, married, and has four children, three of whom are still in school. 

Guet heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1,000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Antonio Jose

texts.es:
Antonio tiene un taller de fabricación y reparación de calzado con el cual genera los ingresos para su hogar donde convive con su esposa y su hijo de 4 años. Antonio anteriormente trabajaba como jornalero, pero se cansó de este trabajo y la mala remuneración que tenía y desde allí montó su taller de fabricación y reparación de calzado. Gracias a los buenos productos que tiene, Antonio ha logrado captar un gran número de clientes, lo que le ha permitido tener muy buenas ventas y progresar rápidamente con su taller. Debido a que actualmente tiene muy baja capacidad de producción comparada con la demanda que hay en el mercado por sus productos, Antonio busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de una máquina industrial para la fabricación del calzado y así aumentar su capacidad de producción y poder responder a los pedidos de sus clientes.

Antonio de esta manera podrá responder a todos los pedidos de sus clientes y así tendrá unos mejores ingresos para su hogar. Además, Antonio espera que con mayores ingresos su familia pueda gozar de una mejor calidad de vida y su hijo de 4 años el acceso a una educación de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Antonio has a workshop where he makes and repairs shoes. This business generates an income for his family; he lives with his wife and their four-year-old. Antonio used to work as a day labourer, but he got tired of the work and the bad pay, so he opened his workshop. Thanks to the good results he has obtained, Antonio has been able to capture a large customer base which has provided him with very good sales. His business has developed rapidly. Because his production capacity is currently very low compared to the market demand for his products, Antonio needs a loan in order to buy an industrial machine for making shoes; this will increase his production capacity and allow him to fill his customers' orders.
This will allow Antonio to respond to all of his customers' orders, and he will therefore have more income for his household. Furthermore, Antonio hopes that this additional income will allow his family to enjoy a better quality of life, and allow his four-year-old to access a higher quality education.

loans.use: to buy an industrial machine for making shoes in order to increase production capacity to respond to orders.

loans.name: Jessenia

texts.es: Jessenia, de 23 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y con muchas ganas de superación. Es conviviente con Michel quien es comerciante y padre de su hijo Moisés de 3 años de edad.  Vive en compañía de su pareja e hijos, habitando cómodamente la casa de su propiedad que logró comprar con mucho esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza Jessenia es la preparación y venta de dulces como tortas y kekes que aprendió a preparar gracias a las enseñanzas de su madre, elaborando unos deliciosos kekes, rosquillas, pancitos y otros, para luego venderlos desde su casa y de forma ambulante. Comenzó con un préstamo particular y ahorros de su pareja para preparar y vender sus dulces, teniendo éste negocio  desde hace más 7 años. Asimismo vende frutas, pero por las constantes lluvias lo ha dejado momentáneamente para luego retomarlo. Le agrada su negocio pues le permite tener un ingreso económico para solventar la manutención de sus hijos, además de tener una ocupación ya que no tuvo la oportunidad de terminar sus estudios. Ahora desea invertir su capital y abrir una pequeña bodega de abarrotes en su casa. Este será el préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida por la oportunidad brindada de tener una línea de crédito para alcanzar sus objetivos. Además comenta sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal pues conoce a la mayoría de sus miembros y los considera ser personas responsables y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para la preparación de dulces como azúcar, aceite, harina, almidón, mantequilla y otros a precio por mayor para así tener mejores márgenes de ganancias.
texts.en:
Jessenia, age 23, is a hardworking woman who has tremendous desire to succeed. She is in a common-law relationship with Michel, who is a merchant and the father of their three-year-old son Moisés. Jessenia lives comfortably with her partner and child in their own home which they purchased through much effort. Her business involves preparing and selling sweets such as cakes and cupcakes. She learned how to prepare these treats from her mother. Jessenia makes delicious cupcakes, donuts, sweet rolls, and other items to sell from her home and as a traveling merchant. She utilized a personal loan and her partner's savings to begin preparing and selling sweets. Her business has been in existence for more than seven years. In addition, Jessenia sells fruits, but the constant rains have halted her momentarily, so she will resume this activity later. She is grateful that her business allows her to earn an income for supporting her children and that she has a career since she did not have the opportunity to finish her studies. Now she wants to invest her capital and open a small grocery store in her home.

This will be her second loan with the MFP organization. She is grateful to have the opportunity to access a line of credit for accomplishing her goals. In addition, Jessenia says that she feels comfortable with her Communal Bank because she knows most of the members and considers them to be responsible and supportive people. With the loan of 1,500 PEN that she requested, Jessenia will invest in the purchase of ingredients for preparing sweets such as sugar, oil, flour, starch, butter, and other items in bulk so that she will have better profit margins.

loans.use: to buy sugar, oil, flour, starch, and butter.

loans.name: Consorcia

texts.en:
Consorcia is from the village of Capatan. She lives with her spouse and four children. The family operates a business making and selling cacao balls and peanut butters ideal for sandwich spreads. The couple owns an oven used in making/cooking cacao balls and peanut butter. From their income, they have also purchased a motorcycle for transporting their products. They have been involved in this line of business for five years and usually earn about P20,000 each month. She is now asking for a loan of P25,000 to buy sugars, cooking oil, cacao balls, and peanut butter to sell and plastic jars used in packaging.

She hopes to earn consistent profits from the business and keep earning funds to invest in another source of income, like backyard hog-raising. Consorcia would like to become a successful entrepreneur in order to surpass poverty in life.

loans.use: to buy sugars, cooking oil, cacao balls, and peanut butter to sell and plastic jars used in packaging.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Map

texts.en:
Map is 38 years old and her husband Vandoeun is 46 years old.  They live in a village about 25 kilometers from the city of Phnom Penh and have four daughters - three attend school and another one is still young. 

Map and her husband are rice farmers. In addition to this, her husband is a fisherman and a motor taxi driver. Map is asking for a loan in the amount of $300 to buy fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm.

Photo: Map is pictured at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm.

loans.name: Asmahan

texts.en:
Asmahan is a 42-year-old married woman, and a mother of three sons and three daughters.  Her husband is a worker who earns a low salary which is not enough to cover the family's needs and costs.

For the past seven years, Asmahan has been operating a grocery store, which has been a profitable project for the family.

Asmahan is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing necessary groceries that customers usually request, such as flour, milk, rice, etc. This will help to increase sales and improve the family's income.

Asmahan and her husband appear in the picture, which was taken in her grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase necessary groceries to sell in her grocery store

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia is married with four children. All of her children are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education.  

To afford the family's living expenses and to pay her children's school fees, Shazia helps her husband in generating the income. She makes and sells samosas and pakodas (made with graham flour and flour). She sells her products to her community clients. She makes good earnings from her business. Her products are very well-known among local children.

Shazia’s husband operates a car oil sales business. He supplies the oil to different motor workshops and earns profits from it. He has been operating this business for more than 10 years.

Shazia has requested for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy oil in larger quantities to resell. She is hopeful about the positive financial growth of her husband’s business.

loans.use: To buy car oil to sell

loans.name: Yamileth

texts.es:
Yamileth se vio en la obligación de abandonar su municipio natal desde hace un largo tiempo en busca de mejores oportunidades laborales y mayores oportunidades económicas para ella y su familia. Yamileth se encuentra casada y tiene 4 hijos a quienes les ha querido ofrecer una buena calidad de vida. Con la necesidad de generar ingresos para contribuir en su hogar, Yamileth aprendió de su hermano la actividad de la compra de excedentes industriales de tela para venderlos en pequeñas cantidades a sus clientes, y de esta manera pudo montar su propio negocio para tener unos ingresos en su hogar. El negocio desde el momento en que lo han montado ha crecido mucho, y ahora su esposo le colabora en este para poder atender todos sus clientes. Con el ánimo de seguir ofreciendo buenos productos a sus clientes, Yamileth busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de excedentes industriales de tela para venderlos a sus clientes en pequeñas cantidades.

De esta manera, Yamileth podrá tener mayores ingresos para su hogar y podrá seguir obteniendo una buena calidad de vida para ella y su familia. Además, Yamileth espera que su negocio le cumpla el sueño de tener su casa propia y dejar de pagar los altos costos del arriendo.
texts.en:
Yamileth felt obligated to leave her hometown. For quite some time, she had been looking for better financial and work opportunities for herself and her family. Yamileth is married and has four children for whom she wants to offer a better quality of life. Since she needed to generate household income, Yamileth learned from her brother the business of buying industrial surplus fabrics that she can sell in small quantities to her customers. This enabled her to establish her own enterprise by which she could generate some income for her household. From the moment it started, her business has grown tremendously. Now her husband helps her by attending to all of her customers. Yamileth is excited about continuing to offer good products to her customers.

She is looking to access a loan so that she can buy industrial surplus fabrics to sell to her customers in small quantities. This will help Yamileth to generate more household income so that she can continue to provide a good quality of life for herself and her family. In addition, she hopes that her business will help her fulfill her dream of having a house of her own since the cost of rent is high.

loans.use: to buy industrial surplus fabrics that she can resell in smaller quantities.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is married and a mother of 8 children. Six of her children are getting an education at a nearby school while her remaining two work with their father in his shoe-making business.

Naseem's husband is very expert in his work and has been doing it for more than 15 years. He makes shoes to order and earns income for the family. Due to the quality of his work and its on-time completion, he has built a good image with his customers which helps him in getting orders every month. 

Naseem has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He will invest the loan in buying required material like leather, nails, shoelaces and shoe polish in larger quantities to make shoes to order and earn a better income. She is very confident that her husband’s business will be improved a lot after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy materials needed for a shoe-making business

loans.name: Sanaria's Group

texts.en:
Sanaria is a 27-year-old Iraqi woman.  She is engaged and will be married soon.

Living with her family, she wanted to start making use of her sewing skills, so two years ago she began to work on custom made dresses. She would like to be able to do more, offer more choices to her customers, and work more. 

To improve her small sewing business, Sanaria took a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq to buy a new sewing machine, an overlock sewing machine and make small improvements to her work area. 

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers group loans for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine, an overlock sewing machine and make small improvements to her work area

loans.name: Kaneez's Group

texts.en:
Kaneez is a housewife who spends her time staying at home and doing her household responsibilities. She is a mother of 5 children, 3 of whom study; the other 2 work to contribute financially to the family. 

Her husband is a driver and drives a rented rickshaw to provide transport services to passengers. Kaneez has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her husband buy a rickshaw.  This will help him provide better-quality transport services without any time limitation to passengers and will also help him buy a business asset.

Kaneez's husband has been operating his business for past 4 years and Kaneez is hopeful that an investment will help him improve his income and the financial situation of the family.

loans.use: To buy a rickshaw for transportation business

loans.name: Octavio De Jesus

texts.es:
Desde muy joven Octavio aprendió la actividad de la fabricación de calzado, gracias a que su padre trabajaba en una empresa de calzado y se la enseñó desde temprana edad. Al aprender la actividad decidió montar su propio taller de fabricación de calzado el cual tiene más de 25 años de experiencia, y con el cual ha sacado su familia adelante. Octavio se encuentra casado y tiene 4 hijos de quienes manifiesta son su mayor motivación para trabajar fuertemente en su negocio. En su taller se ha caracterizado por ofrecer a sus clientes una gran calidad en sus productos y ofrecer muy buenos precios, por lo que ha tenido la oportunidad de captar un gran número de clientes para su negocio. En la actualidad, su negocio tiene más demanda por parte de sus clientes que la capacidad con la que cuenta para responder esta, por lo que Octavio está trabajando fuertemente para poder nivelar su capacidad de producción. Adicional a esto, a Octavio se le ha averiado una de sus máquinas, por lo que busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la reparación de una de sus máquinas y la compra de materias primas para la fabricación del calzado.

Octavio espera seguir creciendo en su negocio y seguir teniendo un buen taller de fabricación de zapatos. Además, Octavio espera que de esta manera su familia siga teniendo una buena calidad de vida y sueña con generar varios empleos en su taller.
texts.en:
From a very young age, Octavio has worked as a shoemaker. His father worked in a cobbler shop and taught Octavio the craft. After learning from his father, Octavio decided to open his own shop, and he now has over 25 years of experience working as a cobbler. Octavio works very hard to provide for his wife and four children, as they are his main motivation. 

In his workshop, he is known for offering his clients high quality products and good prices. In fact, he does such good work, that demand for his services exceeds his ability to finish orders, so Octavio works extremely hard in order to increase his productivity. Recently, one of Octavio’s machines has broken, and he is requesting this loan in order to purchase the parts necessary to repair the machine. He also plans to utilize support from the loan to purchase raw materials for making shoes.  

Octavio hopes to continue growing and developing his business so that he can offer employment to others. He also hopes that, as a result of his hard work, his family can continue to enjoy a good quality of life.

loans.use: to repair one of his machines and purchase raw materials for making shoes.

loans.name: Sandra Marcela

texts.es:
Sandra desde que tenía tan solo 17 años de edad aprendió la actividad del corte y cepillado del cabello y el arreglo de uñas, por lo que decidió montar un salón de belleza y comenzar a generar sus propios ingresos. Meses después de haber montado su negocio, decidió enfocarse en la atención a niños, por lo que decidió montar un salón de belleza infantil donde ofrece todos sus servicios a los niños del sector. Gracias al buen servicio que ofrece en su salón de belleza, sus clientes se incrementaron considerablemente en muy poco tiempo, y esto le ha permitido tener una mejor calidad de vida tanto a ella como a su familia. Ya hace aproximadamente 8 años que tiene su salón de belleza y este hasta la fecha ha crecido notablemente, y es por esto que Sandra busca seguir prestando un buen servicio. Con el ánimo de realizar algunas remodelaciones, Sandra busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de espejos, cepillos, tijeras, entre otros implementos de trabajo para renovar poco a poco su salón de belleza.

De esta manera renovará su espacio de trabajo y así será más atractivo para sus clientes. Además, que así podrá generar mayores ingresos y seguir cumpliendo poco a poco su sueño de tener un gran salón de belleza donde pueda generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas y desde el cual pueda tener un futuro económico estable y mayores oportunidades de progreso.
texts.en:
Since she was only 17 years old, Sandra has been learning the activity of cutting and grooming hair and doing manicures and pedicures, which is why she decided to set up a beauty salon and start generating her own income. Months after she set up her business, she decided to focus on providing the service for children, reason why she decided to set up a beauty salon for children where she offers all the services to the kids in the area. Thanks to the good service she offers at her salon, her customers increased considerably in a short period of time, and this has allowed her and her family to enjoy a better standard of living. It's been approximately 8 years since she opened her beauty salon and up to date it has noticeably grown, this is why Sandra wants to continue to provide a good service. With the purpose of making some remodeling, Sandra is looking for a loan to give her the opportunity to be able to afford mirrors, brushes and scissors, among other implements she uses at work, in order to little by little, renovate her beauty salon.
In this way she will renovate her workspace and it will become more appealing to her customers. Also, she will be able to generate a higher income and continue to accomplish her dream of having a big beauty salon where she can generate employment for the people who are in need and from which she can have a stable financial future and more opportunities to progress.

loans.use: to purchase mirrors, brushes, scissors, among other implements to renovate little by little her beauty salon

loans.name: Janeth

texts.es:
Janeth, de 21 años de edad, es una mujer alegre y cordial, además de trabajadora y empeñosa, con muchas ganas de progresar. Es soltera sin hijos.  Vive en compañía de su madre y sus 3 hermanos, habitando cómodamente la casa de su madre. La actividad que realiza Janeth es la venta de ropa confeccionadas por su madre, tanto de damas, caballeros y niños. Todos estos productos se los confecciona su madre en su pequeño taller en su casa y  ella se  encarga de venderlos entre sus familiares, amistades y vecinos, a quienes atiende de manera cordial y amable, logrando ganarse su preferencia, de esa manera ellos la recomiendan con otras personas, que al cabo de un tiempo se vuelven también sus clientes habituales. Tiene más de 3 años dedicándose a éste negocio y hasta el momento tiene el apoyo de su mamá quien le ayuda confeccionándole las prendas de vestir a pedido de sus clientes.
Considera su negocio bastante rentable por la demanda que tiene estos productos y las buenas ganancias que le deja. Le gusta su negocio ya que le genera ingresos económicos que le sirvieron para pagarse sus estudios superiores, apoyar a sus hermanos menores con sus estudios y los gastos de su hogar; y además de atender a las personas de manera amable, logrando ganarse una clientela regular. Por otro lado tiene planes de planes de formalizar su negocio y hacerlo crecer. Este será el préstamo número 5 con la institución MFP. Está muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado se siente a gusto con su banco comunal, pues  considera un grupo unido y solidario.
Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de materiales de costura como hilos, telas, elásticos y otros, para confeccionar ropa de damas, caballeros y niños, buscando precios más bajos por sus compras al contado y en volumen.
texts.en:
Janeth, age 21, is a cheerful and friendly woman. In addition, she is an industrious and hard worker who greatly desires to make progress. Janeth is single and does not have children. She lives comfortably with her mother and her three siblings in a house that her mother owns. Janeth sell women's, men's, and children's clothing that is produced by her mother. Her mother makes all of these garments from a small workshop in their home. Janeth is in charge of selling the clothes to relatives, friends, and neighbors. She attends to her customers in a cordial and friendly manner, thus gaining their loyalty. As a result, Janeth has been referred to other people who have also turned into repeat customers. She has been in this business for more than three years. Janeth currently has the support of her mother, who helps by producing the garments that have been requested by her customers.

Janeth considers her business to be profitable because of the adequate demand for her products and the good profits she has earned. She enjoys her business because she is able to earn an income to pay for her higher education, support the studies of her younger siblings, and cover the household expenses. By treating people in a friendly manner, Janeth has achieved a steady clientele. Her plans are to formalize her business and make it grow.

This will be her fifth loan with the MFP organization. She is very pleased to know that she will have financial support for advancing her business. Janeth feels comfortable with her Communal Bank because it is a unified and supportive group. The amount of 2,000 PEN that she requested will be invested in sewing materials such as thread, fabrics, elastics, and other supplies for making women's, men's, and children's clothes. This will help her buy at lower prices because she can make bulk purchases and pay with cash.

loans.use: to buy thread, fabrics, elastics, and other supplies for making clothes.

loans.name: Focion Tulio

texts.es:
Focion es una persona que ha tenido que atravesar por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo, sus ganas de salir adelante le ha permitido superar las dificultades y seguir progresando en su vida. Focion es un padre soltero de su hijo de 10 años, pues su madre los abandonó hace un tiempo y debido a esto se vio en la obligación de garantizar el sustento necesario para su hogar. En un momento se quedó desempleado y debido a la urgencia  de generar ingresos para su hogar buscó a unos amigos suyos que tenían sus propios negocios. Uno de ellos se dedicaba a la compra y venta de cosechas de verduras, y le enseñó la actividad a Focion para que se dedicara a esto. Focion trabajó para el como empleado durante un tiempo mientras aprendía en su totalidad como se manejaba el negocio, y una vez aprendida la actividad montó su propio negocio para generar sus propios ingresos. Desde entonces, Focion viene trabajando en su negocio de compra y venta de verduras en el cual compra las cosechas a los campesinos y las vende en la plaza de mercado de su municipio, y gracias a esta actividad genera los ingresos necesarios para su hogar. Con el ánimo de aprovechar algunos buenos precios, Focion busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de verduras al por mayor para ofrecerlas a sus clientes y así aprovechar los buenos precios de la temporada.

De esta manera, podrá acceder a precios bajos que se están ofreciendo en el momento y podrá tener un mayor margen de ganancia. Además, podrá seguir teniendo los ingresos que requiere para su hogar y su hijo tendrá acceso a una buena calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Focion has had to overcome much adversity in his life, but, as he is a hardworking and determined man, he has been able to face those challenges. Focion is a single father, and has a son who is 10 years old. His wife left them some time ago, and so Focion provides the only source of income for the family. At one time, Focion was out of work and was urgently seeking employment to provide for his son, so he worked temporarily as an employee for a couple of his friends who had businesses. His friends taught him their trades, and Focion learned how to run a business, which eventually led him to open his own business and to generate more income.

Since that time, Focion has made a living buying and selling vegetables. He buys produce from various farmers and then sells the products in the local market. Thanks to this work, he is able to make a living and provide for his son and home. In order to take advantage of seasonally low prices, Focion is requesting a loan that will allow him to purchase vegetables in bulk and offer them to his clients.

With these special wholesale prices, Focion will be able to garner a better margin from his resale of the products. The support from the loan will also allow him to continue making a decent wage and offer his son a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables in bulk for resale, and to take advantage of seasonally low prices.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana se encuentra casada y tiene 3 hijos a quienes les ha querido ofrecer una buena educación. Debido a que los ingresos de su esposo no son suficientes para el sostenimiento de su hogar, Liliana se vio en la obligación de conseguir un empleo, y fue así como comenzó a trabajar como empleada doméstica en algunas casas. En una de ellas, se encontró con que una empleadora suya le enseñó a trabajar la actividad de la venta de productos de uso personal, y gracias a esto ha montado su propio negocio y lo viene trabajando en su tiempo libre; de esta manera genera ingresos adicionales para poder contribuir económicamente para el sostenimiento de su hogar, además de que así se paga sus estudios, pues está validando sus estudios de secundaria. Liliana de esta manera se ha encontrado con una mejor calidad de vida para ella y para su familia y por esto quiere seguir continuando con su negocio. Con el fin de aprovechar algunos precios de sus productos, Liliana busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de productos de uso personal al por mayor para aprovechar los buenos precios de su proveedor y tener así un mayor margen de ganancia.

Liliana de esta manera podrá seguir ofreciendo buenos productos a sus clientes, a buenos precios y tener un buen margen de ganancia, con lo que sus ingresos aumentarán considerablemente y su familia podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida. Su sueño es seguir progresando con su familia, sacar sus 3 hijos adelante y terminar sus estudios de secundaria para estudiar alguna carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Liliana is married and is the mother of three children who she loves very much and for whom she wants to provide an education and bright future. As her husband’s wages are low and not sufficient to cover their household expenses, Liliana began working as a maid cleaning houses. In one of those homes, her employer taught her how to be a personal care products saleswoman. Thanks to that opportunity, Liliana started her own business, which she maintains in her free time. This retail business has allowed her to generate additional income for her home and studies, since she is completing her secondary school education. 

Liliana has found a way to increase the quality of life for herself and her family, and she wants to continue her retail business. Liliana is requesting a loan so that she can purchase personal care products in bulk and receive lower prices and greater profit margins.

Liliana wants to continue offering high quality products to her clients at good prices, and she desires to continue providing for her family’s needs. Her dream is to give her three children a good education, finish her own high school studies, and eventually pursue a career in a university.

loans.use: to purchase personal care products in bulk and take advantage of seasonally low prices from her product distributor.

loans.name: Sandra Ines

texts.es: Sandra es una persona muy luchadora que ha podido superar grandes adversidades que se le han presentado en la vida. Sandra se encuentra casada y tiene 2 hijos, de los cuales 1 de ellos en una hija que tiene una discapacidad y debe cuidar todo el tiempo. Desde el momento en que nació su hija con discapacidad, Sandra ha venido superando grandes obstáculos en su vida, los cuales le han enseñado a tener fortaleza y luchar siempre por lo que quiere. En una fundación donde contribuyen con el servicio de salud de su hija, Sandra aprendió la elaboración de artesanías como títeres, muñecos, bolsas de regalo, entre otros, y con el dinero que genera vendiendo estos productos puede comprar la droga que requiere su hija, ya que es bastante costosa. Es por esto que Sandra quiere que su negocio siga saliendo adelante y pueda seguir teniendo una fuente de ingresos con la cual pueda comprar el medicamento de su hija, por lo que busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de materias primas como telas, papeles, entre otros para la elaboración de sus artesanías, y seguir teniendo ingresos para pagar el costo de los medicamentos de su hija.
texts.en:
Sandra is a hardworking woman who has overcome many challenges in life. She is married and has a son and a daughter. Her daughter has a disability that requires full time care and supervision. From the day her daughter was born with this disability, Sandra has constantly been confronted with challenges and hardships. Over time, however, she has learned to persevere and always fight for what she needs.

Sandra learned to make crafts at a foundation that contributes to her daughter’s health care, and she currently works making and selling items such as puppets, dolls, gift bags and other crafts. With the money that she earns, Sandra is able to purchase the expensive medicine her daughter needs. She is requesting this loan in order to be able to purchase raw materials for making her crafts, such as fabric, paper and other items. Sandra works hard so that her daughter can receive proper care and medicine. Sandra’s daughter is her motivation to continue with her business and to continue generating income.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as fabric, paper, etc for making crafts, and to continue generating income to pay for her daughter's medical costs.

loans.name: Claudia Maria

texts.es:
Claudia ha tenido que superar muchas adversidades en su vida, pero gracias a sus ganas de trabajar y ganas de salir adelante ha podido superar estas dificultades y seguir progresando en su vida. Claudia es una madre soltera cabeza de familia de su hijo de 6 años debido a que se divorció de su esposo hace un tiempo, por tanto, Claudia debe garantizar unos ingresos en su hogar con los cuales pueda tener una buena calidad de vida para su hijo. Por enseñanza de su ex esposo aprendió el mantenimiento de computadores y montó un café Internet donde ofrece estos servicios a sus clientes. En su café Internet se ha caracterizado por ofrecer una buena atención a sus clientes y esto le ha permitido tener una gran clientela para su negocio. La gran ventaja con la que cuenta Claudia es que sabe realizar el mantenimiento de los equipos de su café Internet, por lo que no tiene que incurrir en altos costos para pagarle a alguna persona que le realice esta actividad. Aprovechando sus conocimientos, y debido a que requiere reparar un equipo de su café Internet, Claudia busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de los repuestos que requiere para realizar el mantenimiento de un equipo de su café Internet.

De esta manera su negocio seguirá prestando un buen servicio a sus clientes y así podrá seguir teniendo unos ingresos que le garanticen una buena calidad de vida. Claudia sueña con seguir teniendo un buen negocio y que este le permita en algún momento comprar una casa propia para ofrecerle a su hijo una mayor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Claudia has had to overcome many hardships in her life, but thanks to her strong work ethic and desire to get ahead, she has been able to meet those challenges and continue growing as a person. Claudia is a single mother of a 6-year-old son, and is the head of her family. She and her husband divorced some time ago, and therefore, she has to make a living to support her son. She learned computer maintenance from her ex-husband, and so she started up an internet café where she offers clients various services.

It is well known that Claudia is attentive to the needs of her customers, and that her café has a good atmosphere. She has a large client base and is very successful, since she is friendly and knows how to repair and maintain the computers and machines. Her technical knowledge allows her to keep her repair and maintenance costs down.

Claudia is requesting a loan that will allow her to purchase the necessary spare parts to repair a computer. She plans to utilize all her technical skills, but cannot complete successful repairs without the required replacement parts.

With the support from this loan she hopes to continue her business and her source of income for her family. Claudia’s dream is to grow and develop her business, and to one day buy her own house so that she can give her son a better quality of live and a better future.

loans.use: to purchase necessary parts for repairing computers at her internet cafe.

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
Asuncion's business is sewing curtains and tablecloths as well as school and office uniforms. Her customers are mainly students and teachers. She's been in business for more than seven years and earns about 3000 PHP a month. She also raises hogs to sell for additional income.

Asuncion would like to improve her sewing services so she is asking for a loan of 15000 PHP to buy fabric, thread and needles. Part of the loan will also be used to maintain the hog raising business. She would like to have a stable source of income. 

Asuncion is now 44 years old and has four children, two of whom are attending school and in need of daily allowances. She hopes to give them the best education so they can to achieve a better way of living some day.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread and needles.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en: Rosie is 39 years old and is married. She has been blessed with five children. Rosie lives in the village of Cutog Grande with her family. She has been involved in raising hogs for three years. She earns about PHP 7,000 per head. Rosie wants to raise more hogs but she lacks the necessary capital. In this regard, Rosie is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 35,000 to buy feed, vaccine and additional hogs to raise. Despite the hardships of life, she is striving hard to earn and save for education purposes.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccine and additional hogs to raise

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli lives with her husband and eight children. She is a hardworking individual who's very dedicated to her business. She has a piggery business and has been in operation for more than six years.

She wants to increase her sales and income to improve her family's living conditions. She's requesting a loan of 9000 PHP to buy feed and vitamins for her two current pigs. She hopes this will nourish them so she can sell them at a higher price.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her two pigs.

loans.name: Sergio Alberto

texts.es:
Sergio se encuentra casado y tiene 2 hijos de quienes manifiesta son su mayor motivación para trabajar fuertemente en su negocio. Sergio anteriormente trabajaba en una empresa de fabricación de calzado, sin embargo, cansado de tener tan baja remuneración por su trabajo decidió montar su propio negocio de fabricación de calzado. Además, su esposa también es muy emprendedora y decidió montar un negocio de videojuegos y venta de comidas rápidas, y gracias a estos dos negocios generan los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar. Sergio, gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos ha logrado captar una gran cantidad de clientes para su negocio, y esto le ha garantizado tener muy buenas ventas. Gracias a un gran pedido que tiene, Sergio busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de suela de caucho para la fabricación de un gran pedido que le han hecho.

De esta manera, Sergio podrá tener mayores ingresos y su familia podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida y les podrá ofrecer mayores oportunidades económicas.
texts.en:
Sergio is married and has two children who are his greatest motivation to work hard on his business.  Sergio used to work in a shoe-making business, however, tired of receiving such low pay for his work he decided to start his own shoe-making business.  His wife is also very entrepreneurial and she decided to start a videogame business and to sell fast food.  Thanks to these two businesses they earn enough income to sustain their household expenses.  Sergio, thanks to the good quality of his products, has managed to get a large quantity of customers for his business and this has guaranteed very good sales.  Thanks to a large order that he has he is requesting a loan that will give him the opportunity to purchase rubber soles to manufacture this large order that has been made with him.  

In this way Sergio will be able to have better income and his family will be able to have a better quality of life and he can offer them better economic opportunities.

loans.use: to buy rubber soles for the manufacture of a large order.

loans.name: Johnard

texts.en:
Johnard sells fish and meat such as pork and chicken in his village. He is using his motorcycle to sell house to house. He also goes to the other village just to add to his sales and profit every day. He patiently does these activities because of his three children who are currently studying.

Now, he wants to increase his profit through adding more goods to offer but he has insufficient funds to purchase everything he wants to buy. For this reason, Johnard is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy fish and meat.

loans.use: to buy fish and meat

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia, 34, is married and the mother of two young children who don’t attend school. Shazia is a very caring woman who stays at home as a housewife and does her household responsibilities. She is raising her children with great care and discipline. 
Her husband is an electrician by profession and operates an electric shop in the community market where he services electric items and provides repairing services to the customers. He is well-known among his customers for his work and good behavior. He has been operating his business for over eight years. 
Shazia has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy electric items such as bulbs, tube lights and some repairing tools to help make his work more effective. Shazia is very hopeful that the loan would improve the financial position of her husband’s business.

loans.use: to buy electric items and repairing tools.

loans.name: Lailanie

texts.en: Lailanie, 42, is married and lives in the village of Santa Isabel, province of Isabela. Her farming business provides for her family. She is a hardworking mother and she makes sure she can meet the daily needs of her family. She is asking for a loan of PHP 21,000 to buy feed and vitamins for her pig. In the future, Lailanie hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her farming business.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita, aged 51, stays at home for the welfare of her piggery business. She raises pigs and sell them after 4-5 months. This serves as her recreation from staying at home and yet she is still producing income through her business. However, she wishes her income was higher. To increase her profit, she is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy feeds, vitamins, and medicine. She hopes that her request would be approved in order to have better quality living conditions.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and medicine

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 48 years old and is married with four children. She has been involved in raising hogs for over two years. She earns about PHP 1,000 for each hog, a very minimal income. Norma wants her current hogs to be healthier and well-nourished.

Norma is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy feed and an additional hog to raise. She is enduing hardships in this business but still remains strong to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy feed and an additional hog to raise.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita, 47, is a hardworking person who is raising children and operating a livestock business. She has chickens, ducks and pigs. Lolita is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy vitamins and feed for her livestock. Lolita hopes that someday her business expands to meet all the needs of her family and also so she can renovate their house to have good living conditions.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and feed for her business.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en: Narcisa is 46 years old and married to Ronilo and has four grown children. Narcisa is a very diligent person and loving woman for her family. She runs a store that sells different products. She is asking for a loan of PHP 24,000 to buy additional products to sell in their village and increase her income so that she can sustain her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy spices, drinks and snack food for her store.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma a 47-year-old woman with three school-aged children from the village of Santa Isabel province of Isabela. She has been engaged in a hog raising business for 30 years. She is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy feed and piglets for her business in order to have additional income so that she can provide for the needs of her family. 

In the future, Vilma hopes that she can expand her business and renovate their house.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy motorized farming equipment.

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Lay (in the photo), age sixty-one, is a farmer. Her husband stays at home. She has two sons and one daughter. One has full-time employment, one is a security guard and another one is a soldier. The family lives in a village about eight kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Lay grows banana, papaya and mango. She is requesting her first loan of an amount of $700 to buy a motorbike for her son who is a security guard so he can get to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her son to get to work.

loans.name: Sothea

texts.en:
Sothea is 40 years old and lives with her 42-year-old husband, Sarin, in suburb of Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1993 and have two sons and one daughter. Two of their children are garment workers and the third attends school.  

Sothea sells vegetable and meat and her husband is a security guard. She is asking for her first loan of $1,500 to buy a motorbike for her children to get work.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her children to get work.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda, aged 50, is from Catugan. She is married and works as a vegetable merchant and hog fattening business owner. She has been operating these businesses for over three years and is happy about the positive impact on their living situation. Her spouse also helps her in managing these sources of income in order to lessen her burden.

She is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 15,000 to buy vegetables to sell such as string beans, squash, root crops, and feed. This loan will help her to increase her profit because she will be able to satisfy customer demand, thus generating more income.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale such as string beans, squash, root crops, and feed

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en: Adelaida, a very hardworking mother of four, is married to Romeo. They live in the village of Santa Isabel province of Isabela. She dreams that someday she can renovate their house and all her children can finish their studies. In that matter, Adelaida is asking for a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy feed and piglets for her hog raising business so that she can provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets for her business.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita a 38 years old woman with determination and patient in all aspect of her life. She is engaged in selling products such as rice and spices in the people of their village. Carmelita is asking a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy additional rice and spices to offer in their village. She hopes that her business expands so that she can provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy rice and spices for her business.

loans.name: Lucely

texts.es:
Lucely es una persona muy luchadora que ha logrado superar grandes obstáculos que se le han presentado en su vida. Madre soltera cabeza de familia de 2 hijos de 15 y 17 años de edad, puesto que su esposo falleció hace aproximadamente 7 años, Lucely ha tenido que trabajar fuertemente todos los días para poder garantizar a sus hijos el sustento necesario para salir adelante y seguir progresando en su vida. Debido a que tenía que generar ingresos para su hogar, Lucely comenzó abriendo un negocio de venta de celulares, en el cual no le fue muy bien y luego de unos meses se vio en la obligación de cerrar. De allí, montó un negocio de venta de calzado, en el cual trabaja actualmente y el cual sigue creciendo gracias al empeño que le pone Lucely diariamente. En su negocio ha logrado tener muy buenas ventas, principalmente por la buena atención que ofrece, y esto le ha permitido que sus hijos puedan tener acceso a una buena educación. Debido a que su negocio ha ido creciendo, Lucely busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de legalizar su negocio pagando los registros necesarios y surtir su negocio con más calzado para la venta. 

De esta manera podrá tener menos inconvenientes a la hora de seguir comercializando sus productos y así podrá seguir creciendo cada vez más. Además, con mayores ingresos sus hijos podrán tener acceso a una educación universitaria que es el sueño de Lucely, el poder verlos hechos unos profesionales exitosos.
texts.en:
Lucely is truly a fighter who has been able to overcome great obstacles she has faced in her life.  She is a single mother and the head of her household of two children, who are 15 and 17, because of her husband's death seven years ago.  Lucely has had to work hard every day in order to ensure that her children have what they need to get ahead and keep making progress in their lives.  Because she had to generate income for her household, Lucely started out by opening a business selling cell phones, which did not go very well for her.  After a few months she had to close it.  Next, she opened a business selling shoes, which she currently works at and which is still growing, thanks to the effort Lucely puts in every day.  She has achieved good sales in her business, mainly because of her good customer service, and this has allowed her children to have access to a good education.  As her business has been growing, Lucely is looking for a loan to give her the opportunity to legalize her business by paying for the necessary registration and to stock her business with more shoes to sell.

This will allow her to have fewer problems when it comes to continuing to sell her products and will thus allow her to keep growing more and more.  Also, greater income will allow her children to have access to a college education, which is Lucely's dream--to be able to see them become successful professionals.

loans.use: to legalize her business by paying for the necessary registration and to stock her business with more shoes to sell

loans.name: Sareun

texts.en:
Sareun is a 60-year-old construction worker. His 58-year-old wife, Seun, stays at home and does housework. The elderly couple has been married since 1972 and have three daughters, two are garment workers and the third is in school. They live in a suburb of Phnom.

Sareun is requesting his first loan of $1,500 to buy a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Yasmina

texts.en:
Yasmina is a 51-year-old married woman from Al Zarqa, Amman, Jordan and a mother of two children.

Yasmina has a home-based project where she sells blankets and clothes and is requesting a loan of 600 JD to purchase more quantities for trading purposes.

Yasmina is looking to purchase a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase blankets and clothes for trading purposes

loans.name: Kaneez Fatima's Group

texts.en:
Kaneez Fatima, aged 47-years, married with three children.

Kaneez is a very caring housewife. She stays at home and manages the household works. She takes care of her family and tries her best to provide comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs. Her husband runs a canteen where he sells food items such as biscuits, chips, cold drinks, etc. to his customers and earns on profits. He makes good sales, which allows him to put three meals on the table for the family. 

Kaneez has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He will invest the loan in buying more edible items, in larger quantities, to put in his canteen for reselling. Kaneez is very sure that her husband’s income will be increased after the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy eatable items for canteen business.

loans.name: Misbah's Group

texts.en:
Misbah, aged-36 years, is married and has three children. All of her children are getting an education. To be able to afford the education expenses of her children, Misbah does sewing works. She wants to give her children a good education so they can secure their future and make their parents proud. Misbah works with great dedication and her family respects and loves her a lot for her efforts. 

Misbah's husband is a carpenter by profession. He makes furniture on orders and generates income for the family. Her brother in law also lives with her family and he is involved in a sweets sales business. His products are very famous amongst children. He sells Gachak (made with sugar and topping of almonds, peanuts) and sweet noodles. He makes good sales from his products. 

Misbah has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her brother in law’s business. He will invest the loan in buying required material such as sugar, cooking oil, dried fruits, etc. in larger quantities for making the products of better a quality to sell. 

Misbah is hopeful that her brother in law’s business will become more fruitful after the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy required material for sweets sales business.

loans.name: Aurenila

texts.en: To earn her living, Aurenila raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs to sell. She decided to establish her business in order to generate income instead of just lazing at home and doing household chores. She is 45 years old and she has three children. She would like to expand her business, but she has insufficient funds. Therefore she is asking for a loan of PHP 45,000 to buy vitamins, vaccines, and feed for the sustenance and proper growth of her hogs. She hopes this loan will be granted as it is her only chance to improve her business and her family's lives as well.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, vaccines, and feed for the sustenance and proper growth of her hogs.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia's primary source of income is her general store business. She is 57 years old and is married with one child. Her husband's name is Gilbert. He is a farmer in their village, where they generate their income. Lydia has been engaged in her sari-sari store for ninth months and she earns about PHP 300 a day. She wants to restock her retail store but she lacks the necessary capital.
