In this regard, Lydia is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, noodles, assorted bread, candies and soft drinks to sell. She hopes that in the future, she will make her business grow as she continues to manage her business well.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, assorted bread, candies, and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy staple items to stock his business and thereby offer a greater variety of products to his customers

loans.name: Khawlah

texts.en:
Khawla is a conservative woman who she is unwilling to upload her photo on the internet. The photo is of her husband.

Khawla is 45 years old and married. She lives in Irbid, Jordan and she is a mother of three children.

Khawla is looking to have a loan of 500 JD so she can buy more stationary and a camera.

loans.use: to buy stationary and a camera

loans.name: Sultan

texts.en:
Sultan is a 43-year-old married man form Idon, Irbid, Jordan and a father of five children.

Sultan has a mobile phone devices shop. He is requesting a loan of 1,000 JD to purchase more mobile phone devices for trading purposes.

Sultan is looking to improve his business and establish another branch.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phone devices to sell

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa es una madre soltera cabeza de familia de 2 hijos, pues su padre murió hace aproximadamente 6 años, dejando a Rosa viuda y a cargo de todas las obligaciones de su hogar. A pesar de esto, Rosa ha tenido mucha fortaleza para salir adelante con su familia y brindarles a sus hijos todo lo necesario, y gracias a esta fortaleza ha podido ir progresando poco a poco. En un principio, Rosa se dedicaba a las actividades del campo gracias a que sus padres se las enseñaron desde muy temprana edad, y posteriormente junto con su esposo siguió llevando a cabo estas actividades. Actualmente, Rosa se sigue dedicando a las actividades del campo, pues tiene 2 vacas lecheras las cuales ordeña y vende la leche al carro recolector que pasa diariamente por su vereda. Ahora que Rosa quiere seguir progresando, busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de dos vacas lecheras para aumentar su capacidad de producción y por ende aumentar sus ingresos.

De esta manera, su familia podrá tener acceso a unas mejores oportunidades económicas y por ende a una mejor calidad de vida. Además, sus 2 hijos podrán tener acceso a una educación de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Rosa is a single mother of two children whose father died approximately six years ago leaving Rosa a widow and in charge of all of the obligations of her household.  In spite of this, Rosa has had great strength in order to get ahead with her family and give her children everything they need.  Thanks to this strength she has been able to make progress, little by little.  From early on, Rosa worked in the countryside thanks to her parents who taught her this work from a very young age.  Later she continued working in these activities alongside her husband.  Currently, Rosa continues working in this area.  She has two milk cows which she milks and sells the milk to the collection car which passes along her road every day.  Now that Rosa wants to continue to make progress she is requesting a loan that will give her the opportunity to buy two milk cows to increase her production capacity and thus increase her income.

In this way her family will have access to better economic opportunities and thus a better quality of life.  Also, her children will be able to have access to a better quality education.

loans.use: to buy two milk cows to increase her production capacity and to increase her income.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 46 years old and married with five children. She lives in Irbid, Jordan.

Mariam is looking to have a loan of 500 JD to buy and sell cosmetics from her home.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a button machine and a flat machine to be able to keep developing her workshop and keep making profits.

loans.name: Kholoud

texts.en:
Kholoud is a 42-year-old married woman from Sahab, Jordan and a mother of three children.

Kholoud has a distingusished home-based business where she sells eggs. Now she is requesting a loan of 600 JD to purchase new egg incubators.

Kholoud is looking to improve her business so that she can increase her income and provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase egg incubators for her business

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is a responsible housewife, and she has found a way of creating extra income. She runs a business raising pigs to sell. She has done this for almost two years, and earns a profit of 7,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) per head sold. She uses this income for food, clothing and allowances for her two children.

Perlita would like to expand her business, but needs extra capital to do this.  She is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy pig feed, vaccinations and additional pigs to raise. Perlita plans to continue to to manage her business well, and believes that the loan will help her to improve and grow her business.

loans.use: to buy pig feed, vaccinations and additional pigs to raise

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es:
Gabriel es una persona que a tenido que atravesar por muchas dificultades en su vida, sin embargo, sus ganas de trabajar y salir adelante le han permitido superarlas y continuar progresando junto a su familia. Gabriel se encuentra casado y tiene 4 hijos y hace aproximadamente 3 meses fue despedido de su empleo, quedando sin la única fuente de ingresos con la que contaba su familia para poder pagar los gastos de su hogar. De forma individual aprendió la preparación de chorizos y chuzos y posteriormente se consiguió un carrito donde ofrece estos alimentos, y ahora sale todos los días por las calles de su municipio con el ánimo de vender sus alimentos para poder generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar. En este negocio le ha ido muy bien, sin embargo las dificultades no desaparecen, pues una noche cuando regresaba a su hogar luego de trabajar todo el día fue robado y el dinero de ese día se perdió por completo. A pesar de todo esto sigue trabajando fuertemente para poder sacar su familia adelante. Es por esto que busca que un préstamo le permita comprar una nevera, un fogón de gas e insumos para la preparación de sus comidas, y así ir creciendo poco a poco en su negocio.

De esta manera podrá ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes y sus ventas aumentarán considerablemente. Además, con mayores ingresos su familia podrá gozar de una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas para progresar.
texts.en:
Gabriel is someone who has had to get through many difficult times in his life but despite this his motivation to work hard and get ahead has allowed him to overcome them and continue moving forward with his family.  Gabriel is married and has four children.  About three months ago he was laid off from his job, leaving his family without the only source of income they had for paying their household expenses.  On his own he learned how to prepare chorizo (sausages) and chuzos (grilled, skewered meat) and later he acquired a food cart where he sells these foods and now goes out every day to the streets of his town hoping to sell his food in order to earn the income needed to sustain his household.  This business has gone well for him, however, the difficulties haven’t disappeared.  One night as he returned to his house after working all day he was robbed and lost all of the money from that day.  In spite of all this he continues working hard to get ahead with his family.  This is why he is requesting a loan that will allow him to buy a refrigerator, a gas burner, and supplies to prepare his food and continue growing his business little by little.  

In this way he will be able to offer better variety of products to his customers and his sales will increase considerably.  Also, with better income his family can enjoy a better quality of life and greater economic opportunities in the future.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, a gas burner, and supplies for food preparation to gradually grow his business.

loans.name: Montaha

texts.en:
Montaha is a convservative woman who is unwilling to upload a photo on the internet. The photo is of her husband.

Montaha is 31 years old and married with one child. She in Idon, Irbid, Jordan.

Montaha is looking to have a loan of 500 JD to buy and sell food, which will make her income increase.

loans.use: to buy food to sell in her store

loans.name: Paula Liliana

texts.es:
Paula aprendió la actividad de la crianza de cerdos desde muy temprana edad, pues su abuelo se dedicaba a esta actividad y se la enseñó desde muy joven, y gracias a esto Paula adquirió una gran experiencia. En un principio Paula trabajaba junto con su abuelo en la crianza de los cerdos, pero cuando murió Paula decidió montar su propio negocio para generar sus propios ingresos. Actualmente Paula se sigue dedicando a esta actividad y gracias a esta ha logrado formar una familia con 2 hijos de 3 años y 15 meses de nacido, y con su venta de cerdos genera ingresos con los cuales contribuye al sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar. Gracias a que tiene muy buenos pedidos por parte de sus clientes, Paula busca que un préstamo le permita comprar el alimento necesario para la crianza de los cerdos, y así poder ofrecerlos a sus clientes de buena calidad.

De esta manera Paula logrará vender sus cerdos a un buen precio y sus ingresos podrán ofrecerle a ella y a su familia una buena calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas. Paula sueña con tener un gran negocio y seguir creciendo para que junto con su familia puedan seguir progresando y asegurar un futuro económico estable.
texts.en:
Paula learned to work raising pigs from a very young age as her grandfather did this work and taught her from when she was very young.  Thanks to this, Paula gained a lot of experience.  Early on Paula worked together with her grandfather raising pigs but when he died Paula decided to start her own business to earn her own income.  Currently Paula continues to work at this and thanks to this work has been able to start a family with two children who are three-years-old and 15 months.  Wish her pig sales she earns income which she contributes to the household expenses thanks to having good orders from her customers.  Paula is requesting a loan that will allow her to buy the feed she needs to care for the pigs so that she can offer a good quality product to her customers.  

In this way Paula will be able to sell her pigs for a good price and her income will provide Paula and her family with a good quality of life and better financial opportunities.  Paula dreams of having a large business and of continuing to grow it so that alongside her family she can continue getting ahead and assure a financial future for them.

loans.use: to buy the feed needed for raising pigs to be able to offer customers a better quality product.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 60 years old, and is a very industrious woman. She is running a vegetable resale business, and also raises pigs. She cares for the pigs when she isn't able to sell vegetables in the market.  These activities are her ways of helping her family to improve their poor living standard.    

Imelda is asking for financial support from ASKI to improve the lives of her family members.  Her loan of 6,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) will be used to purchase vegetables, such as eggplant and beans, and also pig feed. She wants the loan so she can increase her income, and secure a more comfortable lifestyle for her family.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, such as eggplants and beans, and pig feed

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia lives with her family in the village of Pulay, in the Philippines. She is married to Linberto, a farmer in their village. The couple is thankful, because they have been blessed with three children. 

Pig raising is Neila's primary source of income. Nelia has been busy managing the pig-raising business for 15 years, and she earns about 7,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) per head sold. Nelia is now requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for the proper care of her pigs. She hopes to improve her pig raising business to earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for the proper care of her pigs

loans.name: Barrio El Riito Group

texts.es:
El grupo "Barrio el Riito" esta conformado por siete mujeres las cuales son muy trabajadoras y responsables es la primera vez  que estan en el grupo y trabajando con la institucion, el nombre del grupo lo han elegido ellos porque se encuentran cercas de un riito pequeño que tiene agua cristalina agua que la comunidad aprovecha para tomar.
Esta vez han elegido como representante del grupo a Doña Pilar quien ha quedado como la representante del grupo ella tiene 27 años de edad por el momento esta viviendo en union libre desde hace dos años con sus pareja Alvaro con quien tiene 1 niño aun no asite a la escuela sin embargo le gusta mucho saber que cada vez le hace falta muy poco para que valla a la escuela. Doña Pilar tiene una tienda de abarrotes esta vez ha solicitado el credito para surtise ya que le hacen falta varias cosas, como productos enlatados, leche, pan, huevo, detergentes entre otras cosas. Su tienda no tiene ningun nombre ya que tiene poco tiempo escasamente dos años, el reto mas grande que tiene que atravesar doña Pilar es la falta de recursos para adquirir mas producto ya que tiene mucha competencia y si no tiene bien surtida la tienda es muy dificil que le lleguen los clientes a su negocio.
Nos comenta que la tienda la inicio ya que su pareja muchas veces se queda sin trabajo y de algun modo tenian que empezar un negocio donde les dejara recursos economicos para mejorar su calidad de vida y lo que mas le gusta de su negocio es darle un buen trato a los clientes.
La meta que tiene Pilar es que su tienda pueda estenderse y llegar a ser un minisuper todo esto lo hace para poder mejorar su calidad de vida de ella y su familia, la señora Pilar y el resto del grupo estan muy agradecidao ya que podran invertir en sus actividades, Teresa comprara pollitos y borregos, Luisa comprara borregos, Anita comprara Maiz para animales, Rosaura comprara guajolotes, Dionicia y Elodia comprara pollos y guajolotes.
texts.en:
The group "Barrio El Riito" consists of seven hardworking and responsible women who are working together as a group with Fundación Realidad for the first time. They chose the name for their group because they live near a small river that provides crystal-clear drinking water for the community. On this occasion, the members elected Doña Pilar to be the group representative. She is currently 27 years of age and has been in a common-law relationship for two years with her partner Alvaro. They have a son who does not attend school even though he enjoys learning. However, they lack the funds to send him to school.

Doña Pilar has a grocery store, so she is requesting a loan to restock her business with products she is lacking such as canned goods, milk, bread, eggs, detergents, and other items. Her store does not have a name, but it has been in existence for barely two years. The greatest challenge she faces is not having the resources to acquire more products. There is plenty of competition, so if her store does not have enough stock, it is very difficult for her business to attract customers. Pilar says she started her store because her partner lost his job some time ago. Somehow she found the means to start a business so that she could generate income to improve her quality of life. What she enjoys most about her business is being able to provide good service to her customers. Pilar's goal is to expand her store and turn it into a mini-supermarket with the intention of improving her quality of life and that of her family.

Sra. Pilar and the rest of her group are extremely grateful that they can invest in their businesses: • Teresa will buy baby chickens and lambs. • Luisa will buy lambs. • Anita will buy corn for her animals. • Rosaura will buy turkeys. • Dionicia and Elodia will buy chickens and turkeys.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, milk, bread, eggs, and other products.

loans.name: Femer

texts.en: Femer works raising pigs, a business she started several years ago. She started raising pigs and as they grew she’d sell them. The best way to earn profits was to go to the free livestock markets to buy and sell pigs. Now, she needs to expand her business and this is why she’s taking out her loan amounting to PHP 20,000 to buy feed, vaccine and additional hogs to raise. This business helps Femer because it’s the only source of income she has to raise her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccine and additional hogs to raise

loans.name: Noel

texts.en: Noel is a modest person with a strong personality. He lives with his family in the village of Pulay. Noel is engaged in a hog-raising business that primarily involves hogs for breeding. It is a business he started several years ago. As of now, he needs to increase his business, and this is why he is taking out a loan of 30,000 PHP that he will use to buy feed, vaccines, and additional hogs to raise. This business helps Noel, because it's the only source of income he has to support his family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines, and additional hogs to raise

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.en: Marcelo is 52 years old, and is married to Dolores. They live in the town of Cabatuan in the province of Isabela. He has been engaged in a hog-raising business that primarily raises hogs for breeding. He usually receives an income amount of PHP 7,000 per head. Marcelo wants to raise more hogs, but he has insufficient capital. Therefore, he is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 30,000 to buy feed, vaccine and vitamins for the proper growth of his hogs. He believes that he can improve the business through his patience and strong determination.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccine and vitamins for the proper growth of his hogs

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina is 54 years old, married with four grown children. She is a very responsible mother. She sells different vegetables and fruits in their village. She hopes that someday she can build her own stall in front of their house. She is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy additional vegetables and fruits that she can offer for sale in their village to have additional income to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy squash, eggplant, onions and garlic for her business

loans.name: Ray

texts.es: Ray, de 43 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y empeñoso, además de alegre y sociable. Es conviviente con Delia quien es ama de casa y madre de sus 4 hijos, Jack de 20, Pitter de 16, Clar de 8 y Jamilet de 7 años de edad a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Vive en compañía de su pareja y sus hijos, instalados cómodamente en su casa propia. El negocio que tiene Ray en una tienda de ventas de repuestos para motos y motocarros, además de dar servicio de vulcanizado; comprar y vender vehículos menores de segundo uso, contando para eso con un local propio acondicionado en su casa ubicada en una avenida muy transitada de la ciudad de Pucallpa, donde atiende muy servicialmente a sus clientes. Se inició con un capital propio  hace más de 5  años, además cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja y sus hijos quienes le ayudan en la atención al publico. Considera su negocio bastante rentable por la demanda que tiene sus productos, por el constante crecimiento del parque vehicular de motos y motocarros. Le gusta su negocio pues fue concebido por una idea propia logrando verlo concretizado y viendo los buenos resultado que tiene está logrando aumentar sus ingresos  e ir creciendo como empresario por tanto tiene planes de ampliar y comprase maquinas necesarias para dar servicio de torno. Este será el préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecido por contar con una línea de crédito para avanzar con su negocio, se compromete a cumplir con los pagos para así tener un buen record crediticio. Además comenta sentirse cómodo con su banco comunal pues considera  a sus miembros ser personas responsables. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en su negocio en la compra de un mototaxi de segundo uso valorizado en 900 nuevos soles al cual lo repotenciarà y lo pondrá a la venta. Además de repuestos de motos.
texts.en:
Ray, age 43, is a hardworking and industrious gentleman. He is also cheerful and sociable. Ray is in a common-law relationship with Delia, who is a homemaker and the mother of their four children: Jack (age 20), Pitter (age 16), Clar (age 8), and Jamilet (age 7). He wants to provide them a better quality of life. Ray lives comfortably with his partner and chilldren in their own home. He has a retail shop where he sells spare parts for motorcycles and motorcycle taxis. Ray also provides tire repair services and buys and sells small secondhand vehicles. In order to provide these services, he set aside suitable space at his house which is located on a very busy street in the city of Pucallpa. This spot is where he is able to offer service to his customers. Ray started his business more than five years ago with his own capital. He also has the support of his partner and children, who help with attending to the customers. Ray considers his business to be profitable because there is demand for his products as a result of the growing number of motorcycles and motorcycle taxis. He enjoys his business because he came up with the idea, took action to implement it, and achieved good results. His income has increased and he has grown as an entrepreneur. Ray has plans to expand and buy the necessary machines for providing lathing services.

This will be his fourth loan with the MFP organization. He is grateful to access a line of credit for advancing his business. Ray promises to complete his payments, which is demonstrated by his good credit record. In addition, he feels comfortable working with his Communal Bank because he considers the members to be responsible people. The amount of 1,500 PEN that he requested will be invested in his business. Ray will buy a secondhand motorcycle taxi valued at 900 PEN that he will refurbish for resale. He will also buy motorcycle parts.

loans.use: to buy a secondhand motorcycle taxi and spare parts.

loans.name: Seham

texts.en:
Seham is 53 years old and a widow. She lives in Irbid, Jordan and she is a mother of two children.

Seham is looking to have a loan of 300 JD to improve her house and her living conditions.

loans.use: to improve her house

loans.name: Olivia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Olivia se encuentra casada y tiene 4 hijos a quienes les ha querido ofrecer una buena calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas. Olivia tiene una tienda general desde hace aproximadamente 1 año donde ofrece productos de la canasta familiar, snack y dulces a sus clientes. La tienda la abrió debido a que los ingresos que generaba su esposo ya no eran suficientes para poder sostener todos los gastos de su hogar, y de esta manera ha logrado tener mayores ingresos con los cuales puede ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas para progresar. Debido a que su tienda la abrió con muy bajo capital, Olivia busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de productos de la canasta familiar y así surtir mejor su tienda.

Olivia espera que de esta manera sus clientes aumenten considerablemente, pues podrán encontrar una mayor variedad de productos en su tienda. Además, Olivia espera que con el crecimiento de su tienda pueda ir cumpliendo poco a poco su sueño de salir adelante con sus hijos y algún día tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Olivia is married and has four children for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life and better financial opportunities. For approximately one year, she has managed a general store where she offers household products, snacks, and sweets to her customers. Olivia opened her store because the income generated by her husband was not enough to maintain all of the household expenses. By earning additional income, she is able to provide her family a better quality of life and greater economic opportunities to make progress. She started her store with very little capital. Olivia seeks to access a loan so that she can acquire household products to restock her store.

She hopes that her customer base will increase considerably as a result of offering a wider variety of products in her store. In addition, Olivia would like to see her store grow so that she can gradually fulfill her dream of seeing her children succeed and of having a house of her own someday.

loans.use: to buy household products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Ekhlas

texts.en:
Ekhlas is a conservative woman who is unwilling to upload her photo on the internet. The photo is of her husband.

Ekhlas is 43 years old, married and the mother of four children. She lives in Idon, Irbid, Jordan.

Ekhlas is looking to have a loan of 400 JD to she can expand her sales in her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to sell

loans.name: Noofa

texts.en:
Noofa is 61 years old and married with one child. She lives in Madaba, Jordan.

Noofa is looking to have a loan of 900 JD in order to buy foodstuff to sell from her home store.

loans.use: to buy foodstuff to sell in her store

loans.name: Silvard

texts.en: Silvard is from the village of Arapy in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She is married with two sons (twenty-seven and twenty-eight years old).  Silvard has a college education and has been engaged as a farmer for the past twenty-five years.  She also supports her relatives with produce grown on the family farm.  Silvard is a hardworking, honest person.  She is looking for a loan to purchase potato seeds, fertilizer and some piglets.  Silva expects this investment to increase the family income by fifteen percent.  She is pleased with the services of microfinance, especially as loan collections are conducted in her village.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en: Svetlana is from the village of Arevshat in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She is married with two children – a twenty-two-year-old daughter and a twenty-one-year-old son.  Svetlana has a high school education and has been farming for the past fifteen years.  She dreams for her children to have happy lives and looks forward to being a grandmother.  Svetlana is also keen to expand her business.  She is looking for a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer and fuel.  According to her plan, this investment will increase the family income by eighteen percent.  Svetlana was born in Arevshat and enjoys the rural life surrounded by family and friends.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and fuel

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en: Ruzanna is from the village of Arevshat in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She is married with two sons (twenty-three and twenty-four years old).  Ruzanna has a high school education and has been farming for the past twenty years.  She considers herself a hardworking, honest person.  She is looking for a loan to purchase potato and barley seeds and fertilizer.  Her investment should increase the family income by fifteen percent.  In addition, Ruzanna keeps her debt below twenty percent of the equity in her business.  She is pleased with the services of microfinance and hopes to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase potato and barley seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Sofya

texts.en: Sofya is from the village of Voghji in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She is married with two sons (seventeen and nineteen years old).  Sofya has a high school education and has been farming for the past nineteen years.  She also supports her relatives living in the city with produce grown on the family farm.  Sofya would like to expand her business.  She is looking for a loan to purchase two calves.  With this investment, she expects her family income to increase by twenty percent.  She hopes to keep growing her business and save some money to construct a new family home.

loans.use: to purchase two calves

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en: Ruzanna is from the village of Gharibjanyan in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She is married with three children: a thirty-three-year-old daughter and two sons (thirty and thirty-six years old).  Ruzanna has a high school education and has been farming for the past thirty years.  She considers herself a hardworking, honest person and is looking to grow her business.  She would like a loan to purchase potato and barley seeds and fertilizer.  According to her business plan, this investment will increase the family income by forty percent.  Ruzanna keeps her business debt under twenty percent of the equity in her business.  She is pleased with the services of microfinance.

loans.use: to purchase potato and barley seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Armine

texts.en: Armine is from the city of Gyumri in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She is single and has a college education.  She is a designer of home furnishings and has been in this business for twelve years.  Armine supports her parents and her sister’s family.  She is a hardworking, ambitious person and would like to grow her business.  She is looking for a loan to buy materials to expand her types of products.  Armine expects this investment to increase her income by twenty percent.  She would like to continue expanding her business and purchase her own store.  She is pleased with the quality of microfinance services.

loans.use: to purchase material to increase her product lines

loans.name: Hana

texts.en:
Hana is a conservative person who is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet so the man in the photo is her husband.

Hana is a 53-year-old married woman from Baqa'a, Jordan and a mother of two children.

Hana has a remarkable business. She sells Italian goods. Because of the high inflation in gold prices in Jordan, many of the women are unable to purchase it, especially those who about to get married. Thus, a growing business has appeared: selling Italian gold, which is less expensive. Hana is requesting a loan of 600 JD to purchase more Italian gold for trading purposes.

Hana is looking to purchase a house for her family instead of their current rented one.

loans.use: to purchase Italian gold to sell

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a very determined and patient person with three adult children, from Alibagu, province of Isabela. She is engaged in managing a community based store. To meet the needs of her family she is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy additional products that she can offer in their village so that she can have additional income and provide for her family.

In the future, Rosita hopes that her business will expand so that she can meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy rice, coffee, shampoo, noodles and snack foods for her store

loans.name: Taguhi

texts.en: Taguhi is from the village of Marmashen in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She is married with four children: three daughters (seventeen, twenty and twenty-two years old) and a ten-year-old son.  Taguhi has a high school education and has been farming for the past eight years.  Previously she was employed as a laboratory assistant.  Taguhi dreams of renovating the family home and having all her children graduate from university.  She is looking for a loan to purchase potato and barley seeds and fertilizer.  According to her plans, this investment will increase the family income by thirty percent.  She will continue to save money for her children, expand her business, and help support her relatives.  Taguhi appreciates the services of microfinance.

loans.use: to purchase potato and barley seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Hrachik

texts.en: Hrachik is from the village of Shirak in the Shirak region of Armenia.  He is married with four children: two daughters (thirty-four and thirty-seven years old) and two sons (twenty-nine and thirty-nine years old).  He is a trained mechanic and has been working on the family farm for the past eighteen years.  Hrachik is a hardworking, respected person in Shirak.  His oldest children are happily married and he is looking forward to his youngest son getting married.  He is looking for a loan to purchase potato and barley seeds and fertilizer.  According to Hrachik’s plan, this investment will increase the family income by thirty percent.  Hrachik is careful with his debt.  He keeps his loans to less than twenty percent of the equity in his business.  He is satisfied with the services of microfinance.

loans.use: to purchase potato and barley seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Salha

texts.en:
Salha is a 26-year-old single lady from Al Russeifeh, Jordan.

Salha is looking to improve her family's living conditions so she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to do maintenance on her family house.

loans.use: to do maintenance on her house

loans.name: Abdoul El Mazid

texts.fr: Monsieur Abdoul El Mazid  habite au Sénégal. Il est âgé de 37 ans. Il est célibataire  et évolue depuis 5 ans dans le secteur du commerce.  Il vend des habits, chaussures et accessoires  de femmes. C’est une activité qu’elle  a choisi par nécessité afin  de gagner des revenus qui lui permettent de subvenir à ses besoins personnels mais aussi d’aider ses parents. Il est membre d’un des guichets  de l’U-IMCEC  ou il a déjà remboursé  2 prêts  antérieurs. Il sollicite un  crédit de 300 000 frs  prévu pour l’achat de marchandises qu’il commercialise. Son objectif est de développer son activité de commerce, renforcer  les  revenus qu’il gagne,  pour ainsi pouvoir satisfaire  ses besoins particuliers et  en meme temps  améliorer ses conditions de vie économique et sociale.
texts.en:
Abdoul El Mazid lives in Senegal.  He is 37 years old, single, and has been involved in retail business for the past five years.  He sells clothes, shoes and accessories for women.  This is an activity he has chosen out of necessity in order to earn an income which allows him to meet his own needs and also support his parents.

He is a member of one of the branches of UIMCEC and he has already repaid two previous loans.  He is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs for the purchase of merchandise that he will resale.  His goal is to expand his retail business and increase his income, in order to meet his own needs and improve his economic and social living conditions.

loans.use: to buy clothes and accessories for resale.

loans.name: Hanaa

texts.en:
Hanaa is 34 years old, divorced and the mother of two children. She lives in Al Khaledieh, Al Mafraq, Jordan.

Hanaa is looking to have a loan of 400 JD so she can buy furniture for her house.

loans.use: to buy furniture

loans.name: Kawthar

texts.en:
Kawthar is 37 years old and a mother of six children. She lives in Al Hashmi, Jordan.

Kawthar is looking to have a loan of 700 JD to improve her living conditions by fixing her home.

loans.use: to fix and improve her house

loans.name: Florida

texts.en: Florida is a 54-year-old woman married to Sadili, with five grown children. They live in Alibagu, province of Isabela. Florida manages a store which is located in front of their house. In the future, Florida hopes that her business will expand so that she can meet the needs of her children.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, snack food and spices for her store

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 41 years old. She is married and has two school-aged children. Gemma has a retail shop where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. She has had this business for ten years. 

Gemma is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy shampoo, soap, canned goods and noodles to sell. Each month, she earns about 4,000 PHP doing this type of work. Aside from the grocery store, she and her spouse have a motorcycle that provides them with additional income. Her spouse manages the motorcycle.

In the future, Gemma hopes that her business will improve so that she will be able to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, soap, canned goods and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Najah

texts.en:
Najah is a conservative person who is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet. Thus, the man in the photo is her husband.

Najah sells home appliances and she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase more quantities for trading purposes. Najah is looking to establish a shop for her business instead of working from her house.

loans.use: to purchase home appliances to sell

loans.name: Fatemah

texts.en: Fatemah is 32 years old and single. She lives in Irbid, Jordan. Fatemah is looking to have a loan of 400 JD, which will help her to expand her work in cosmetics sales so she can open her own store in the future.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is 52 years old. He has eight children who live in Taiz, Yemen. He has a spare parts business to earn a living. He has been in the business of spare parts and batteries for different cars for 27 years. He started his business with a small amount of capital and different small spare parts until he opened this business. He describes his business environment as competitive because many people do the same business. He has been able to save his income and he hopes to expand his business so that he can improve his living conditions in the future. He has applied for 200,000 YER from AMB to buy different spare parts for cars.

loans.use: to buy different spare parts for cars

loans.name: Yuldoshboi

texts.ru: Юлдошбой добрый и честный человек. Он женат и на воспитании имеет троих несовершеннолетних детей. Более 10 лет занимается выращиванием картошки и пшеницы. Юлдошбой хочет расширить свой бизнес, чтобы получить хорошую прибыль. Он мечтает построить небольшой дом для своей семьи. Он запрашивает займ для покупки минеральных удобрений и скота. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Yuldoshboi is a kind and honest man. He is married and has three young children. He has been cultivating potatoes and wheat for more than ten years. Yuldoshboi wants to expand his business and receive a good profit. He dreams about building a small house for his family. He is asking for a loan to buy mineral fertilizer and cattle. He hopes for your help and generosity.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and cattle.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en: Amal, 39 years old, is a single lady. To be able to support herself, Amal started her own business two years ago by opening a clothing retail business selling ladies and kids clothes. Now Amal has applied for this loan to bring in a spring and summer collection to the store.

loans.use: to buy the spring and summer clothing collection

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar, 23 years old, is single. She has four brothers and two sisters.

Sahar is a university student majoring in anthropology in a governmental university. She has applied for this loan to pay for her last semester and move on with the graduation process.

loans.use: to pay for her last semester

loans.name: Bakary

texts.fr:
Monsieur Bakary est un homme marié de 28 ans et père de 1 enfant. Il vit avec sa femme et son enfant dans le quartier Faraba de Bougouni.
N’ayant pas été à l’école moderne, très jeune il commença les activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat et la vente des pneus et le collage des chambre à air et pneus. Pour renforcer davantage son activité il décide d’associer à son activité de collage et la vente des pneus, l’achat et la vente des pièces détachées.
Avec une expérience de 10 années, il maîtrise son activité.
Pour agrandir sa boutique Monsieur Bakary décide de prendre un prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter, 30 pneus, 9 batteries, 3 trousseaux de clé 20 chambres à air à Bamako. Il s’approvisionne à Bamako Capitale de la République du Mali.
 La vente se fait dans sa boutique et sa clientèle est composée pour la plus part des transporteurs.
Il est à son premier prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso.
Avec ce prêt, monsieur Bakary compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000 FCFA
Il envisage avec ce bénéfice agrandir sa boutique et construire un autre magasin.
texts.en:
Bakary is 28 years old, married, and the father of one child.  He lives with his wife and child in the Faraba neighborhood of Bougouni.  He did not attend modern [secular] school, but from a very young age he started to get involved in income-generating activities such as buying and selling tires and gluing tires and inner tubes.  In order to further strengthen his business, he decided to diversify his activities and to start buying and selling spare parts in addition to gluing and selling tires. 

He now has ten years of experience working in this field and he masters his activity well.

In order to increase the size of his shop, Bakary has decided to take a loan with Soro Yiriwaso.  This loan will help him buy 30 tires, 9 batteries, 3 key sets and 20 inner tubes, in Bamako.  He purchases his wares in Bamako, capital city of the Republic of Mali.

He sells in his shop and his customer base mostly consists of transport operators.

This is his first loan with Soro Yiriwaso.  With this loan, Bakary is expecting average monthly profits to reach 50,000 CFA francs.  With his profits, he is planning to increase the size of his current shop and build a second one.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan, 49 years old, is a married woman. Her husband owns a grocery store that supports the family.

Hanan wanted to help and to have her own business that she loves doing, so she chose to make accessories from beads and gemstones. It has been six years now since she started and through those years, she participated in a few exhibitions and showrooms where she was introduced to a number of bead retailers. 

Now Hanan wants to expand her business,  add more types of accessories and participate in a special summer market that will help her spread the name of her business and allow her to open her own accessories store. 

Hanan has applied for this loan in order to buy more beads and new gemstones to design more accessories.

loans.use: to buy more beads and new gemstones to design more accessories

loans.name: Majeda

texts.en:
Majeda, 41 years old, is married with four children. Her husband works in a dry cleaning shop. Majeda, on the other hand, has a small tailoring business at home to help her husband in supporting the family.

Majeda has applied for this loan to buy more fabric and embroidery thread to start making embroidered dresses in addition to the tailoring business.

loans.use: to buy more fabric and embroidery thread

loans.name: Shokirjon

texts.ru: Шокирчон добрый и трудолюбивый человек. Он женат и на воспитании имеет пятерых детей. Более 9 лет он занимается выращиванием сельхозпродуктов. Он начинал свой бизнес с выращивания лука. В бизнесе помогает жена. Шокирчон хотел бы получить займ для покупки минеральных удобрений для обработки земли. Он надеется на вашу помощь и милосердие.
texts.en:
Shokirjon is a good and hardworking man. He is married and raising five children.  He has been involved in agriculture for more than nine years, an activity he initially started by growing onions.  His wife helps him with the business.

Shokirjon would like to receive a loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers to cultivate his land.  He is hoping for your help and mercy.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Sandy Catalina

texts.es:
Sandy es una joven emprendedora que decidió montar su propio negocio al dejar su empleo por ser muy mal remunerado. Sandy, con 22 años de edad, montó su negocio de alquiler de videojuegos, donde ofrece a sus clientes un gran servicio, lo cual ha permitido que tenga grandes clientes que le garantizan muy buenas ventas. Su negocio, a pesar de que fue montado con muy bajo capital, ha logrado crecer ha medida que pasan los meses y esto se ha visto reflejado en la gran cantidad de clientes que ha captado hasta la fecha. Debido a que su capacidad de atención a sus clientes se ha quedado un poco corta ante la gran demanda de sus clientes por el servicio, Sandy busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de una consola de videojuego y un televisor para poder aumentar su capacidad y poder atender a todos sus clientes.

De esta manera, Sandy podrá atender todo el mercado y así sus ventas mensuales aumentarán considerablemente. Además, poco a poco irá cumpliendo su sueño de tener un gran negocio con el cual pueda asegurar un futuro económico y con el cual pueda ofrecer a sus padres una buena calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas.
texts.en:
Sandy is a young entrepreneur who decided to establish her own business after leaving a low-paying job. She is 22 years old and has a business of renting out video games. Sandy offers her customers a great service. Attracting good customers has guaranteed her the chance of generating good sales. Despite having little capital in the beginning, her business grew within months and the results are reflected in the large number of customers she has attracted to date. Her ability to gain so many customers over a short period of time is due to the great demand for this service. Sandy seeks this opportunity to obtain a loan so that she can purchase a video game console and a television. This will increase her capacity so that she can serve all of her customers.

As a result of this loan, Sandy will be able to serve her entire market and her monthly sales will increase considerably. In addition, she will gradually fulfill her dream of having a successful business to ensure her economic future. This will allow her to provide her parents with a good quality of life and more economic opportunities.

loans.use: to buy a video game console and a television.

loans.name: Ayat

texts.en:
Ayat is a conservative person and she is unwilling to upload her picture on the Internet, so the man in the photo is her husband.

Ayat is a 26-year-old married woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan, and a mother of three children.

Ayat sells clothes and she is requesting a loan of 800 JOD to purchase more quantities for trading purposes.

Ayat is looking to open a shop for her business.

Because Ayat is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for trading purposes.

loans.name: Ahlam

texts.en:
Ahlam is a conservative person. She is unwilling to upload her picture on the Internet, so the man in the photo is her husband.

Ahlam is a 28-year-old married woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan, and a mother of two children.

Ahlam has a home-based beauty salon. She is requesting a loan of 700 JOD to purchase cosmetics for her salon.

Ahlam is looking to open a salon away from her house to increase her income and improve her family's life conditions.

Because Ahlam is under 30 years old, her loan considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Tariq

texts.en:
Tariq is a 23-year-old single man from Al Zarqa, Amman, Jordan.
Tariq has a perfume shop and is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to purchase more perfumes for trading purposes. He is looking to expand his business and improve his family's living conditions.
As Tariq is under 30 years old his loan is considered as a youth loan.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes for trading purposes.

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha is a conservative person so she is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet. The man in the photo is her husband.

Maha is a 19-year-old married woman from Idon, Irbid, Jordan and a mother of 2 children. She is looking to improve her family's living conditions, so she is requesting a loan of 700 JD to do maintenance on her house.

Because Maha is under 30 years old, her loan is considered as a youth loan.

loans.use: to do maintenance on her house

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a conservative person so she is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet. The man in the photo is her brother.

Sarah is a 26-year-old married woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan and a mother of 2 children. She is looking to improve her family's living conditions, so she is requesting a loan of 700 JD to purchase new furniture for her house.

Because Sarah is under 30 years old, her loan is considered as a youth loan.

loans.use: to purchase new furniture for her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to do maintenance on her house

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 26-year-old single man from Al Russeifeh, Jordan. He started his business three years ago. He was distributing mobile phone accessories to shops using his van, then with his hard work he was able to establish a shop for his business.

Now, Ahmad is requesting a loan of 1500 JD to to purchase new goods for his shop and renew its interior decoration. Ahmad is looking to increase his income and his family's living standard as well.

Because Ahmad is under 30 years old, his loan is considered as a youth loan.

loans.use: to purchase new goods for his store and renew its decoration.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a conservative women, so she is unwilling to upload her photo on the internet. The photo is of her brother.

Amal is a 23-year-old married woman, a mother of 2 children, and she lives in Al Russeifeh, Jordan.

Amal is looking to have a 500 JD loan so she can improve  living conditions in her house. Amal is under 30 years old so her loan is considered a  youth loan.

loans.use: to improve conditions in her house

loans.name: Raja'a

texts.en:
Raja'a is a conservative woman, so she is unwilling to upload her photo on the internet. The photo is of her father.

Raja'a is a 25-year-old married woman and she is a mother of 2 children. She lives in Al Zarqa, Jordan.

Raja'a is looking to have a loan of 400 JDs, so she can buy and sell clothes. She is under 30 years old so her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy and sell clothes

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a 23-year-old married woman who lives in Al Russeifeh, Jordan. She is a mother of one child.

Lina is looking to have a loan of 400 JDs, enabling her to buy and sell clothes so she can improve her living standards.

Lina is under 30 years old so her loan is considered as a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy and sell clothes

loans.name: Rihab

texts.en:
Rihab is a conservative woman, so she is unwilling to upload her photo on the internet. The photo is of her husband.

Rihab is a 25-year-old married woman. She is a mother of one child. She lives in Al Nasser, Jordan.

Rihab is looking to have a loan of 400 JDs so she can expand her cosmetics business which can help her to increase her income. She is under 30 years old so her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Shamyah

texts.en:
Shamyah is 26 years old and single.  She lives in Al Khaledieh, Jordan.
 
Shamyah is a conservative woman so she is unwilling to upload her photo on the internet. The photo is of her brother.

Shamyah is looking to have a loan of 400 JD so she can expand her sales in cosmetics.

Shamyah is under 30 years old so her loan is a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Dana

texts.en:
Dana is a conservative woman so she is unwilling to upload her photo on the internet. The photo is of her mother.

Dana is a 21-year-old single woman. She lives in Al Hashmi, Jordan.

Dana is looking to have a loan of 500 JDs so she can expand her work in cosmetics and clothes sales. Dana is under 30 years of age so her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy and sell cosmetics and clothes

loans.name: Rawan

texts.en:
Rawan is a conservative woman who is unwilling to upload her photo on the internet. The photo is of her father.

Rawan is 22 years old and single. She lives in Irbid, Jordan.
 
Rawan is looking to have a loan of 400 JD so she can buy and sell clothes from her home.

Rawan is under 30 years old her so her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Walaa

texts.en:
Walaa is a conservative person who is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet.  Thus, the man in the photo is her husband.

Walaa is a 21-year-old married woman from Irbid, Jordan. She has a home-based business in which she sells clothes. Walaa is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase more quantities of clothes for trading purposes.

Walaa aspires to continue her studies. 

Because Walaa is under 30 years old, her loan considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Khetam

texts.en:
Khetam is a conservative woman who is unwilling to upload her photo on the internet. The photo is of her brother.

Khetam is 29 years old and single. She lives in Al Khaledieh, Jordan.

Khetam is looking to have a loan of 500 JD to buy new furniture to improve her living conditions.

Khetam is under 30 years old, so her loan is consider a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy new furniture

loans.name: Gulshaiyr

texts.ru: Гулшайыр 42 года, замужем, воспитывает 4 детей. Гулшайыр работает в хлебопекарне и в качестве дополнительного  источника дохода для семьи, Гулшайыр занимается полеводством.  На сегодня в хозяйстве Гулшайыр имеется 0,67 га, где она выращивает хлопок.  В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса за счет животноводства, Гулшайыр обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы Гулшайыр планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Gulshaiyr is 42 years old, married and raising four children. Gulshaiyr works in the bakery and also does field crop cultivation as an additional source of income fo her family. Today she has 0,67 hectares of land where she cultivates cotton. With a goal to further develop her busienss Gulshaiyr has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy cattle. Gulshaiyr plans to invest the income from the loan to further increase her livestock.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Indira

texts.ru: Индира – участник группы «Учкун», замужем. Индира занимается животноводством и полеводством, имеет в хозяйстве 1 дойную корову, 1 теленка и 1 лошадь, а  также 2 га земли, где выращивает фасоль и многолетние травы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Индира обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота.  Доходы от кредита Индира  планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Indira is a participant of the "Uchkun" group, married.  She is involved in animal husbandry and farming and has one dairy cow, one calf, one horse and also two hectares of land, where she grows beans and perennial herbs.  In order to further grow her business, Indira requested a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy livestock.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a continued expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Gulnura

texts.ru: Гульнура – участник группы «Бегимжан», замужем, воспитывает  4 детей, младшей из которых 1 год. Гульнура занимается животноводством и полеводством,  имеет в хозяйстве 10 овец, 6 ягнят и 3 дойные коровы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гульнура обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Гульнура планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья.
texts.en: Gulnura is a participant of the "Begimjan" group, married and raising four children, the youngest of whom is one years old.  Gulnura is involved in animal husbandry and farming and has ten sheep, six lambs and three dairy cows in her business.  In order to further develop her business, Gulnura requested a loan in the amount of 15,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy additional heads of livestock.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a continued increase of livestock headcount.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Madame Fatou  vit au Sénégal. Elle est âgée  de 32 ans. Elle gère un salon de coiffure et  en meme  temps elle  évolue dans le commerce. Elle a une expérience de 4 ans dans ses activités. Son objectif est de subvenir  à ses besoins et assister  sa famille dans la gestion des charges du foyer. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEc depuis mai  2009. Elle a déjà remboursé  2 crédits antérieurs. Elle sollicite un prêt de 250 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de matériels  de coiffure. Son investissement a pour but de rendre plus accueillant son salon pour mieux attirer la clientèle. L’accroissement  de ses revenus lui permettra d’aider ses parents dans leurs besoins financiers et d’améliorer ses conditions de vie économique et sociale.
texts.en: Fatou lives in Senegal. She is 32 years old and manages a beauty salon, and also sells articles. She has four years’ experience. Her plan is to fund her needs and help her family to meet the household expenses. She has been a member of one of the UIMCEC branches since May 2009, and has already repaid her two previous loans. She has asked for a loan of 250,000 francs to buy hairdressing materials, and with her investment she plans to make her salon more welcoming to attract more customers. Her increased income will allow her to help her parents with their financial needs, and to improve her financial and social standing.

loans.use: to buy materials for her salon.

loans.name: Shingimizi Group

texts.fr:
A. Joselyne fait partie du groupe Shingimizi et habite à Gitega. Elle   a  30 ans et est mariée à  Jean Marie, un mécanicien. Ensemble ils ont  2 enfants, âgés de 9 mois à  3ans.

Elle  a un bistrot (vente de la bière de banane) depuis  10 ans. 

Elle est à son quatrième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et introduire la vente de la bière industrielle dans son commerce. 
Elle va acheter une grande  quantité de bière de banane et 3 casiers de bière Primus, à revendre, afin de gagner plus.
texts.en:
Joselyne is part of the Shingimizi group, and lives in Gitega. She is 30 years of age and is married to Jean Marie, a mechanic. Together they have two children, aged from nine months to three years of age.
She has an establishment where she has sold banana beer for the past ten years. 
This is Joselyne’s fourth loan with Turame. She plans to use the loan to increase her capital and start selling industrially produced beer in her business.
She plans to buy a large quantity of banana beer and three crates of Primus beer, which she will sell to make more money.

loans.use: to increase her stock of banana beer and buy three crates of Primus beer, which she will sell to make more money.

loans.name: Kanlé

texts.fr: Femme de 57ans, Kanlé  est revendeuse de produits de mercerie et divers dans une boutique. Elle a démarré cette activité en 1990 pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Elle a  01  enfant de 18ans qui est scolarisé. Elle est à son quatrième crédit de WAGES et sollicite ce prêt pour acheter plus de marchandises afin de mieux répondre aux besoins des clients. Elle veut devenir grossiste et mieux s’occuper de l’éducation de son enfant vu qu'elle prend en charge elle seule.
texts.en: Kanlé is 57 years of age and sells dressmaking supplies and miscellaneous products in a store. She began this activity in 1990 to meet the needs of her family. She has one child, aged 18, who is at school. This is her fourth loan with WAGES, and she plans to use it to buy more goods so that she can better meet the needs of her customers. She wants to become a wholesaler and look after the education of her child, for whom she is the sole provider.

loans.use: to buy dressmaking supplies and miscellaneous products.

loans.name: Hamadoun

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Hamadoun  a 28 ans, marié, il réside avec sa famille à Kaboïla II, le centre ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur Hamadoun après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès,  s’est initié  depuis plus de dix ans aux activités de commerce d’articles divers dont il dispose d’une boutique à Kaboïla II où il mène cette activité d’achat et vente des articles divers (Cigarette, bonbon, allumette, Chewing Gum, lait en poudre, Thé, sucre, savon, etc). Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décide de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est un premier crédit qui lui permettra d’acheter, 10 cartouches de Cigarettes différentes, 4 sacs du sucre, 10 carton du thé, 5 paquets de bonbon, 10 paquets de Chewing Gum, 10 paquets d’allumette, 5 cartons de savons, etc. Ses marchandises sont achetées auprès de commerçants grossistes de la ville avant de les revendre en détail dans sa boutique à une clientèle mixte
  Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 130 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Hamadoun is 28 years old, married, and lives with his family in Kaboïla II, the city center of Sikasso (in the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

After having run several businesses without success, Mr. Hamadoun learned the business of selling various goods more than 10 years ago, which he uses in a shop in Kaboïla II, where he runs this business buying and selling various goods (cigarettes, candy, matches, chewing gum, powdered milk, tea, sugar, soap, etc.). He is very much in demand among his customers for the quality of his wares.

In order to satisfy his ever-increasing customer base, he decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom he is on his first loan, which will allow him to purchase 10 cartons of various cigarettes, four sacks of sugar, 10 boxes of tea, five bags of candy, 10 packages of chewing gum, 10 packages of matches, five boxes of soap, etc. His merchandise is purchased from wholesalers in the city before being resold at retail in his shop to a group of customers of both genders.

Mr. Hamadoun expects to see a monthly profit of 130,000 CFA francs with this loan, which will be used to contribute to his family expenses and to pay the interest on his loan, with the rest being invested in his business.

loans.use: To purchase various goods for his shop.

loans.name: Mayerly

texts.es:
Mayerly es una joven emprendedora que decidió montar su propio negocio para generarse sus ingresos y contribuir económicamente en su hogar. Hace aproximadamente 2 años aprendió el arte de tejer bolsos en lana y otros materiales, y con esto decidió montar un negocio con el que pudo aportar en un principio a sus padres, y ahora que se encuentra casada aportar para el sostenimiento de su hogar, donde convive con su esposo y su hijo de 2 años. Los bolsos que fabrica Mayerly han tenido un gran reconocimiento gracias a la buena calidad que tienen, y gracias a esto ahora logra enviar sus productos a otras ciudades donde comercializan sus bolsos. Gracias a que sigue teniendo muy buen crecimiento, Mayerly requiere tecnificar su producción, por lo que busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de comprar una máquina para coser industrial y materias primas para la fabricación de sus productos.

De esta manera su negocio estará más tecnificado y así podrá producir en mayores cantidades para la comercialización en diferentes puntos, y haciendo esto logrará aumentar sus ingresos considerablemente, ofreciendo a su esposo y a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas.
texts.en:
Mayerly is a young businesswoman who decided to open her own business to generate income and contribute financially to her home. Approximately 2 years ago, she learned to weave bags out of wool and other materials. She them decided to open a business. At first she contributed to her parents with it, and now she is married and contributes to support her home where she lives with her husband and 2 year old son. The bags that Mayerly makes have been very well received thanks to their good quality. Because of this, she is able to send her products to other cities where they sell her bags. Thanks to continued good growth, Mayerly requires mechanized production. She is looking for a loan to afford her the opportunity to buy an industrial sewing machine and materials to make her products.   

This way, her business will be more mechanized and she will be able to produce in greater quantities to sell in different places. Doing this will increase her income considerably, and she will be able to offer her husband and son a better quality of life and better financial qualities.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine and materials to make her products.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Revendeuse de produits cosmétiques et de mèches depuis 2006 dans une boutique, Abla est mariée à un déclarant en douanes et est mère de 04enfants : 02 sont scolarisés. Le premier a 10ans et dernier 01an. Elle est à son troisième crédit de WAGES et veut ce montant pour acheter des produits cosmétiques et des mèches. Elle vend seule et sa difficulté principale est la mévente.  Avec les profits, la cliente pense augmenter son fonds de commerce. Elle veut ouvrir d’autres boutiques similaires et contribuer au mieux au développement de ses enfants au coté de son mari. Elle est âgée de 28ans.
texts.en: Abla has been re-selling cosmetic products and hair extensions since 2006. She is married to a man who works in customs, and is a mother of 4 children, 2 of whom attend school. The oldest is 10 years old and the youngest is 1. She is asking for her third loan from WAGES in order to purchase cosmetic products and hair extensions. She works alone, and is worried about lower sales. She hopes to user her profits to increase her commercial space. She would also like to open other, similar boutiques and contribute to the development of her family. She is 28 years old.

loans.use: purchase extensions and cosmetic products

loans.name: Mawuena

texts.fr: Mawuéna est un homme de 28ans. Il est célibataire et n’a pas d’enfants. Il est vendeur de farines vitaminées depuis 2010 et le fait de façon ambulant. Il s’approvisionne dans les sociétés de fabrication de farines vitaminées et est à son premier cycle  à WAGES. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité et avoir une boutique pour mieux vendre aux clients.
texts.en:
Mawuéna is a 28-year-old man. He is single and has no children. He has been selling fortified flour on the street since 2010. He gets his supplies from companies that manufacture fortified flour.

This is Mawuéna's first loan cycle with WAGES. He wants to reinvest in his business and to one day own a shop, so that he is better able to sell to customers.

loans.use: to buy fortified flour.

loans.name: Gnamba

texts.fr: Gnamba est une femme de 31ans. Elle est mariée à un enseignant et a 02 enfants tous à l’école. L’ainé a 10ans et le dernier 07ans. Elle est revendeuse d’haricots  à la maison et est à son second crédit de WAGES. Elle veut ce prêt pour acheter des haricots. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité et devenir grossiste.
texts.en:
Gnamba is a 31-year-old woman. She is married to a teacher and has 2 children who both go to school. The eldest is 10 years old and the youngest 7.

Gnamba sells beans from her home and is on her second loan with WAGES. She wants to use this loan to buy beans. She wants to reinvest in her business and would like to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy bags of beans.

loans.name: Ayélé

texts.fr:
Ayélé est une femme âgé(e) de 23 ans. Elle est célibataire.
Ayélé travaille comme revendeuse de boissons alcoolisées, de cartes de recharges  et autres  depuis 2011. Elle vend seule dans un kiosque et s’approvisionne à Lomé. 
Ayélé a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits de détails(boissons alcoolisées, cartes de recharges et autres). Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité et mieux se prendre en charge.
texts.en: Ayélé is a single, 23 year old woman. She has been selling alcoholic drinks and top-up cards for mobile phone credit since 2011. She sells on her own, in a kiosque, and stocks up on products in Lomé. She is asking for her first loan from WAGES in order to purchase larger quantities of merchandise. She would like to invest a greater amount in her business and take better care of herself.

loans.use: Purchase drinks and top-up cards for mobile phone credit

loans.name: Martha Lucía

texts.es:
Martha es una persona que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajadora y siempre querer ofrecer a sus hijos una buena calidad de vida. Martha, gracias a estas cualidades ha logrado superar grandes adversidades en su vida y ha logrado seguir progresando junto con su familia. Martha es una madre soltera cabeza de familia de sus 2 hijos, pues su padre murió hace un tiempo y por tanto quedó a cargo de las obligaciones de su hogar. Gracias a que Martha ha trabajado desde muy temprana edad, pudo seguir sosteniendo los gastos de su hogar, lo que le ha permitido tener una buena calidad de vida a pesar de las dificultades. Martha tiene una experiencia de aproximadamente 30 años en el corte y cepillado del cabello, y gracias a esto su salón de belleza es muy reconocido y visitado por muchos clientes. Debido a que últimamente ha crecido a muy buen ritmo, ya se ha estado viendo con falta de insumos para su negocio, por lo que busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de comprar insumos para su salón de belleza como tratamientos, shampoo, gel, tinturas, entre otros.

De esta manera su negocio seguirá ofreciendo a sus clientes una buena atención y un buen servicio, y de esta manera sus ingresos seguirán garantizando a sus hijos una buena calidad de vida. Además, Martha espera que con unos ingresos superiores sus hijos tengan acceso a una educación universitaria que les permita prepararse y conseguir un empleo bien remunerado.
texts.en:
Martha is a person who has always been describes as hardworking. She always wants to offer her children a good quality of life. Thanks to these things, Martha has been able to overcome great adversity in her life and she has been able to keep progressing with her family. Martha is a single mother of two children. Their father dies some time ago and she took over the household obligations. Thanks to the fact that Martha has worked since she was very young, she was able to cover the household expenses, which has allowed her to have a good quality of life despite the difficulties. Martha has approximately 30 years cutting and styling hair. Thanks to this, her beauty Salon is very well known and frequented by many customers. Since she has grown at a good rate, she has been seeing a lack of materials for her business. That is why she is seeking a loan to afford her the opportunity to buy materials for her beauty salon, such as treatments, shampoo. gels, dyes and more. 

This way, her business will keep offering the customers good service and attention and her income will keep guaranteeing her children a good quality of life. In addition, Martha hopes that with higher income her children will have access to a university education that will allow them to find well paid jobs.

loans.use: to buy materials for her beauty salon such as treatments, shampoos, gels, dyes and more.

loans.name: Lassina

texts.fr:
Monsieur Lassina a 35 ans environ, marié et père de trois enfants, il réside avec sa famille à Wayerma II, le centre ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur Lassina après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès, s’est initié  depuis plus de trois ans aux activité de commerce général dont il dispose d’une boutique devant le domicile conjugal où il mène cette activité d’achat et vente des articles divers (Cigarette, bonbon, allumette, Chewing Gum, lait en poudre, Thé, sucre, savon, etc). Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ quatre ans. Il a bénéficié de  4 crédits qui ont été tous correctement remboursés. 
Il sollicite ainsi ce cinquième crédit pour pouvoir acheter 15 cartouches de Cigarettes différentes, 10 sacs du sucre,15 carton du thé,  10 paquets de bonbon, 10 paquets de Chewing Gum, 25 paquets d’allumette et 20 cartons de savon. Ses marchandises sont achetées auprès de commerçants grossistes de la ville avant de les revendre en détail dans sa boutique située à Wayerma II.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 175 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Lassina is about 35 years old, married, and the father of three children.  He lives with his family in Wayerma II, in the center of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

After being involved in several activities without much success, Lassina decided to learn about retail business more than three years ago.  He now has a shop in front of his house, and he buys and sells various goods such as cigarettes, candy, matches, chewing gum, powder milk, tea, sugar, soap etc.  The quality of his products makes him a very popular seller and the demand from his customers is high.

In order to satisfy the needs of an increasing number of customers, Lassina decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso about four years ago.  He has received four loans which have all been properly repaid.

Lassina is now requesting a fifth loan for the purchase of 15 cartons of various brands of cigarettes, 10 bags of sugar, 15 boxes of tea, 10 packs of candy, 10 packs of chewing gum, 25 boxes of matches and 20 boxes of soap.  He buys his goods from local wholesalers in town and retails them in his shop in Wayerma II.

With this loan, Lassina is expecting average monthly profits to reach 175,000 CFA francs which will be used to contribute to family expenses and pay off his loan's interest, while the rest will be reinvested in his business.

loans.use: to buy various grocery items.

loans.name: Djiguissèmè Group

texts.fr:
Composé de femmes mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogamiques, les dix  femmes du groupe Djiguissèmè ont  en moyenne 42 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le village de Zenguela dans la commune rurale de Sakoïba, région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de mariage. Elles font le petit commerce d’agitateur local(un ustensile de cuisine en bois ou en métal, avec une extrémité en forme de flèche et qui permet de remuer les sauces en le faisant tourner en rond entre les mains. La première femme debout à droite a 2 agitateurs en bois en main. Elles vendent aussi de tamis, de condiments (gombo sec, tablettes de cube magie), des articles divers (sucre, cigarettes et boîte d’allumette). 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont  intègrent  Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame, Kadiatou (femme assise au milieu sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de sucre dans le village de Zenguela. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 sacs de sucre dans le grand marché de  Ségou en gros. La revente se fait au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle mixte. Avec ce prêt, Madame  Kadiatou  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et épargner.
texts.en:
Made up of women married and living for the most part in monogamous families, the 10 women of the Djiguissèmè group are on average 42 years old and have on average 4 children each. They all live in Zenguela village in the rural area of Sakoïba in the Ségou region (4th administrative region of Mali) and got to know one another through being neighbors, relatives and through marriage between their families. They sell locally-made whisks (a cooking utensil made of wood or metal, whose end is shaped like an arrow and which is used to stir sauces by rolling the tool between one's hands. The first woman standing on the right has two whisks in her hand.) as well as sieves, condiments (dried okra, packets if maggi boullion cubes), and grocery items (sugar, cigarettes and matches).

In order to increase their working capital, the members of this group joined Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first solidarity group loan cycle.

Madame Kadiatou (the woman seated in the middle in the photo) is a well-established sugar seller in Zenguela village. She plans to use her loan to buy 2 sacks of sugar wholesale in the large market in Ségou. She resells on a cash basis and also awards credit to her diverse clientele. With this loan, Madame Kadidiatou hopes to make a monthly profit of on average 25,000 CFA Francs, which will be reinvested in her business and savings.

loans.use: to buy sugar.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées dans des familles polygames les 4 femmes du groupe Benkadi ont  en moyenne 34 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes  dans le quartier Dougounina de la ville de Bougouni et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de leurs activités professionnelles. 
Elles font l’achat et la vente des oignons à l’image de la présidente du groupe Fanta, des condiments alimentaires, des jus de fruits et des céréales.
 Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 9 eme prêt solidaire. Les huit précédents ont été correctement remboursés
Madame, Fanta (3eme  femme gauche vers la droite sur la photo) est la vendeuse d’oignons de toutes qualités et qui est très appréciée et sollicitée à Bougouni. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 20 sacs d’échalotes auprès des grossistes venant de Sikasso. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, en détail et à crédit à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt, Madame  Fanta espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 95.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et aider son mari à prendre en charge certains besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
All married in polygamous families, the four women in the Benkadi group are 34 years old on average and have an average of 5 children each. They all live in the Dougounina neighbourhood of Bougouni and are neighbours, relatives and business associates. 

They buy and sell various products such as onions, like the group leader Fanta, condiments, fruit juice and cereals.

The members of the group joined Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase their business funds. This is their ninth solidarity loan. The eight previous loans have all been repaid correctly.

Fanta (pictured 3rd from the left) sells onions of all qualities and is much sought-after in Bougouni. She will use her loan to buy 20 bags of shallots from Sikasso wholesalers. Her customers include both men and women, and they pay cash or buy on credit.
